review_content:
0,5 Can from Shop & Go, brewed in Serbia by Apatinska pivara. From can.

Hoppy, metallic, unpleasant. High bitterness. Unbalanced hops. Dry. Not so light. Not so great one. Below my average
Old Untappd checkin, January 27, 2016. Clear appearance. Slightly skunky aroma, but sweet, malty flavor. Tastes better than it smells.

Butelka 660ml.
Z braku ciekawszych piw w sklepie skusiłem się na to - to miał być mój pierwszy raz ze Stella Artois.
Po otwarciu kapsla odór skunksa, który się już nie ulotnił i towarzyszył mi do samego końca. 
Smak: to piwo jest doskonałym przykładem jak ma smakować koncernowy lager. Całkowicie wyprany ze smaku, wodnisty - smakować ma nastolatce, dziadkowi i mamusi. 
To był mój pierwszy i ostatni raz z tym lagerem. Wstyd dla Belgii.

White sudsy head with large bubbles that are non compact. Nose is bland. Some effervescence inside an almost yellow hue  and otherwise clear pour. Taste is not remarkable (by design?) but easy going down the hatch - finish is light. Will not offend, this is a basic beer to share with someone that just want “a beer, anything, doesn’t matter”.

66cl bottle from a local italian store, drinking it on 17/06/2021 BB 03.2022 - 2 bottles of this also gave me a very nice looking branded glass for a really cheap price, really catches the eye. Pours crystal clear golden with very thin white foam on top, drinking it chilled. My guess is that the Stella Artois brand is made on license in different countries, this bottle says it's made in Germany. Anyway. Light malt and grains aroma, some corn possibly, a hint of grassy hops.. slightly better than average with this kind of pale lagers i guess. Taste is really mild and sweet with pale malt, sweet malt, biscuit flavour, mineral water character and some floral hops. Good sweetness, just a touch of hops in the finish. A bit too watery i would say, but easily drinkable. Light body and medium high carbonation. Not too interesting or anything but somehow acceptable for what it is, would really like to try it on tap in Belgium to see how it is.

Famosa birra belga di antica tradizione dal colore giallo paglierino e la schiuma abbondante e pannosa. Il profumo è caratterizzato dai malti e sfumature floreali; il gusto è delicato e maltato, un pò luppolato, dolciastro ma un pò “annacquato”. Il finale è quasi assente. Infine il corpo è leggero, una birra fresca e beverina.

Got this can 500ml 99 THB from Supermarket. 

This can brew from ABInBev Sedrin China plant, I think why this can is cheaper more than bottle version. 

The beer on can version is so watery than bottle version or draught version I drank it, low malt or grains taste from that and also lower hops than too.

-Update-

Tasting again with very cold at 14/06/2021 founded the body it’s clean but coming with a little bit metallic taste, earthy hop, low bitter, a little bit grain taste, low malty taste.  

I think this from China plant is lower quality more than Belgium or European version. 

If you want beer for clean body no headache this one is ok from Thai convenience stores.

Hop is the most prominent aroma here, yet it's also very caramel-filled. But both of those remain in the comfortable zone. This beer is quite fresh and close to many bulk beers (kind of combined with Belgian sweet beers), but without any bad aroma, taste or annoying feel. I think what's especially nice here is the balance between the hop and sweet malt taste. So it's not bitter or sweet, good for light thirst drinking or with some stronger food. Suits super well for modest laypeople like me. Perhaps the one of the best beers after all, because it's not too strong. Although, I think there might be a bit too much "alcohol" taste in it. The appearance of the can itself is not so nice, because it looks like some other beers like A.Le Coq. The carbonation is fine and the beer doesn't feel thin or sharp at all. However, after a while you can see how it's not very carbonated. And it tastes "low", this is a synesthetic description, of something combining uncarbonated, roasted and sugary things with unpleasant taste of the carbonation (not feel).
Can 50 cl. Golden, clear, white foam. Aroma: light malt, a little corn, a little hop with flowers. Taste: malt, candy, a little watery, a little grassy, so-so.

Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień w celu uzupełnienia profilu na RateBeer. Degustacja odbyła się jakiś czas temu.
Instagram/czgr_
Old rating from 1998 - Pint from the tap. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aromas & tastes of citrus, flora, corn, biscuit, grain & malt. Moderate body. Light bitter finish
nice but more of a pricey regular pale beer, very refreshing and good hoppy taste.

Słomkowe, idealnie klarowne z białą drobną obfitą pianą, niestety szybko opada robiąc się nieładna. W aromacie słodowe, lekko chmielowe. W smaku puste, wytrawne, wodniste minimalnie słodowe. Goryczka niska, wysycenie dosyć wysokie.

Pint can. 4.5% English license-brewed version. Pours pleasant gold with a dense thick head. Aroma faint hops and cereal. Taste- cereal, stale hops, dust and grassy notes. Leave that typical belgian vomity aftertaste. Not a clean beer. It was OK at the higher ABV where the alcohol body covered up its faults, this new weaker version is a drain pour. Much worse than the new 5% Tyskie. Lagers keep getting weaker and weaker with more cardboard and dusty flavours.

Draught, half pint. Tasted several times during my trips around Belgium.
[#3.851 Global - #130 Belgium - #4 Anheuser-Busch InBev Belgium]
Clear golden colour with a medium white head. Aroma: Sweet malts, grains and straw. Taste: Watery and slightly sweet. 
Next one please!
0,5 Can from Shop & Go, brewed in Serbia by Apatinska pivara. From can. Hoppy, metallic, unpleasant. High bitterness. Unbalanced hops. Dry. Not so light. Not…
Old Untappd checkin, January 27, 2016. Clear appearance. Slightly skunky aroma, but sweet, malty flavor. Tastes better than it smells.
Butelka 660ml. Z braku ciekawszych piw w sklepie skusiłem się na to - to miał być mój pierwszy raz ze Stella Artois.…

White sudsy head with large bubbles that are non compact. Nose is bland. Some effervescence inside an almost yellow hue and otherwise clear pour. Taste is not remarkable (by design?) but easy going down the hatch - finish is light. Will not offend,…

Got this can 500ml 99 THB from Supermarket. This can brew from ABInBev Sedrin China plant, I think why this can is cheaper more…

Can 50 cl. Golden, clear, white foam. Aroma: light malt, a little corn, a little hop with flowers. Taste: malt, candy, a little watery, a little grassy, so-so.

Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień w celu uzupełnienia profilu na RateBeer. Degustacja odbyła się jakiś czas temu.
Instagram/czgr_
Old rating from 1998 - Pint from the tap. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aromas & tastes of citrus, flora, corn, biscuit, grain & malt. Moderate body. Light bitter finish
nice but more of a pricey regular pale beer, very refreshing and good hoppy taste.

Słomkowe, idealnie klarowne z białą drobną obfitą pianą, niestety szybko opada robiąc się nieładna. W aromacie słodowe, lekko chmielowe. W smaku puste, wytrawne, wodniste minimalnie słodowe. Goryczka niska, wysycenie dosyć wysokie.

Pint can. 4.5% English license-brewed version. Pours pleasant gold with a dense thick head. Aroma faint hops and cereal. Taste- cereal, stale hops, dust and grassy notes. Leave that typical belgian vomity aftertaste. Not a clean beer. It was OK at the higher…

Draught, half pint. Tasted several times during my trips around Belgium. [#3.851 Global - #130 Belgium - #4 Anheuser-Busch InBev Belgium] Clear golden colour with a medium white head. Aroma: Sweet malts, grains and straw.…
Aroma 5. Appearance 3. Taste 5. Palate 2. Overall 9. Malt, mid sweet and some hops aroma. Similar taste, with a hint of bitterness.
The typical light refreshing lager is relatively refreshing, the entrance is a bit sweet, suitable for quenching thirst
Grass natural taste with a musky smell. Looks and pours like apple juice. Oddly satisfying, like a smoother Heineken

A solid overall Belgium style beer. It’s probably easier to find that Hoegaarden so if you wanted that and it wasn’t available this would do in a pinch. A little light for my tastes as I like a bit more punch to my beers but definitely not bad at all.
Bottle said made in Ukaine, yellow to red liquid with not much top. Mundane taste.
A distinctly average beer. Certainly offers a little more than something like fosters or carling, but absolutely nothing special. Grassy notes followed by a metallic finish.
This beer simply did not do a thing for me and lacked unique character.  I'm a general fan of Belgian beers, but not this one...
4.6% brewed and canned in UK, pairing a couple of these with a steak dinner, not bad, bitter sweet beer.. literally, not bad at all though.
Aroma's are bittersweet with hints of metallic. Flavors are like nose but slightly more sweet than bitter. Decent body and carbonation with an okay finish.
Blond limpide fine mousse blanche ténue. Arômes : herbal, floral, caramel, franche acidité et et amertume. Sinon un peu trop sucrée, recette réussi
Can on plane. Typical pilsener, a bit sweet with a medium bitter linger. Not bad.

Tastes a bit like sweaty balls but in a good way at the start.
Then moves into a tangy bum juice finish with the crisp taste of grass coming through
A380 in 40.000 ft. Clear golden color, instable white head. Cereals, grassy, mild & crispy.
Una cerveza color amariilo oro, con espuma generosa pero fugaz, con notas salvajes a malta.

La Pils connue dans le monde entier mais loin derrière Jupiler et même Maes en Belgique en terme de popularité et de consommation.
Elle est aussi très différente avec un goût amer puissant, elle a ce mérite pour une pils d'être très marquée, ça en est même déroutant.
Elle ne manque pas d'arôme et de sensation en bouche mais son goût est tout de même particulier.
Je vais lui préféré des bières supérieures en qualité mais pour une pils bas de gamme elle a son mérite.
A noter une liste d'ingrédients clean avec sans sucre ajouté, présence de maïs étonnant mais pourquoi pas

Smaczne piwo typu Lager. Piwo co prawda popularne, ale przy swojej popularności bardzo poprawne. Stosunkowo mocno gazowane, ze złocisto przezroczystą barwą. W smaku bardzo delikatne, alkohol niewyczuwalny, dominujący chmielowy aromat, bez zbędnych dodatków mogących być niepożądanych w piwie tego typu.
This beer has a strong corn taste and no aroma at all. It might be okay as a pale lager, but no pleasure comes after it.
It's like pale lager in China early years, using decent raw to brew a beer.

APARÊNCIA
amarelo, límpido.
creme branco de boa formação e média retenção.
AROMA
malte.
SABOR
malte, leve mel e final com amargor suave.
SENSAÇÃO
corpo baixo e alta carbonatação.

19.3 oz. can. Pale straw pour with fizzy white head and lots of carbonation. Aromatic notes of salt, some cereal and grass, some funky notes were a little off. Lightly tart. Mild, pleasant, crispy. Not bad for a macro brew. Watery mouthfeel. A pretty clean pale lager.
Słodowy zapach, w smaku dużo zboża i słodyczy. Zielona buteleczka zkupiona w Biedronce.
Always tastes better in Belgium than elsewhere so there's that.fairly strong macro piss though, really.
Pours dark amber. Highly carbonated and gassy. Smell a hint of skunk.Metal aftertaste
Es una buena cerveza, sin embargo es algo aburrida. Color dorado, bastante carbonatacion, las notas aromáticas son muy suaves.

Lager lager lager! Good premium beer that.
Popular and common. But damn good.
This is a well known beer, but tastes different with the meal. Some find it a bit boring others love it.

Value 20 oz pour at my local AppleBee’s. Zero head and lacing. Golden Pilsner look with attractive bubbles ascending to the top. NoseI is sweet and malty. Taste is light honey with a hop bite in the finish. Refreshing on a nice summer evening in the parking lot due to COVID-19. Cheers!
Jobban bele gondolva igazándiból én szeretem az artézit a maga szénsavmentességével olyan mint egy áporodott lepkefing egy tavaszi zuhéj után
Freshly poured in a Stella glass on a terrace in the sun. Just a great well balanced lager, has its slight touch of bitterness, but overall well balanced in lager-flavorland.
Limpida dal colore giallo oro. Versa poca schiuma. Classica lager da supermercato senza infamia ne lode.
Une lager classique qui dans ce style me semble un cran en dessous de la Jupiler... mais bon c'est une question de goût.

440ml Can @ 4.8%. I’m sure it used to be 5% and was derogatorily called ‘wifebeater’ due to its relative strength compared to typical low percentage British lagers and the unseemly effect it had on some young men in the UK. No doubt that is exaggerated but with an element of truth. Anyway the pour is a light gold, not much aroma, a slight malt taste, a certain metallic aftertaste, quite watery, high carbonation. Its poor but certainly not the worst in lager land.

Living in Leuven for some time, I ignored Stella for other Belgian beers. Yet, Stella is a good pilsner that I started appreciating while having a craving for one or two without a headache on a sunny day. Evaluating it against other pilsners, it is a good non-disappointing choice that goes well with pizza and most of the meals. 

The aroma is satisfying. It does not foam too much (unless someone does not how to do it right). The overall availability across Europe and the US indicates Stella's ambition to be the European beer of choice, dethroning Heineken, Carlsberg, or Budvar. I hope it will not get worse as the other beers did (with the exception of Budvar).

Pours a pale gold with a huge white head. Carbonation is definitely significant and aromas are very weak. There is a faint malty tone but it really needs to be looked for. Taste is weak, flavourless and leaves a slightly unpleasant metallic piss in the aftertaste. Texture is thin as can be and as such, it goes down like water. Would I voluntarily have this again? Fuck no.
Water with a bit of beer taste.  Didn't have much  taste to me. Plenty of better beers available.
Birra bionda lager, ideale da bere in qualsiasi momento e con qualsiasi pasto. Gradazione alcolica equilibrata, non da alla testa. Senza infamia ne gloria.

Have to say I didn't used to drink Stella in the UK as it is nothing like it's Belgian cousin. However during the corona lock down I've had to buy whatever I can get! I have to say I've found it quite refreshing! Still looking forward to the day I can be in Belgium again to sample it for real.
Pils de base industrielle. Plus claire sèche et piquante, moins amère que la Jup
0.33 l bottle (5%) from K-Citymarket Ruoholahti, Helsinki. Golden, clear, bubbly, big head. At first a bit grass then something... well, artificial. Nope, this does not taste good at all.

UK can @ 4.8%

This seems a pale imitation of how I remember Stella 25 years ago.

Standard inoffensive pale Euro lager.
Cerveza rubia bastante básica y sin nada que destacar, amarilla y sin espuma demasiado popular para su nivel.
Ubiquitous session lager. Bottle version is better than the average draft stuff. Bubbly, bright, slight metallic taste, but relatively rounded.

Bristande smakkvalitéer då smaklökarna inte greppar den allt för milda aromen. Jag lämnas helt uttryckslös med H2Oviben som präglar min kritiska mun. Ölet kan beskrivas som beige. Men kvällen fortsätter. Och så gör min smakresa. Jag skall satsa på frodiga ipor resten av denna afton.
Sexy body with a touch of skumbad, perfect in a boat outside the icelandic coast
Svalkande och hyfsat god mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm väldigt god i stunden!

Poured from a bottle into a tulip glass.  Light aroma.  Pours a crystal clear, golden colour with a white head that holds well to form consistent lacing and collar.  Subtle malty, slightly sweet flavour with toffee overtones and a slight bitter aftertaste.  Well carbonated and medium body.  Not bad and quiet refreshing.

Rituals. HG loves rituals. Open this up in a glass and the ritual begins. Try and open HG up and you’ll turn quickly to your prayer rituals. Stellar stars aligned tonight. Sound the trumpet HG has begun the ritual.
Uma lager refrescante e com sabor um tanto amargo. Cor dourada e espuma branca.
12 ounce bottle at Beef O Brady’s in Stow Ohio. Light grain aroma. Light yellow in color. Light grain in taste. Smooth. Grainy aftertaste. Just a delightful beer. Cheers!
nic nadzwyczajnego, skunks, lekki diacetyl, goryczka znikoma, do wypica i zapomnienia gdy nie ma nic ciekawszego.
Clean and crisp. Bready nose. Absolutely refreshing on such a warm day. Awesome

33 cl bottle bought from supermarket. Pours clear golden color with medium white head. Aroma of grains, light malt, light citrus. Taste of malt, watery, grains. Light body, medium carbonation, dry finish. It is ok for an industrial lager.
clear golden colour, medium sized dense white head; aroma and taste of grainy, slight sourish-citrusy, as well as cardboard and metallic notes; drinkable lager
Light yellow pour. Very little aroma. Well balanced. Sweet with a bitter sweet finish.
Slightly rubbery aroma. Clean flavour; some malt, some citrus. One dimensional. Enjoy a quick one on a hot summer day.

12 oz. bottle pours a clear golden yellow with fluffy white head.  Aroma is slightly skunky with biscuity malts.  Taste is on the sweet side. Body is light with slight carbonation and a crisp mouthfeel.   Nothing very memorable here.
Light, clean, open, with smooth afternotes.  Not too bitter. A good basic beer.
Clear light golden with low head. Citric aroma. Malty taste with low bitterness. Average standard lager.

Stella is one of the most overrated beers known to man. Not surprising because it comes from the most pussy country of all time aka Belgium. Always remember that even though I gave this beer a 3 out of 5 its rating is still high for a beer that wasn't made in the greatest and oldest country in the world America. next time you're considering buying this rethink your life and grab a pack of frosty bud light limes.
Pretty good beer, not my go to but it has a nice flavor and goes down nicely. Ain’t to strong ain’t to watery, nice Belgium touch.
Stella Artois is my favorite beer of all time. It is just the best. Nothing can do better for me.
Serin koku. Sarı gövde. Acı içim. Asitliği fena değil. çok fazla malt tadı yok.

Linella Market  28 lei - 0.5 l
Aromă dulce de cereale. Gust echilibrat puţin amar, uşor de băut. Un euro lager de calitate.
12 oz bottle. Pale gold with a white head. Grassy scents. Sour hop forward lager with a malt sweetness in the finish. Low carbonation. Sticky mouthfeel. Not my favorite.

500ml can. October 2010
Clear light golden
Slight skunky smell
Bit watery with light taste
Slightly bitter finish. 
Very easy to drink.
7/20 bottle while watching Joker. crisp with mild bitter taste, bit more taste than a lot of lagers

# 270; 3/2016. Velmi nedobrý, nevýrazný ležák. V chuti dominují kukuřičné a maltózové tóny.

Edit 3/2020. Alc. 5%, brewed in Hungary, bottled in Staropramen in Prague. Uninpresive malty and corny aroma. Briliant straw body, thick white head. Strange flavor, corn, cardboard, glue. Undrinkable beer. 0,5 l, green bottle, market, Pilsen (Bohemia, CZ).

660ml bottle brewed in UK at 4.8%. Moderate head, dissipating swiftly. Pale yellow, with an almost green tinge. Grassy, sweetcorny aroma. Low to moderate carbonation. Slight grassy, peppery hop, prominent sweetcorn flavour from the maize, and thin bready sweetness from the malt which in particular is bordering on insipid. The way these flavours play out and converge makes me think it's quite a calculated brew, and I'm sure those that like it will like it indeed, but it really doesn't do it for me. A once in a blue moon beer at best, and only because it does have a somewhat unique flavour. Far better out of a bottle than a can, mind!
Klar lys gul med hvitt skum. Aroma malt. Smak malt korn. Lett fylde. Flaske i gave fra Hilde

Many years i see this beer everywhere but somehow i'm scared to take it because i always thinking was the "Heineken" of "Belgium".. But the truth is "Belgium" hasen't beers like "Heineken" and there was my mistake.
So one day i decide to give a try to this outside in some bar and was one of my greatest surprise for me.. This beer has nothing common from the other "Lager" beers i have drink until now.. Is on a different level.. 
First of all the beer is so smooth and very drinkable.. Nothing can't distract you here.. The taste is bitter/sweet but in more sweet direction and that make this beer great.. Hasen't the ordinary bitter taste and aftertaste like some other "Lager" beers.. The taste is great and smooth but the aftertaste is even better and remind you a classic "Belgium" beer there.. 
Overall this beer is great and good all around if consider the low price.. Is refreshing, it has decent taste and great aftertaste and over the time if get little hot still is very drinkable and that is a big benefit.. The only bad here is the aroma that it smell like a ordinary "Lager" beer and only from there lose points for me.. Lastly i believe "Belgium" hasen't bad beers.. The people there are masterminds on that matter.. Any beer from "Belgium" i have try was at least great.. Respect to them!
One of the best beers ever- although in the UK they have changed the recipe which means Stella is not as strong as it used to be. I prefer the version of Stella Artois from the early 90's.
Clear golden with a two finger wide head. Strawy smell of yeast. This is a good normal beer. Bready and hoppy. So far my favourite Belgian lager/pils.
Why does Stella out of a bottle taste so much different (and better) out of a bottle than out of a can or draft?
I've been drinking this beer for a long time, so I'm just taking this here to keep it written

31.08.2019-- 0.5l can from coop in zurich, brewed in belgium, 5.0% abv. pours a clear pale golden with a frothy head. aroma of biscuit, sweet malts, hay, a hint of candy. flavour of hay, citrus, biscuit. sweetish but not cloying, slightly sour.
22.10.2020 -- very smooth mouthfeel.

Cerveza popular, dorada, con carbonatación media y cuerpo ligero. Aroma herbáceo, con notas de pan. En boca tiene un buen equilibrio entre el dulzor y el amargor, y además del sabor herbáceo y pan, también tiene pequeño sabor a cereales. Dentro de la gama de las populares, es una buena opción.
This beer is the drink of Gods. I took only one sip right hooked me missus and went on a no surrender 3 week bender wif that lads. Crisp, refreshing and absolutely unreal.
Mikołaj Rutkowski is drinking a Stella Artois by Stella Artois Normalne piwo ale jest ok
Sour aroma on opening bottle - reminded me of  a skunk. Tasted rather weak and came back on me after drinking and left the same aroma in my mouth. Terrible beer.

Tap @ Camping du Marqueval, VII 2019. Eerste ijskoud biert op de camping in Frankrijk na een lange roadtrip en het is een Belgisch biertje. 😂 Goeie moutige doodrinkbaar pilsje. Moutig geurend. Helder geel hoop koolzuur met een witte schuimkraag.  Origineel glas

Bevuta in bottiglia da 66. Aroma da piscetta. Colore oro pallido. 
Gusto pale lager.
Fgr

A: Clear gold with a small white head. 
N: Faint hint of pale malt
T: Faint malty profile with a hint of bitterness. Plenty of sweetness.
P: Thin
O: Industry-standard light lager, but with a bit more sweetness than most.

This is one of those that I've had 100 times and I thought I've rated.  Pours a clear golden with a medium white head.  The aroma is corn, grass, and bread, which is nothing special but it isn't bad either.  The taste produces both a mild sweetness and bitterness.  Its grassy and with a floral touch.  Quite bready and with mild cereal and a short grainy finish.  Light to medium in body and with a smooth yet slightly crisp texture.  When handed one of these I'm always slightly disappointed but I'm never offended.  You could easily do worse.
Cerveza casi sin sabor cargada de maiz, sabor neutro, aroma inapreciable. no merece la pena

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso è indirizzato verso l'orzo. L'intensità olfattiva è normale e il modo in cui permane è sufficiente. Il cappello di schiuma resiste poco. La grandezza delle bollicine è a grana medio-fine. Il liquido è di consistenza limpida. Bollicine medio-fini costituiscono la forma della frizzantezza. Il colore è giallo dorato brillante. Il corpo è rotondo. L'amaro è discreto. La forza gustativa è normale e si prolunga in modo sufficiente. Le sensazioni boccali finali risultano di facile beva. Il finale è semplice e dissetante. Il retrogusto è di media intensità. Al palato finiscono indizi di miele e di cereali.

When its cold it is the best beer on the planet for me. And remines me of a cold cucumber.It drinks so smoothly I love taken my time with it . Itsnot a guzzling beer it is a sexy beer even the bottle holds well. I get lots of comments when I pick it up at the store. Or even at the bar when I go out. The beer is light with having the light taste of noting. And your not running to the bathroom all night.
Tap @ el simpatico, Balchik, Bulgarien. Pours a golden colour beer with a medium head. Malty and watery with sweet notes. Dry finish.

This is definitely the best generic beer on the market. TV commercials trying to make it look fancy are a bit laughable but imagine you show up at your buddy’s barbecue, open the cooler, and you see Stella, bud light, and Michelob something... which one ya grabbing? Far and away the best you can do out of the selection of bombers at the convenience store in Someplace, Oklahoma.
this has a nice piss taste to it and the feeling after you drink it is insane

Not one of my favorites, but ok.Stella is officially classified as a Euro Pale Lager, but some consider it to be a pilsner. It pours like most lagers—with a thin, white head and a crisp, golden color. It is traditionally served in a signature Stella Artois chalice; however, a normal beer pint will do just fine, as long as it is poured correctly. For a lager, it is light and is easy to drink.

You can’t say this is a bad beer since it is easy to get...as a pils, it clearly is not the most tasteful one on the market. But again, as a pils, this one hits most of the marks. First, the appearance, I don’t see how you can take points off it other than the dead retention. 

The scent is a bit light...if they use Saaz hop, I expect more floral scent and fragrance in the body. Okay, that’s points off. 

Taste is clear as Yosemite water, clean and crisp. I taste the malt, the hop and the water. I have had some “good” pils, they are alright. I mean, the only way you take points off a pils is when they make mistakes (oh, and you can tell). 

So I say this is a solid beer that deserves higher points than what is given on RB.com now. Come on, people!

0.5 can
C: pale clear amber
N: light malt profile
P: watery, hint of shredded grain, lightly malty, light acidity.

0.5 Bottle Russian production
Golden color, with good foam.
Nose. Restrained, pleasant. Malt, a little hops.
Taste. The body is pleasant, soft carbonation. The taste is slightly distinguishable malt, and a pleasant hop aftertaste.
Good EuroLager!

Appearance - clear pale golden colour with a medium, white, soapy head.

Palate - light body, medium carbonation, low bitterness.
Taste - mostly malty, with some discrete (corn) sweetness, some very faint hop hints in the background and a little bit of sourness.
Aftertaste - short, bittersweet with just a hint of sourness.
Overall - classic macro lager, one that I enjoy at times, since it doesn't have any particular flaws, but at the same time, it isn't great in no regard.

I believe I had this before, but was a while back and couldn't quite remember. So, I decided to buy a 6-pack since I've been seeing this beer around many place, on tap, etc. Was hesitant about the $9/ six pack price tag, but was included in a rebate promotion, so said "wth, I'll take a shot." Almost bought Beck's instead for a buck less, and kinda wish that I did. As I was checking out, I saw the manager of Publix who I happen to play cards with and asked him if he had Stellas. He said he had, and that he thought it was better on tap. Then I read here some comments that it is better on tap, so maybe next time I'll try it on tap? In the bottle though, was semi-skunky in aroma and first few sips, but the beer itself was smooth and had a decent pilsnery taste. I'd say something like a cross between a Belgian Blonde/Wheat Ale and a Pilsner. Appearance is a light yellow with a bit of an orange tint. I guess it's a decent one if at the bar on tap, with not many other choices in the microbrew department. Don't think I'll be buying in the bottle again though. Will probably go with Beck's or Bass instead. (All part of that $10 rebate Michelob is offering on 4-six packs....Just glad to have other choices included)

Stella Artois...the answer to the question that nobody asked. 
Every time I've ever had Stella it's been mediocre to bad. My friends in London call Stella Artois "  Wife Beater ".



Why is that? Well, that comes mostly from its clientele, who have a reputation for binge drinking and violence. Yup, that sure sounds like the crowd that can enjoy a finely crafted, high-end beer, which makes its positioning as a boutique luxury beer in the US all the more laughable.
 


My favorite factoid whenever somebody orders a Stella Artois: " Congratulations. You've picked the worst beer ever. "



As they say: "Stella Artois Is A Disgrace To Belgium" ... 


And as if that weren't enough, it also debases centuries of Belgian beer culture. Belgium is home to some of the world's very most distinguished breweries, including Chimay, Duvel, Cantillon, Rochefort, and Dupont...and Westvleteren, Achel, Orval and Maredsous. The abbeys of Orval and Maredsous are just beautiful.

I przede wszystkim, uwaga, jest to pierwszy lager jaki piłem, który w ciepłej temperaturze nie smakuje jak nieświeże! I nawet ma coś poza wodą i słodowością. Ogólnie jest to bardzo pijalne piwo, jako lager może być reprezentantem stylu. Na minus wysoka cena i słaba dostępność w Polsce. Ale na plus fakt, że jest z Belgii ;)

330 ml bottle into lager glass, best before 6/4/2018. Pours crystal clear pale golden yellow color with a 1 finger dense and rocky white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Thick soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of cracker, corn, white bread, and mild herbal/grassy earthiness. Bit of skunky notes in the aromas that dissipated as it sat in the glass. Okay aromas of pale malt and minimal hop notes; with poor strength. Taste of cracker, corn, white bread, lightly toasted biscuit, and mild herbal/grassy earthiness. Mild herbal, grassy, spicy bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of cracker, corn, white bread, lightly toasted biscuit, and mild herbal/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Nice robustness and balance of pale malt and light earthy hop flavors; with a nice malt/bitterness balance, and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Lightly increasing dryness from bitterness. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy, and lightly sticky mouthfeel that is good. A bit thin, but not watery feeling. Perfectly clean on lager flavors, with zero yeast notes present. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5%. Overall this is a solid pale lager. All around good robustness and balance of pale malt and light earthy hop flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink. Nicely flavorful and clean pils malt/grain presence with decent hop balance. An enjoyable offering.

On tap at various bars in Leuven. Pours a golden colour with a chemical looking white head. It's definitely not a tasty looking beer and that's because it is not a tasty beer. It tastes like a musty basement. It's an empty taste with some nasty tones of something you can't really figure out what it is. If you're not planning of going completely bonkers, don't drink this: it's not worth it.

Pilsner Pale Lager (Premium American Lager)
5.2% teor alcoólico
Bélgica 


Com espuma de aparência inicial média e cremosa, coloração branca e reduzida longevidade, apresenta boa formação de colarinho. Seu corpo é borbulhante e de densidade rala, de tonalidade amarelo-claro.

O aroma é clássico: pão branco e forte lúpulo. Seu sabor inicial é levemente doce e amargo, apresentando moderado amargor no final, de curta duração. Seu paladar é composto de um corpo leve, de textura aguada, forte carbonatação e um final chalky (lembrando giz), sendo esse seu único diferencial passível de comentários.

Seu final é bem limpo e o amargor é balanceado – no entanto, não foge muito da média das Pale Lager.

风格：International Pale Lager
酒精度：5.0%vol
原麦汁浓度：11.35°P
灌装日期：2016.08.30

饮用日期：2017.04.09

外观：非常干净的淡稻草色，色度估计在2左右。泡沫还算丰富。

香气：工业啤酒的酸感，初闻有一丝烟味。

味道：非常平淡的味道，麦香几乎没有，酒花苦味有一些并且有余味，还有一丝烟味。

口感：中等偏低的杀口感，收口较干爽。

总体印象：一款使用大米的国际淡拉格，瓶装远没有我喝过的生啤好喝，生啤有淡雅的花甜味。

Does it have the aroma of Tesco and a basement party at university, or is that just the haze of nostalgia talking? TASTE: some malt upfront, touch of creaminess and vanilla, a bit sweet, then more bitter than typical pale lager, green grass, some metal and astringency/skunk. 500 ml bottle. Brewed in Ukraine. 4.8% ABV. Pours crystal clear golden colour. 2 finger porous white head. Standard carbonation for a pale lager. Aroma: skunky, grain, barley malt. Flavour is barley malt, grain, a bit salty, tiny bitter. Dry palate. Reminds me of a german pilsener of a low quality. Boring but still better than a fukcing budweiser.
Pours golden clear with medium white head. Aroma is malts, dust, old pants, dry. Taste is malts, dry, sweaty shirt, some salt, dry. Classical beer.
Bottle. Pours light yellow. Aroma is lightly hoppy, also metallic. Not much of a body, a bit sweet, low bitterness. Still meh.
Clear golden color, small white head. Aroma of malt. Not very good, but decent, comparing with other industrial lagers...

Pale clear golden color. Aroma is light and crisp. Taste is faintly sweet with a touch of bitterness in the finish. Mostly notes of grains. Lighter bodied beer with average carbonation, It is a crisp light lager with a fresh taste.
Piwo o zapachu slodowym i takim samym smaku. Zero chmieli, zero doznan ciekawszych, wodniste
Clear straw with a nice white head and good pacing. Mostly light malts in the nose with light hoppy notes in the background. Not much taste appart from the overdone carbonation. Waterry and bland.

Gezapft am Flughafen in Brüssel. Gelb-gold, klar, weisser, fester Schaum. Aroma Hopfen, Zitrus. Geschmack: leicht bitter, malziger Hintergrund. nach etwas stehen mehr Getreidegeschmack. Für ein Pale Lager recht charaktervoll.

4.8% can made in UK. Malty lager aroma and taste, bit floral, no weird off flavors, quite alright actually. 

2016 rating:

Clear yellow color with minimal sized white head. Aroma of water with some malt. Taste is same, sweet-ish water. Watery texture, soft carbonation. Still one of the best industrial pale lagers.
Overall-ordinary euros lager. Traducido al castellano, el sabor típico de una premium española pero por 1 eurazo.

440ml Can: Pours a clear straw colour with persistent white head. Fruity aroma with slight breadiness. Slight maltiness on flavour with hints of bread. Finishes nice and crisp. Light bodied with good carbonation. Overall a nice, commercial lager.

Aromat: z butelki słodowo z lekką ziołowością i skunem, po przelaniu lekki karton i alkohol, ale w granicach przyzwoitości
Wygląd: barwa żółta, przejrzyste, piana biała, szybko opada do cienkiej warstwy, zostawia delikatny lacing

Bottle pours a clear light gold with a fluffy white head and good lacing. Aroma is of berries, yeast, and grass. Flavor is lightly sweet, somewhat metallic citrus. Aftertaste is metallic citrus.

Aroma: dry and bready; Appearance: clear, golden pour with thin white head that dissipates quickly; Taste: mostly watery with a little caramel; Palate: very light bodied with no finish; Overall: better than most pale lagers but still a pale lager.
this one is really hitting the spot. smooth and easy, refreshing, light. Not a complex beer but the more I drink beer the more I don’t mind simply easy to drink beer.

33cl bottle. Pours golden colour with thick, soft white foam. Light bodied, but very nice taste. Really enjoyable.
This score is for original Belgian brew. Stella is brewed all over the world, and brews from other countries are usually inferior.

500 ml can. Clear yellow with a medium white head. Light malty aroma of bread and hay. Taste reflects the aroma. Light bodied. Average carbonation. Low bitterness.

A fine commercial lager. Mild sweet and bitter. Faint grassy aroma. Bready yeast.

Overall, not a bad choice on hot summer day. Nice.

Butelka 660 ml (zielona!). Ubogie, jak na tak znaną markę. Wodniste, bardziej słodowe niż goryczkowe, eurolager.

Bottle from Meny, Thorsø. Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma and taste is sweet malt, corn, grass. Watery. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Light bitter finish.

A smooth easy drinking big brewery lager. Dosent stand out as an thing special.
.

500ml can at Motrych’s (damn you, George!). Pours a clear golden with weak white head. Aroma is malty. Taste is malty, hoppy bitterness. Much better then Kozel Svetly, but still meh.

12oz bottle -Golden hue w/white head. Aroma of pine, hay, and run-over skunk. Flavors of nearly the same.

UK version. BB 31Jul16. Poured a crystal clear pale gold with a one- to two-finger bright white frothy head that retained OK and laced OK in rings. Carbonation moderate with medium sized bubbles. Taste of subtle grainy malts and a very slight sweetness; no obvious hops. Taste starts with a slight sweetness then becomes bland and slightly metallic; no real hops bitterness; slightly more malt flavour than the Legere which I parallel tasted. Light body. Crisp, clean, smooth but with a bland finish.

0.5 l can, bought by Miss Vran?i?. Thanks! Clear golden, diminishing frothy white head. Straw, hay, light tart aroma, like cow stable. Light tart. Medium to high carbonation, medium body, dry grass finish, quite bad.

0,4l can. It was the Hungarian version brewed in Borsodi Sörgyár Kft with corn greese. Clear pale yellow colour with quickly disappearing white head. Aroma: Corny. Taste: Sweet start with a light bitter mouthfeel but too sweet. A bit watery but not bad. I’m sorry for the additional corn. Light body with medium carbonation. Long sour/light bitter finish. The original is better for sure.
A proper beer. A decent bulk beer. Nothing too special, but very okay to drink.

500 ml can. Clear gold color with small white head. Smells a bit hopy with grain malts. Taste are little light bitterness with some gain malts and some strange sugar sweetness. Aftertaste are short light bitterness with some metal sweetness.

Klar gylden farve, og har en tynd skumkrone. Mild maltsmag, og måske en lille eftersmag af gær?

Piana dość bujna, średnio i grubo pęcherzykowa, bardzo krótkotrwała. Barwa słomkowa, klarowna. W smaku wodniste, lekko słodkawe, powtórka tego co w zapachu - słodowość, kukurydza, lekki mokry karton. Wysycenie średnie do niskiego, goryczka niska, prawie zerowa.

Cóż tu pisać - słaby lager z koncernu.

Golden yellow pour with thick, white foam. Hoppy-sour nose with strong effervescence. Sweet initially with sour, hoppy finish. I had it ice cold on a brutally hot and humid day. It was very refreshing as a lager should be.

Robe jaune pâle et limpide, pas de mousse. Arômes de céréales, légèrement renfermé. Goût un peu malté et alcoolisé. Heureusement, pas de tenue en bouche. Aqueuse.

12 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured clear yellow, minimal head, minimal lacing. Aroma of malts

From a tallboy at CBP. Poured into a plastic cup. Pours light/pale yellow, same as all the others. No real aroma except for skunk. Moutfeel is light and carbonated. Flavor was, eh. was expecting something Belgian, but no. probably one of the better major lagers I’ve had, but nothing special.

On tap at the brewery, Leuven. Pours clear golden yellow with thin white head. Malty aroma, some light floral hops. Taste is light sweet malt. Average carbonation, light body. Pretty nice pale lager here in the brewery.

This is the Belgian product at 5.0% ABV. Faint malty nose, no hoppiness or spritziness. Medium-light body with a mild bitterness and a pleasant bitter finish. No off-flavors. Nothing objectionable, but just an ordinary North Sea lager.
Une lager très facile et légére. Bu en terrasse à la pression, lors d’une happy hour. Tout est dit, c’est la seule raison d’en boire une.

It was free so I can’t complain. Better than the American macros but that isn’t saying much. I enjoyed having a couple of these after cutting the grass but wouldn’t purchase it. The premium price compared to other beers in its class is not justified.
11.2-ounce bottles in a stemmed glass. Really light flavor, not nearly as bad as Heinken. Very easy drinking. Pretty good for a mass-produced lager.
bottle @ supermarket. pale colour, light body, high carbonated, an average pilsener beer, nothing special
Pours clear yellow, decent, medium white head. Light aroma, straw. Taste is very light malt, some tang which may be hops. Crisp, lightly carbonated.
Where is the beer? A little taste, but too much alcohol for a short beer. This is a product I do not understand how you say beer, soda would say with a slight taste of beer.

Very light golden color, descent frothy white head. Aroma has some strange old grass notes. Quite light bodied and very simple lager. Tastes like any other mainstream lager, maybe little bit sweet notes at the end. Nothing special.
Great tasting beer, expensive but worth the money. I would recommend this to any beer enthusiast.
Companheira do dia dia! Vale a pena pelo preço. Nunca decepiciona. Gosto de tomar na garrafa na maioria das vezes. Mas no copo tem uma espuma bem cremosa e gostosa.

Poured from 12 oz bottle from friend. Served in pint glass. I know should have served in a stemmed glass. Beer is a pale clear golden color. Head is white and thins somewhat, then sticks around a little while. Some thin white lacing on glass. Aroma is light and crisp. Taste is faintly sweet with a touch of bitter near finish. Mostly notes of grains. Lighter bodied beer with average carbonation, It is a crisp light lager with a fresh taste but I don’t understand the hype. Its ok but I personally wouldn’t spend the money for a light beer.

Pours clear golden with medium white head. Nose is herbal hops. Aromas are sweet hops, herbal hops, with a lemony touch. High carbonation, light body. Medium bitter and herbal finish. Just an industrial lager... one of the most over-rated beer I know.
had loads, not rated yet. recalling the last time i had it in prague. faintly tangy belgian flavour. otherwise just an ordinary drinkable clean light beer

Tasted from bottle. Pours clear gold. Very faint aroma that's sweet and some corn and grain notes. Taste is clean and sweet. Perfume, grains, caramel. For a pale lager is pretty good.

300ml cam poured into a Stella glass. Light yellow colour with a crisp white head. Hoppy grass aroma with a clean taste. Good beer.

Common beer and easy to find. Color: clear golden blond beer with medium carbonation and small white foam. Smell: malt and nothing more... Cereals notes. Taste: light body malt and nothing more as the nose. Easy drinkable and fresh. That’s you want for a massive drinkable beer. Aftertaste: small bitterness. Nothing special but obviously the best beer on massive lager commercial beer.

11.2 oz bottle 2/1/16 (Leftover New Years Party)-Pours a clear light golden with a small white head. Aroma of skunk and malt. Taste of the same with a bit of sweetness and Belgian on the back end. This light bodied brew is not bad but not good. It’s amazing what marketing can do.
The least interesting of all Belgium beers I have tried so far. Still a good choice for a pale lager if nothing else more palatable available.
Well it is a lager and it is commercial, so what can you expect, no special aroma, but feels good when it is cold.

0.5 l bottle & on tap - points are going to the tapped version, because it is way better. Nice golden color with a thin, relatively long lasting head. High carbonated and has a malty aroma. Medium bodied with a medium bitterness in its taste.
From imported brewed in UK bottle at Dan Murphy’s Wagga. Hadn’t had this in ages and it was nowhere near as good as I remember. Just average, over carbonated lager. OK, but not great.

Cerveza de apariencia clara em el SRM deve de estar em Los planos nas bajos, una retención de espuma mínima igual que su corona aun que muy cristalina no luce debido a la escasa retención. On tap, this pours a clear golden yellow color with a frothy head. Slightly malty with a little bit of grain in the aroma. The taste is slightly bitter, with a decent grain flavor, fairly clean finish. Leaves a little bit of a dry, bitter after taste.
Aus der Flasche und vom Fass. Hellgelbes Bier mit weissem Schaum. Herber Getreideduft, Grass und Heu. Geschmack herb und langweilig.

Bottle poured into chalice. Pale translucid yellow colour with a medium white head. Very light hops and malt aroma, corn and sweetness. Taste is good, sweet notes and some kind of bitterness, very high carbonation (head stills to the end). Is not great, but is enjoyable and easy going.

Draft pour into goblet glass. Aroma is mild sweet malt with corn and mild cheese. Appearance is clear light yellow with minimal sparkle and thin white head and mild lacing. Taste is mild to moderate sweet with some light hop bitter and yeast--slightly metallic. Palate is light bodied with thin texture. Overall, highly sessionable but nothing to get too excited about.

Color amarillo aroma cereal, una large mas.

advent calendar #5, 0.3 bottle brewed in Belgium, ABV 5.0% .
Pale yellow, medium cold white head.
light aroma, not so pleaseant... more trash than malt..
light malty taste, pasty final with a constant sensation of skunky cheese..
Pours a clear light piss yellow with a big white head. Aroma has some malt with sharp bitterness. Flavor has a skunky funky bitterness and metallic aftertaste. Thin body. OK, not great.

Bottle. Clear pale yellow, white head with good retention. Aroma is sweet malt, corn, slight overcooked vegetables, dough.
Taste is medium sweet with bread, oat, lightly bitter, slight metallic hint. Soft mouthfeel, light body, light carbo. All in all not a disaster, but the flavours are too modest.

Bottle. Insipidly pale with very little aroma, and what there is is of damp cardboard with a hint of straw. Sweet and thin with a little bit of hop but quite an unpleasant aftertaste. I expected it to be more inoffensive (long time since I last had any) but it’s almost unpleasant. Got to be better mass market lagers than this.
Stella Artois (InBev Belgium, Belgium) Overall Score: D - Below Acceptable Standard

Aroma of more or less nothing, appearance a golden clear hue. Nice soapy white head, typical malty lager taste but bitter hoppy aftertaste that I always found unique to Stella and unlike anything else. Refreshing beer that was my first love! I refer to the 5.2% Euro version rather than the current 4.8% stuff in UK now, which weirdly tastes stronger and a bit doctored. 5.2% Stella is a very decent beer despite the reputation of this brand in the UK.
Lager bionda e banalotta, ma discretamente piacevole. Di gusto delicato, non eccessivamente amaro nè appiccicoso, può dissetare in una giornata soleggiata.

Two 11.2 oz bottles at a friend’s house. Clear straw yellow with off-white head. Aromas of corn and wheat. Tastes of corn, wheat, malt, a little herb. Light body with a dry finish. Not something I’d drink by itself but was fine with a homemade Korean dinner and Cards Against Humanity.
The aroma is a little skunky, but other than that the taste was fairly good. a little hops, slightly bittersweet, easy to drink.

July 29, 2021
250ml on tap. Golden clear body. Mouth feel is lightly sticky, body is medium light, carbonation is medium low. Tastes quite sweet with low bitterness and very low acidity. Flavors are amber malt with some corn. Mediocre but drinkable.
4/3/4/3/8=2.2


November 11, 2015
On tap. Pours pale yellow with tall light head. Aroma is hoppy, vegetal and lemony. Flavor is herbal, quite bitter, too sour, citrus, hops, very light malt. Body is medium-light. I just don’t like this style of beers...
4/3/4/3/6=2.0

From the bottle pours a pale golden brew with a thin white head. Subtle, well balanced
 aromas and taste of malt and hops.
Bottle. Can’t believe I haven’t rated this. Golden with a thin white head. Smells a little rubbery plus grain. Thin flavor a little watery.

My favourite pils beer! Drink this one all the time.
The only thing that’s allways in my fridge.

Good when you’re thirsty, easy drinkable and so smooth!

Mijn thuis is waar mijn stella staat!

Brilliant straw color. Rich thick extra foamy 2 finger white head, lasting 2 - 3 minutes and sticking on the glass in a unique way.

Faint aromas and flavors of citrus, corn, slightly skunky with some floral spices. Very faint taste but well balanced in sweetness and bitterness with a little sugary feel.

Light slick body with faint carbonation but a prickly finish. Short and faint finish on the bitter side.

Overall : Too delicate, missing some freshness and lots of flavors, I find this beer a little off. In comparison, the Heineken is better in my opinion.
Tried it several times because I’m somehow attracted to the artwork, but was always a bit disappointed. This is just too flat in taste, even for a Pale Lager.
440ml can in the UK (4.8% ABV). Pours clear pale golden colour with a white head. Aroma is grainy, grassy. Flavour is slightly sweet malt, grain. An average lager.

Clear straw color. Medium carbonation. smells of grainy, light toast. Has a strong aroma, but not a nice one. Pretty dry..touch of sweetness in the end. Balanced bitterness. Goes down smooth, nothing offensive about it, but there is nothing to really like about it either.
Dose Flasche und vom Fass, Geruch recht flach im Geschmack leichter Hopfen wenig herb

Stella is a great beer - well a great lager. But it is so hit or miss. Green bottle is fraught with danger; as is the place of manufacture. The taste can range from a 5 to a 15 depending upon how fresh it is and it’s storage. Don’t write it off until you have had it on tap by the manufacturers. But only buy if a) it comes from Leuven Belgium (not the UK, Australia or other destinations) and b) it has been stored in a dark place with the box having never been opened. 
Appearance is a five - when it is right - beautiful colour, thick two finger white head that holds and delivers lacing if in the right shaped glass. Shame the rest doesn’t hold up to the promise or deliver consistency.
Pours golden color with a white head. Aromas of citrus and pine. Flavors are the same but kinda flat. Maybe compares to a fancy Bud. Nothing special.
Dit bier ruikt chemisch en zurig (mout). De smaak is ook onnatuurlijk en bovenal waterig. Weinig hop of andere smaaklagen te herkennen. Niet zo lekker.
Best Belgium lager I know. If it is well served (WITH A HEAD, dear UK friends ) this is even the best lager in the world.

50 cl can from Kaufland, served in a snifter. Dark yellow to golden with medium sized white head that lasts a good while. Aroma is strongly floral, hoppy, malty. Medium body, medium carbonation. Taste is medium sweet, with a low bitterness, slightly unbalanced. Texture is watery to oily.
Pours golden straw with medium head. Aroma of dank hops. Taste of bitter and mild hoppiness

Manufacturer: PJSC "SUN InBev Ukraine"
The color is golden yellow.
The taste has a fresh, delicious bitter taste with citrus and nutty nuances and noble aftertaste.
The aroma in the aroma of beer felt notes of fresh grass, maize nuances.
Una normale lager da pasto, giallo pieno, schiuma minima, aroma di malto e cereali. Sapore prettamente di malto e piuttosto amarognola.
Vooral overal te verkrijgen in de streek van Leuven. Veel beter dan Jupiler of Maes en Primus.
Excelente aroma e sabor equilibrado, por ser comercializada industrialmente considero uma das melhores lagers atualmente. Ideal para um dia quente de verão!

Candle wax and field berries like ripe ready strawberries. Thin barely consistent foam. Straw sweet and easy to enjoy, there is a distinct enjoyable after taste reminiscent of what beer should taste like, thank you Stella for trying.
From Carrefour. In Ikea’s pilsner glass. After dinner. One of the best industrial lagers commonly available here. With a moderate and nice bitterness

Lots of nice white foam that forms dense crown on this somewhat colorless lager. Smells fine hops and tastes partially malty, slightly floral and have long lasting pleasant hop bitterness with a sweetish flavor. A very tasty lager.
Medium sized porous head, vapid yeasty aroma, Sweet malty taste, creamy vibrant bitter palate.
Draft to plastic cup. I love ticking free shit beer. Wheat, light malt, some sweetness. Light piss yellow with a frothy white head. Taste is wheat, pepper, adjuncts, but not as bad as expected.
On tap. Pours clear straw, dissipated white head. Aroma of sweet corn malts, flowers. Taste of same. Finish is dry citrus and corn. Mouthfeel is light, with mod-heavy carb.

Bottle 330ml. Clear yellowish with small white head. Floral aroma with some graininess and corn sugar. Slightly bitter flavor, light malty sweetness, spicy and corny. Lively carbonation, light-bodied.

Crisp, light a refreshing with a clean taste. Really great with buffalo wings on a really hot day.

This is a re-rate.  I had it on tap.  The aroma was a less skunky than usual. The taste is corn, malt, and faint hop bitterness. It is pretty full and heavy for a beer of this style. I rate it slightly higher than the average American macro.

33cl bottle at home. Pours a clear pale colour with a small fizzy head with low retention. Aroma of pale malt, slight hay. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter with a moderate dry finish. Notes of pale malt, slight hops, grass. Texture is watery, light bodied with moderate carbonation
Bottle. Pours gold, with diminishing white head. Aroma of corn and grass. Taste, horrible.

Pale clear with a frothy white head. Malty some belgian ale yeast hints. Medium sweet with a more than average bitterness for a lager. Medium carbonatiln, watery. Refreshing and honestly a good lager.

Simple pilsener. Golden yellow brew, with a thick forty white head. Crystal clear. Not much to talk about.
The aroma is fine. Malty, with some bready aromas. Hops give some herbal notes. There are also some yeasty aromas, with a bready and slightly meaty character. All is quite basic and not very special. 
The taste is fine too. Quite a sweet beer, both the malts and the yeast give sweetness. The hops are bitter. It might be a bit too sweet, adjunct maybe?
The palate is fine too. Light body, thin texture and medium-high carbonation. The finish of the beer is allright. Has some sweet malts in it and in the far end some bitterness from the hops. All in all, very plain beer.

Keg at The Dyers Arms, Leek. A clear golden colour with a fizzy white head. Aroma of sweet grain, slight lemon, straw and grassy hops. Tried it for the first time at a restaurant. Served from a can. Very amber colored with slight white head. The taste is smooth but unremarkable. From a green glass bottle.

Pours a straw color. Pretty nice head, pretty nice head. The bottle is neat, makes it seem fancier than it is.

Aroma is skunky at start. It mellows out after a while. I smell a lot of roasted malt, perhaps barley. There’s something lingering at the end, not sure what it is.

It’s actually pretty tasty. It’s light, but bold flavor. It’s slightly hoppy and bitter. I think it’s also a little salty.

Mouthfeel is dry. It’s pretty average. There’s some hop bitterness that lingers on.

Overall, it’s okay. The skunkiness at the first sort of turned me off. I think it deserves a higher rating than I give it. It’s okay. I’m not super impressed. I’m certainly not looking to try it again.

Drank directly in Stella Artois Brewery in Leuven.

I guess this is Belgium’s brewing answer for the non-sophisticated beer drinker. A classic Euro Pale Lager. No discernible adjuncts here like with typical meh American standard lagers (Budweiser/Miller/Coors). It is hoppy, malty, and just a bit sweet. Smell is of citrusy hops. It is basically a Heineken with more refined taste and less sulfur tang from the bottle. Plenty of better Belgium offerings (Belgium = Disneyworld of Beer!) out there, but this certainly fits the bill and appeals to the majority of beer drinker’s sensibilities. Good, just not great.

While waiting for a rare 35mm screening of Candyman in Toronto, I walked down King st. and looked for a place to have a few quick beers. 5$ tall boys at The Red Tomato! Not bad. Poured into glass, had a decent size head, a bit bubbly. Pale golden appearance. Good lacing. Good smooth mouthfeel. Well carbonated. Aromas a bit hoppy, wheaty. Flavours are lightly malted, hops, grains, citrus notes. Not too bad for a pre-screener, but will need to try this on tap at some point in the future.

Stella Artois looks nice in the glass, but not much in the taste. Beautiful deep amber pour with a fluffy white head. No aroma detected. NIce mouthfeel, but just not much there in the way of taste -- no complexity. Stella is about what you would expect from an InBev product.

Clear yellow-golden colored, small white soapy head with nice lacing. Aroma is malty, grainy, a bit metallic. Taste is of pale malts, grains, a bit corn and a bit of metal, low bitterness. Light to medium bodied and medium carbonation. From Zagrebacka Pivovara, better than some of its other products or Heineken and the like but just barely.

This beer is overrated and way overpriced, there’s nothing special here. For about the same price you can buy much better beers, like Heineken, Carlsberg, Samuel Adams, Beck’s or for an even lower price, you can buy some American pale lagers, like Schlitz and others like it.

Pours straw yellow with a slight white head. Aroma is a little skunky with a pinch of corn. Taste is skunky early with a ton of carbonation up front. Has a little sweetness on the backend with more skunk. Not bad not great.

An inoffensive lager, don’t read into the hype or the scorn. Bland, yet refreshing. I call it a pleasant beer. Good for grabbing out of a half melted ice cooler on a fishing boat, or for grabbing at the store in the morning to help you sleep after an all night c binge.

Rate stuff for what they are. This beer is for healthy drinking, not for beer-tasting connoisseurs. This is a cheap beer; in fact, the cheapest drinkable among those, unless you enjoy having a headache (as e.g. Guiness or esp. Bud is good at producing) or a bad stomach the next day (Heineken, for one, is way too acidic). This one is absolutely neutral, nearly alkaline. No distinguishing aroma, which is perfect for the smoothness and cleanliness (no perceivable additives), because the cause of scent would definitely affect the taste. Taste and aftertaste depend on your way of holding it in your mouth and the way you swallow. In my experience, this is the most neutral brew in the commercial domain and remarkably clean for that.

4/16/15 (Draft - Finley Dunnes Chicago) - Nice golden pour, generous carbonation and head. Pleasant hops and malt scent. Enjoyed the taste, crisp and clean texture, easy going down, good mix of hops and lemon / floral taste. Overall good offering.

Poured from a 12OZ bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- Has a corn and citrus flavor, this is one of the few green bottled Euros that doesn’t have that skunky aroma.
Appearance- Has a fairly bright straw yellow color with a thick white head.
Taste- The taste is a nice combo of citrus, corn and spices.
Palate- A light bodied brew with moderate carbonation. Has a semi dry finish.
Overall- One of my favorite Euro Pale Lagers, this is getting quite a bit of notice in the States lately. I prefer this over Heineken by a country mile.

Belgium’s best known lager started its life as a first-generation ’pils’ in the twenties - and as a Christmas beer. When its brewery Artois joined with Jupiler’s Piedboeuf to form Interbrew, a company policy was established to keep the latter on the home market and to promote Stella primarily as the international brand, which, needless to say, proved very successful. It pours a clear light golden blonde with delicate fizz and builds a snow white, moussy head with good retention and cobweb lacing on the edge of the glass. The aroma has some corn but less disturbingly so than in many other mass marketed macro lagers (including Jupiler) and supported by a bready malt sweetness, a slight hint of iron and some cheesy and grassy hops. Taste is crisp and clean, corn and bready maltiness again, slick with a slight sourishness, minerally carbonation and a gentle, yet pleasant ’European’ leafy and aromatic (Czech) hop bitterness in the finish, in which the initial maltiness also continues. In all: though just another bland standard lager, this very clearly has a more ’noble’ and refined character than Jupiler, if one has to compare. It has a cleaner maltiness, less disturbing corn, less chemical wryness and more genuine hoppiness. I only know one pub which serves both from tap, but if you were to find another one and feel like having a pale lager, be sure to choose this one.

Its beer, lager, hoppy, palate is weak but good biterness. Bottle, brewed in the u.k 4.8%. Bizarrely this abv seems to be creeping up on a lot of mass produced beer in the u.k. I’m not going to slate this beer any more than I would cadbury chocolates or a ready meal pizza cos I like chocolate and I like pizza. Its a ready meal, cheap beer and sometimes they are the most satisfying on a Friday after work. I like beer.

I should start calling this the “Green Bottle Review Session,” but here we are. I’m going to review a Stella Artois that I happened to find without the case punctured—no holes in it, so there should be no light that has gotten to it. As you can see, it pours fairly nice, as you would expect; nice carbonation with the bubbles; head retention’s moderate—went away fairly quickly, but it does leave a little white tiny head on the top.

Let’s get some aroma here … mainly getting some malt, that’s about it. There could be a tiny hint of skunk, which leads me to believe that, maybe, something in the way they produce these in the factory lets the UV light in them, but I’m not sure. Mostly malt is all I’m getting; I’m getting no hop at all on this.

The flavor—again, I’m getting that undercurrent of a little bit of skunkiness, very tiny amount. I do get a lot of malt, but it goes into a little bit of hop bitterness. Stays pretty malty with a slight, slight bit of hop bitterness to it; I don’t really get any hop flavor.

Get another little aroma here since it warmed up a bit … still nothing but malt, to me. Could be a tiny, tiny hint of some floral hop on there.

Again, I’m getting some malt in the flavor, but I do get this tiniest hint of skunk, which leads me to just wonder—I’m not sure what their packaging procedures are, or how it got skunky, but somehow it did. I can guarantee that package was sealed, or I wouldn’t have bought it, because I don’t need to prove to myself that green bottles get skunky.

My impression of this beer is it’s definitely a lot better than the skunky ones you get—not as good as the stuff I had when I was over in Antwerp. I’d probably give this about a thirty out of fifty. It’s not terrible. The skunk is not really overpowering. Like I say, I barely get it. Not a great example of this beer, because I know it tastes a lot better in Belgium.

There is actually, now that I’ve had it for a little bit in my mouth—I’m getting a tiny bit of paper. I should have checked the date on that one. I don’t have the box anymore, but I don’t believe it was out of date. One thing to look out for is—when you’re buying beer, especially beers that you don’t want to age, if they have a date on them, and most European beers will have that, just make sure it’s not expired. The closer you get to fresh, the better.

I’d basically say it’s drinkable, but certainly not like I remember it. Again, green bottle beer is terrible. I wish these marketing people would get that in their thick heads and let the brew masters tell them, “We don’t want any more green bottles.” They look stupid. Everybody knows now in America that green beer sucks, so let’s start putting your good beer in a good container.

Review: Can of Stella Artois Pilsner Beer 5.2%ABV
Stella Artois is a nice clean and easy to drink beer, perfect to bring along for a party since its a beer that everyone can drink and enjoy. 

The appearance was perfectly clear of a nice yellow colour, with a good sized white head and some decent lacing. It’s certainly looks the part. 

The aroma was nice and sweet but faint, smelling of a malty and hoppy smell.

Stella Artois had a nice crisp and refreshing taste to it which I found very easy to drink, was clean tasting with with no real offensive flavours. It is a very sweet grainy beer yet smooth enough to enjoy. A great session beer with your mates, light and very drinkable, an absolutely beautiful Belgian lager beer.

It has a nice light golden color with very good clarity and a good amount of visible champaign like carbonation. On top it forms a big fluffy head that slowly settles and leaves very little to no lace. The aroma has a delicate floral and grassy nose. It has a delicate flavor as well as its aroma. There is a mild sweetness that is balanced by light floral, almost fruity and mildly bitter hops. This mild flavor can become skunked very easily so look for as fresh a sample as possible. Its body is light and the finish is crisp and dry. The texture is slightly slick and thin with lively carbonation that makes it very easy to drink

Transfer from BA review on 5-5-12- 
Poured from bottle into pint glass

Appearance – Pours a golden color with a huge billowing white head with giant carbonation bubbles entrapped within. The head has a moderate retention but eventually subdues to give a good level of lacing. It is actually a very nice looking golden brew.

Smell – There is a bready backbone with a little bit of skunkiness mixed within.

Taste – Quite a simple crisp tasting beer overall. The taste of a bit of malty breadiness with some light notes of caramel to sweeten it up. The taste is quite consistent for the most part, but possibly a bit sweeter at the end.

Mouthfeel – Medium bodied with a medium level of carbonation. Very easy to drink and good for the style, but somewhat boring.

Overall – Pretty one dimensional but very easy to drink.

Bottle. Clear pale yellow pour with a white head. Skunky aroma with sweet corn and grains. Flavour is grainy with light bitter hops. Very plain.

Chilled and presented in a fine lager glass this was a picture. Sweet malt with a strong alcohol presence. This isn’t nick named "wife beater" for nothing. The hop presence is subtle and not something to sing about but nevertheless an enjoyable pint. Keg at the Arisaig Hotel with Stuart.

So the paper covering the cap is supposed to make me think this is a fancy beer. For what it is I guess it is decent, but not worth the price. Pours light gold with little head, no retention, no lacing. Nearly nonexistent aroma, light grain(corn) and slight grass. This is kind of like the Miller or Budweiser of Belgium, but a little cleaner and a little more distinct. Taste is sweet grain with a slight hop presence and mineral flavors. I did get some metallic aftertaste. Light body, thin texture, fizzy carbonation, and sweet finish. I prefer full bodied ales, this is not my style of choice.

Clear golden-yellow colour with a small whitehead. Pretty watery with a sweet grassy flavour followed by a bitter metallic aftertaste. Terrible, barely drinkable and overpriced. Stella used to be almost decent beer and now it is trash.
Tap, despite the sexy commercials, this beer is not very good. It is a clear gold, with a white head, very watery and has a bitter finish.
Clear golden-yellow colour with a small white rocky/frothy head. Quite watery with a sweet grassy flavour followed by a bitter hopsy aftertaste. Not terrible for a macrobrew but below average

Color dorado claro, cabeza blanca, larga, tersa que deja muy bonito encaje. Aroma a malta, lúpulo y zorrillo. Alta carbonatación, fresca en boca, amargor lijero y adecuado. Muy buena para una lagger, y no me gustan las lagger.
Yellow towards golden with white foam. Mild aroma sour malt with a hint of hay. Mild malt, with stronger dry bitter aftertaste where there are clear malt tones. High in carbon.

Good head retention with some lacing. Malt, corn, cereal and some floral hops. Not bad. Miss more hops.

Pours pale yellow with lots of bubbles and bright white head. Aroma is skunk city. When I popped the top my entire living room smelled like a skunk. Disgusting. Meh. I’ll take a generic Caribbean pale lager over this "fancy" one any day. Makes people feel more cultured to drink it, I guess.

Love, love, love Stella Artois. The aroma has some floral hints to it as well as a very malty nose. The taste is light and fruity without being sickly sweet, very crisp with a bit of a bitter aftertaste. Good from the bottle, better from the tap.

Fruity, syrupy, alcohol, strong tasting. Czech version made in Smichov. Very overpriced and not so great, but not terrible. Cannot compare with local Czech beers. And what’s with the doily they put on the bottom of your glass.

Bottle pour. Pale yellow with thick head. Good lacing. The aroma is corn chips, with undertones of skunked piss. Taste is rice, stale crackers and vague sweetness. Light and unenjoyable. For the price, it is hard to buy a worse beer. The rare straight 3s.

It isn’t terrible. I’ve had terrible beer, and this beer is not terrible. It pours a fizzy, bright, clear yellow. Maybe they’re using candy corn. I don’t know. I do know that I finished the glass, and I can’t say that about some micro-brews, so there’s that. The bottle is 11.2 ounces instead of 12. I’m not sure why. Maybe they’re skimping to pay for the extra paper on the neck of the bottle.

I had to. This shit sells, no joke. It moves enough for me to decide that it needs a five block just so it wouldn’t sellout on a god damn Monday morning in February. The clientele is specific… yuppies and other well to do’s. Carlo Franco seven fold ties, dress shirts by Ike Behar and customized Maybach’s. We would get this trash in by the skid. American Eagle would roll up with a couple of 18 wheelers and I would unload some 500 cases of Stella without thinking twice. This is Stella Artois, the Patrick Bateman crowd. It smells of beer on the nose and resembles dehydrated piss whilst in the glass. No foam…no head. On the sip one imagines skunked PBR. While refreshing it does remind you that you paid some 15 dollars for 12 beers that by the way are only 11 OZ a piece. This is for the Wall Street material, Sacks Fifth Ave junkies and for all the other over paid 20 year olds who had it all served to them on silver trays.

Bottle poured into Pint glass, Best By: November 2014 Pours a golden yellow, very little opacity, two finger frothy white head that dissipated relatively quickly. Inconsistent lacing that mostly slides down back into the beer with immediacy. Grassy aroma, not particularly pleasing. Has an odd bite right as it hits your tongue that gives way with haste to a sweeter malty taste, more flavorful than anticipated but there’s still not much to it. Mostly corn. Very light body, almost like water. Overall, it’s a very drinkable beer that would serve well for high temperatures or during/after heavy physical activity, but there’s no reason to go back to it for the enjoyment of drinking it. It serves it’s purpose, and doesn’t do much else.

Poured golden pale clear color with 1-to-2 fingers of frothy white head. Below average lacing along the sides of the glass. Above average amount of white retention all the way down.

Smelled bread, cereal, hay, corn, Belgian spices, peppery spices and a tad bit of caramel. 

Tasted similar to the taste, although I would argue not quite as good. Tasted bread, hay, cereal and corn mainly. Spices weren’t as potent as the nose. Move Belgian skunky spices than anything else. 

Light body. Thin texture. Average carbonation. Watery, abrupt finish.

A lot better than I remember it. Nothing spectacular about this beer, but for the style, which I’m still pretty new to, it’s not too bad.

Quite simply the best. I first drank Stella on a working holiday in France when I was just eighteen. Ever since it has had a wonderfully nostalgic quality, Almost like the smell of fresh cut grass or a favorite childhood place, the first sip always transports me back to that scorching summer spent idling away in the sands and fields of Northern Brittany.

Serving type: 12 ounce bottle poured into a pokel glass.

Appearance: Poured a clear golden yellow with a nice white bubbly foam. About 1 fingers worth. Some carbonation visible. Light fizzy lacing was left as I drank the beer.

Aroma: Very yeasty. A little bit pungent to the nose.

Taste: Yeasty first and then some light hop bitterness. Maybe a little piney taste.

Palate: More than light but not really medium bodied. A little oily actually as there is some lingering taste in my mouth. Feels like something has coated the roof of my mouth.

Over all: This isn’t a bad beer but it is not great. It has more flavor and pop than most of the American macros. That is a personal taste. When I have a beer I like it to have something going on and this beer has a little to offer that way. Given a choice between this and a Budweiser I would choose this.

Bière jaune pâle tirant sur le vert, incroyablement limpide, effervescence moyenne-faible, surmontée d’un bon col blanc immaculé, mousseux et dense, et laissant une belle dentelle sur les parois du verre. Arômes de malt pâle, grain et pain frais, accompagné d’un houblon principalement herbacé. Aussi, cette bière importée en «belle bouteille verte» est particulièrement susceptible de développer des odeurs de mouffette (il vaut vraiment mieux privilégier la cannette!). Si on fait abstraction de la mouffette, le nez est surtout herbacé et tout de même assez intéressant, mais il manque franchement de complexité et d’intensité. En bouche, pétillement moyen sur la langue, onctuosité moyenne au palais. Au goût, c’est vraiment plus malté (et intéressant!) que le nez laissait présager, grain légèrement rôti, pain un peu grillé, pointe de noisette même. La bière est également légèrement sucrée, douce, présentant certaines saveurs de sucre d’orge et de miel, avant de présenter une amertume intéressante à la fois légère et tranchante aux accents de houblon bien herbacé et légèrement citronné. Goût vraiment très bien pour le style, complexité et intensité significativement supérieures en bouche par rapport au nez. Bonne bière de soif, mais c’est tout juste correcte sur la plan de la dégustation…
Pours a clear yellow-straw with lots of bubbles. Nose is skunky. Taste is skunky with little to no hopping. Palate is lively and watery. Overall a not my favorite draught.

A beloved friend of mine came over from California and I took him to one of my favourite Yorkshire places. He spurned the whisky and the Timothy Taylor’s for a Stella. I was a bit upset that he’d come over here and have something so mass-produced when we’re back into some golden age for brewing real ales in the UK.

He took the term "real ale" as a "No True Scotsman" fallacy and thought I was putting down his beloved Stella for some artificially valued "realness," so I had to explain to him that it was a lot like craft beer in the USA, independently-brewed to a method I don’t quite understand which classifies it as a real ale, like how real cider is basically actually made from fruit rather than radon. Unfortunately I couldn’t get through to him, and things were dampened somewhat until we met up with another friend who came up with the perfect analogy for it. It was like your girlfriend telling you she was into philosophy, and you going "Ah! Who do you like then?" and her going "Oh, Kurt Cobain, Jim Morrison."

Stella Artois is to beer what Kurt Cobain is to philosophy.

Crystal clear golden color with tall frothy white head.  Smells like - well a European pale lager.  Taste - Sweet corny malt, grassy hops and subtle fruity and floral notes.  Clean, crisp, attractive and refreshing.  An above average pale lager.

Aroma:  Nothing, absolutely nothing.  Appearance:  Doesn’t get a whole lot better than that I guess, but really shows that you can’t judge a book by its cover, or in this case you can’t polish a turd I guess.  Taste:  Skunk, this beer is the king of skunk, it’s so skunky that I feel like a need a tomato bath afterwards.  Other than that the carbonation turns it into a mess of bubbles before you can even swallow.  Best kept for washing out the taste of bad food.  Palate:  Fine initially, but that bubble storm I mentioned earlier ends any pleasure you might have had extraordinarily quickly.  Overall: Really bad, don’t drink it unless you absolutely have nothing better, and frankly that’s a rather large category.

Not sure but I’ll try.
Decent lager. Not much of an aroma. Flavor is mild tastes like almost any lager. Like many beers in green bottles has an unfortunate yet light skunky taste.

Goes down smooth, no strong aroma like some beers and the bottle is pretty sleek. Not quite the same ounces as a regular beer but it’s one of those beers that would be nice to have on special occasions or relax on the weekends.

Bottled, 0.33l. Clear golden color, frothy white head and lively carbonation. Aroma of herbal hops, grainy malt, cardboard with some skunky notes, too Sweet and rich malty start is followed by crisp finish. Mouthfeel is more on a bland side with mild bitterness in the aftertaste. Medium body, thin texture and lively carbonation in palate. My first Belgian disappointment, luckily quite rare...
Pours pale yellow. No head. Pale malt, grass and light citrus flavors. Pale lager indeed...it’s pale.
Very boring beer. Tastes like water. Tiny white head, barely any hops and the small taste that there is to find disappears quickly. Overpriced and overrated.

Poured my own from the tap into a branded 330ml chalice.
Clear straw color with a nice fluffy white head.
Fresh bread aroma, mild corn, ,mellow noble hops.
Relatively clean malt flavor with some adjunct notes, low bitterness.
Light bodied, short and not dry enough finish, decent when fresh.
A pretty streight forward pale lager. A bit more bitterness and sweet flavor than usual for a pale lager, but all in all somewhat boring. Amber in color with a white head.
330 ml bottle. Pours a yellow gold with medium head. Aroma of cereal. Slightly skunky. Tastes the same. Light bitter finish.
A friend of mine once described this as The Bud Light of Europe... and that’s probably accurate (having never gone to Europe myself). But I loath Bud and I can still drink copious amounts of this.
