Bottle bought at the local Tesco and shared with MichaelBruch. Clear light golden colour with a strong head. Sweetisch taste of mild citrus fruits, biscuits and sunshine. Nice one.

Bottle shared with McTapps. After years of UK visits I finally tried it and it turned out as a nice, bit sweetish lager. Coming in golden colour with a smaller head. Aroma was hops and bit malty with sweets. Extremely refreshing, easy drinkable and way better than I though. Surprisingly huge.
Almost no head with a pale golden color. Not bad with a meal but could be a little weak on its own.
Not a fan of lagers but this one is quite good. Nice bright color, no bad aftertaste. Not bad at at all

Draft in Odessa. Clear gold with thick and lacey head. Aroma is sweet and grainy with decent malt character. The finish is too sticky-sweet snd cloying, needs a crisper hoppier finish to be good. Macro swill but drinkable.

Seemed like an easily drinkable beer at first. Awkward, corn/hoppy aftertaste killed the initial fresh, crisp taste. Would not get again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle, pours clear yellow with no head and small amount of carbonation. Some cheesy yeast on the nose, but not much. Tastes yeasty, citrus hops, not very much on the palate. An alright mainstream lager.

Aroma: grain, floral. Appearance: pours a light yellow with a large, rapidly diminishing rocky white head with some lacing noted. Taste: sweat malt, grain slight hop bitterness. Mouthfeel: medium bodied and medium carbonation. Overall: ok I would drink it again, but it's not a "go to" beer for me.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Brass Tap Trinity.  Poured into Stella chalice with a clear golden color and a foamy white head.  Fairly typical Euro lager aroma and flavor with a sweet grain emphasis and a touch of hop bitterness in the finish.  Not bad, but far from great.

Bottle.  Typical clear yellow, fizzy with small head.  Heavy, headache-inducing metallic taste with a short finish.  Bitter water.  There is no reason to ever drink this - it is too strong to be a barbeque beer so if you want a tasteless summer lager there are plenty in the 4%-4.5% range.
Large head, white, creamy, clear, light golden, mostly diminishing, malty grainy aroma. Tastes like beer. Light body.

Bottle. Pours a clear gold with nice fluffy white head. Aroma of malts, and a bit of fruity hops, some grape. Flavor is crisp but there’s not much complexity to it. Not bade for a pale lager, but not great.
Pours white not lasting head, nice golden color, aroma of some malt, light hops, cereal, taste is a bit sweet, very light bitterness. Well balanced.
Average taste you would expect out of the big three only slightly more flavor. This beer held a decent quarter finger through most of a sitting.  Not overly impressive or boring in either's entirety.

This beer is very mild without many defining characteristics. It is a pretty standard lager. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours Pale yellow, a ton of skunk on the nose... Real crisp and light, but not too much flavor...
Na ausência da heineken, esta consegue suprir as carências. Boa para localizar com amigos
Hoppy, grassy aroma. Pours with a thick white head. Golden color. Lightly carbonated, taste of grain and hops, slIghtly I am bitter. Average pale lager

I can enjoy a Stella from time to time, but it is certainly not my go to beer of pale lagers. It’s far too expensive for that. Not enough bang for your buck. Smooth and easy drinking beer that’s a bit above average for its class, but there are better beers in the price range.

Happy international beer day. Pours a typical yellow lager color with a thick white head and decent lacing. Smells of malt and grass. Tastes like a typical pale lager with a slight sweetness. Not much on the mouthfeel. Overall its a light refreshing import beer for a warm summer day which was what I was looking for but its nothing special.

I got this at a work conference networking reception in Chicago.  It tastes like watered down Heineken and has that skunk smell going on.  Clear yellow appearance, bubbly. It’s light and refreshing and may be good to drink after, or maybe even during exercise.  I wasn’t exercising at the time though, so I got bored with it and only drank half the 12 ounce bottle before throwing it out.  Note how bad the competition in the "pale lager" style category must be when a beer rated sub-20 out of 100 overall is still 91 out of 100 among its style.
Can. Poured golden with a thin white head. Very subdue aroma and flavor of grain and corn. Light body. Crisp.

Light grassy/hay nose....pours a beautiful light gold. Nice carbonation. The taste is light and very light at that. Nothing special but tasty and very refreshing. It was a hot one today (over 100*) and this hits the spot. Not great but it has It’s place. I’m rather enjoying it.
Bottled. Pours pale yellow with a big white head. Smells and tastes sweet bread malty, abit bitter and watery.
Yellow lager colour, white foam. Strong metallica smell. Pleasant feeling on tongue. Taste bitter, grains. Ok drinkable beer.

Slightly sweet aroma has hay and bit hoppiness in background. pale, minimal head. Taste is plain and minimal.light body, flat, soft. Sigh.. not much aroma or flavor here..this beer has social fobia. it definetely does not want to stand out.
Bottle. Served well chilled. Pours a very light golden colour, weak aroma, the taste has a touch of bitterness, with hint if citrus, with a light crisp finish.
Aroma is extremely lacking.  Taste is way too light and a bit skunky. I’ll drink it in a pinch.
Cheap smell and color. I’ve had this several times but decided to rate it this time....Not particularly smooth for a cheap beer, all around just bad.
Well, this is your standard pale lager. Light and refreshing and that’s pretty much it for this one...
The standard beer, just pretty much average in every way however it is good and strong, a healthy 5% which is better an other standard lagers.

This is a good crisp lager with a nice munich style malt.  Although it is a lager there appears to be a nice belgian yeast profile present to compliment the subtle bready malt.  Carbonation is perfect and there is a slight earthy hop presence as well.  This is a well made beer.

33 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Albert Heijn. Pale yellow with a white head. Grainy aroma with a hint of freshly mowed grass. thin grainy hoppy taste. Crispy pilsener with lively carbonation and a mild aftertaste.
among all the regular lagers, stella artois is very good. not so much bitterness, nice aroma of hops and malts and very smooth. it’s not a special beer, but it’s definitely a nice drinking one.
Being of belgian decent i always try to taste a belgian beer when i come across it. Stella is a nice refreshing lager that is a nice beer to be able to enjoy at a bar or at home.
Stella is my go-to favorite beer that is usually at any bar. I was so bummed when I heard it associated with Anheuser-Busch. So much for years of tradition. I still love it, but I also resent it.
Hade den här varit spansk hade jag kallat den för överraskning, nu är den belgisk och jag blir besviken. Det finns inte mycket som minner om belgiska smakämnen här inte. Dricks med fördel på balkong.
Bottle. Clear yellow colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of malt and hops.

Draught @ La Michele, Onesti.

Clear liquid, pale golden colour, long white head.

Aroma has notes of malt, hops, honey, belgian yeast.

Medium body, average carbonation, sweet taste, astringent finish, bittersweet aftertaste.

Tasty and not bad. Better exists out there but when at Round Table, this fats much better than Bud. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
The beer impressed me as I typically do not like bitter beers. As a higher end beer I was not impressed with the taste. It was average, but not bad. Forgettable.
The taste of acid stays in your mouth even after you brush the teeths 3 times. Very strong for a normal pilsen, is just more convenient cause is easier to find in 24h stores.
On draft. Looks fine; light with decent carbonation. Smell is very mild, but pleasant. Tastes good for what it is. Easy to drink with a decent mouthfeel. Better than it’s scores suggest.
Good lager. Very floral with a strong aftertaste. Worth trying. The head is very full.
One of my favorite beers out there. I was lucky enough to be at a wedding that had this at an open bar!!! Oh yeah!!
Good for a light beer. Nice bottle. Amanda likes it. What else can I say about a boring light lager its good

Pours a clear golden yellow with dissipating white head and little lacing. Aroma of grains, corn, and mediocre ester. Taste is like most pale lagers, but slightly cleaner and smoother. A nice spacer beer when drinking lots of dark beers; better from the bottle than on draft.

Nose is cereal - after all it is grain. Appearance is light yellow with a pure white head that leaves spot sheeting. Carbonation is long lasting and fizzy. Taste is slightly bitter with dry malt.  14.9 oz can in a 10 pack, which is cheaper than the 11.2 oz bottles in a 12 pack. Hate those 11.2s!  4/27/16 -  Now they have 11.2 oz cans.
This was like an over priced bud light, a little bit smoother with a subtle hop flavor overall not to good.
Bottle. Clear light copper color with a thin white head. Aroma of malt and hops. Some fruity notes. Malty taste with hay and cereal.
Aroma of grain and maybe a little hops.  Pours clear yellow with a small white head.  Taste is sweet and grainy.
Average aroma, appearance, taste and palate. Decent, somewhat memorable. Rated in the past from the bottle.

Aromas ligeros a malta con notas herbales....

Color amarillo palido con una media carbonatación, coronda de espuma ligera y de corta duración. El color llega a ser muy traslucido contra la luz.

En boca, cerveza de amargor medio y seca.

Al paladar, es suave y un pocogaseosa por su carbonatación, sin embargo tiene el amargor justo para no ser un cerveza de baja fermentación tradicional.

En general  es una buena cerveza, ideal para las tardes calurosas Mexicanas!
33cl bottle from Alko. Poured clear golden with a thin white head. Grassy, light sweet aroma. Flavor is mild hoppy, grassy. Crisp, tad too swet, but as a whole quite ok.
Great beer overall, clean crisp taste and very smooth. Strong enough without the bitterness.

Pours a clear thin gold w/out much of a head but does leave some lacing. The aroma is pretty weak - possibly some malt?  The taste is thin but has enough flavor to avoid the "watery" label. It’s got a euro skunk thing going on. Ok - if there’s no other micro options.
C’est une bonne bière quand il fait chaud mais rien de spécial au goût. Elle se boit très bien sans plus.

On tap during ribfest. It helped that it was 40+ degrees with humidity but unfortunately the beer warmed up and it became less then pleasant. Clear slightly pale yellow with a nice white head. Bit of corn and wheat, some sugar, light malts. Mild body, moderate to high carbonation, slightly sweet with a hint of bitterness on the finish, very smooth, bit of skunk at the end, aftertaste is not pleasant.
Une bière intéressante, bonne bière de soif. Pas de caratéristiques distinctives ressortants, mais elle se boit bien quand même.
draught. Golden colour, small white head. Pungent aroma of grains, apple juice, some skunk. Taste is grainy malts, very bubbly. Meh.
Great Belgian beer. Light, tasty and not too gassy. Strength is ok, doesn’t get you too drunk too fast.
the beer taste incredible good. the bottles are good also. and you can get it almost everywhere in the world.
All around light beer.  A bit of a pungent taste.  Carbonated, a bit too fizzy for me.  But nice to have on a warm day.
Ótima alternativa pro chopp do dia a dia. Principalmente estando fresco. Deixa um resíduo amargo mas muito mais sutil que as cervejas da categoria. Fácil de beber em grandes quantidades.
Stella Artois is easily one of my absolute favorite beers. Simply delicious. Highly recommend.
Pours golden like a pilsner. Little head. Light malty taste. Decent if nothing else is around , good for its style.

From a can, really made in Belgium. Very nice in hot weather. Good refresment when you are thirsty. Definitely not a best beer in the world but works fine when you are looking for this type of beer. A lot of CO2 for me though.
Bottle from Alko. Light golden color, white head. Light taste with some citrus and malts. Light carbonation. Pretty OK lager.

Clear yellow pour with a good white head. Aroma is unappealing - kind of medicinal. Very light-bodied, touch of bitter without much flavor and some sweetness. Short, boring finish.
Until I read others’ reviews here, I thought perhaps I just didn’t get this beer. Now I see that it’s just a more expensive European version of Lite/Bud/Coors.
Better than most lagers available in the UK mainstream, but nothing special at all. Can be slightly too fizzy at times but looks ok and tastes decent.
The head is medium. It smells chemical, corn, a bit barley. The taste is chemical-barley and also watery. 8/3/4/3/8/3

Botella de 330ml. Vaso Lager. Color amarillo pálido y apariencia cristalina. Espuma blanca, tupida y cremosa. Aromas florales, de ligero sulfuro y levadura. Sabor de malta moderada y toque cítrico. Cuerpo ligero y carbonatación media pero chispeante. Final y retrogusto de suave amargo.
330ml bottle. Lager glass. Pale yellow color, crystal appearance. White in color, close & creamy froth. Slightly sulphur, yeasty & floral aromas. Mildy malty flavor & citric touch. Light body with medium, but lively, carbonation. Smooth bitter finish & aftertaste.

Bottle. Light golden color, some rocky head. Some hop aroma, but very generic smelling. Taste is pretty watery, with some citrus on the mid palate and bitterness on the finish. It’s crisp and clean, with a light mouth feel. A decent basic beer, but not very good in the grand scheme of things.
The bad pale lagers have no hops and a metallic/chemical flavour. This suffers from neither problem, but is still quite boring. I even get a bit of citrus, though, which is nice.
On keg, this is decently ok. In bottle, it is ruined by the "trademark" green glass.

Draft pint at a ball game. Clear golden yellow with a thin white head with surprisingly decent lacing. Aroma is bread, yeast, biscuit, lemongrass, and some spice, probably coriander. Taste is bready, malty, and Belgian yeast with a spicy lemon twist. Kinda adjunct lagerish but ok.
Enjoyable. A great refreshment after yard work. I love the smell. Appearance is lackluster. very crisp and abrupt taste/palate. Overall it is one I will get from time to time

On tap at a pub in West Palm Airport. Pours clear gold with a medium, white head. The aroma is lemons, pilsener malts, and hay. The flavor is very sweet, with a very faint hop bitterness and very lightly spicy. The palate is light, effervescent, and a little acidic. Overall, this is very drinkable and light, but still interesting and tasty.

Draught at the Pyrmont Bridge Hotel. Pours a clear pale gold, with a moderate white head, which lasts reasonably well but does not leave much lace. The aroma is standard pale lager: stale hops and wet cardboard. There is a light bitterness without any really discernible hops flavour, and a mix of cardboard and white bread. It at least doesn’t taste metallic, like most pale lagers. A very missable beer.
Fresh, fruity and slightly sour. Pleasant aftertaste. A light beer that works as well as a thirst quencher as with the meal.

Bottle at Average Joe’s. The least terrible of some grim choices. Pours clear yellow/gold; thin white head, surprisingly good lacing. Nose is faded skunks hops, clean malt, some grass, some green apple. Flavours of apple, grass, stale hops. Bland.

Pale, clear, fizzy; some malt, the odd hop, but pretty tasteless all told; short, dry finish; after driving for four hours I wanted something cold and refreshing - the first 2 or 3 mouthfuls delivered, the remainder was ultra dull; wish I’d put the kettle on instead.
Bottle. Not actually Belgian. This one is brewed in the UK. It’s lager, massed produced, not quite lowest common denominator but not far off.

There really isn’t much to say about this beer... very bitter and skunky, quite watery. This really is just a terrible beer that needs to be avoided at all costs! Back in the day I would often drink this but I can’t look at the stuff, it’s not good... instead of picking up a case of this grab a few bottles of ale... you might be a few bottles down but you will get a better experience!

Aroma of hay and crisp malts, a little funky. Taste is crisp malts, hay, a touch of metallic and floral hops, some funk and a marijuana taste. Palate is thin. Overall this isn’t bad, nor is it too good. Certainly a step above all other mass produced pale lagers.

Poured into a tall flute glass. Two and half fingers of head. Clear, golden color body with lots of bubbles visible. The head quickly faded.

It smells like dry grain and rice.

Tastes like carbonated water with the mildest bitter note at the end.

Crisp and light body. Lower carbonation than I was expecting.

It is what it is.
good aroma, crystal clear and golden in color with a nice head. good taste that is a little bit malty

yellow beer with white head with average retention. Grass and skunky aroma. Very light and watery taste. I remember that 10 years ago this beer was somewhat better but from now on I will try to avoid it.

Stellaaaaaaaaaa fièrté des Artois, dommage que cela soit le fleuron brassicol belge qui s’exporte à toutes les sauces sous un grand bluff de matraquage médiatique. 
Pils typique et pas étonnant qu’elle s’exporte car pour moi, elle est la plus médiocre des pils belges loin derrière les classiques de Jupiler, Palm, Safir, Maes, etc, etc.
A ce profile horrible et métallique telle la Heineken sur des houblons nobles et typique euro pour l’amertume et ce côté grains pâle et pils qui en fait ne contribuent en rien à une saveur quelconque.

A - super clear straw yellow with small thin layer of head.  S - rose petals are abrupt at first with hints of bubble gum and lager.  Light bodied and simple palette.  T - very floral with hints of honey up front.  Notes of each aforementioned flavor slowly fade throughout.  Faint clove spice picks up in the middle and fades with other flavors.  4/4+.

Bouteille de 25cl. Couleur blonde légèrement pale, mousse moyenne de tenue moyenne. Une lager correcte, avec un peu de goût et juste ce qu’il faut d’amertume. Un goût générique mais je la préfère pour ma part aux 33 export et autres Kro. Trouvée à Intermarché - Montigny en Gohelle.

Draft. Clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma is light pils malt and some spicy/herbal hops. Flavor is mildly sweet malt and a light hop bitterness. Light body with average carbonation and a clean finish. Very light but clean and refreshing. Always better on draft as apposed to bottled.

This is a review of a green 284ml bottle brewed under license in the UK, best before Oct 2008, drank in Oct 2007.

Poured into a Veltins Pilsner glass, it looked like a lager should, clear, golden yellow and with a white head on top.

The normal lager/pilsner nothingness aroma.

Inbev promote this as a special expensive all singing and dancing lager that you are lucky to be able afford. In reality it is a run of the mill Euro lager and no different to many many others which are cheaper. It tastes crisp and clean, again like a normal lager, nothing special at all.

A unwanted dry aftertaste which knocks my drinkability score too.
Pours clear cream yellow. Smells and tastes of generic Belgian yeast, malted wheat, watery corn and has a dryness on its end-palate.

Nothing special / had too many times to count.  Good clean taste. Always open to have when options limited. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Originally reviewed: 6/17/08. Poured this into a conical. Not much head, but what was there stayed there. Excellent lacing. Poured a light-medium golden color. Smelled of greens, corn and slight buttery scent. 

Had a crisp clean mouthfeel to it. Very smooth. Tasted of hops, mild fruitiness, husky grains.

I enjoyed this beer. Very refreshing. Will definitely drink this again.
On draft during vacation pours pale golden yellow 1" head, lots of carbonation. Nose of cereal and light hay. Crackery malt body balanced well with grass hop. Crisp mouth.

330ml can poured into a "chalice." Aroma is light sweetness and some light herbal and floral hops. Poured a clear yellow brass with moderate head. Taste is very lager sharp with some light sweetness underneath. Body is rather light but refreshing. Overall, it is very drinkable even if it is not some brilliant craft brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle, 5,0% abv. Amber color. Medium thick head. At first there is sweet corn, malty aroma, only to be replaced with strange metallic scent. Absolutely no taste. Watery, slight short bitter ending.
Pours crystal clear golden orange. Good lace.  Smell is some sweet corny malts, some metal.  Taste is sweet corn and some hop bite.  Good lager.
Not sure what all the appeal and allure of this beer is.  Is it because it’s foreign?  Really, I’d rather have a Yuengling Premium or Miller High Life.  This bee just doesn’t offer much of anything.
750ml bottle. Colour is clear golden with big head. Aroma is malt, yeast. Flavour is slightly bitter hops.

Bottle at a Red Lobster. The taste wasn’t as bad as I thought; much better than a domestic pilsener. However, the aroma was nonexistent, the palage was pretty watery, and the appearance was unremarkable. Overall, if in a chain restaurant with no other options, I’d get one, but otherwise, not thanks.

Can 0,5l - Supermarket
Appearance: Clear light amber, with a small, white, short lasting head. Good lacing. 
Aroma : Cornflour,citrus  with hints of floral and grassy hops, mild skunk note. 
Palate : Light body, lively carbonation, slightly astringent finish. 
Taste: Lightly sweet in the beginning, mild bitterness masked by the cornflour and a moderate length finish.
12 oz bottle pours golden with a white head.  Aroma of malt and citrus.  Taste is the malt with a bit of bitter hops.

Pours a very clear light golden color that you could read through without any problem. Head disappears quickly but it laces decently. Smell of skunk weed upon opening (good ol’ green bottles). I want to say I can detect a sort of grainy hoppiness after it sits a couple minutes. Taste is much better, with some cereal: corn, oat, and a mild maltiness. Leans toward refreshing, though there is a bit of body to it and little carbonation. There’s little there to tell you it comes from Belgium; I don’t recognize a yeast or malt characteristic. I guess I don’t hate it. Had to get this one out of the way.

Sampled at Delizia, restaurant in Stavanger. Clear golden with a lasting white film leaving a fair lacing. Light malts and a metallic whiff on the nose. Light sweet, bitter flavors with notes of grains, vegetables and paper. Light to medium body. Long, papery bitter finish. Catchy name.

this beer just reminds me of drinking a heineken only very much more expensive honestly i would rather drink a heinken the beer does form a decent head and has a good taste to it but not my cream of the crop

Clear light golden with a rocky thin white head. Smells like some Belgo pale cereal grains with a dusty light peachy yeast esters, as well as a subtle grassy hop tone. Taste was a little lager-y, with pale grain and biscuit tones, but the middle followed through with some light but pleasant light fruity Belgo yeast esters. But then finishes biscuity and lager-y again. Not terrible, better than I expected. Better than some American craft belgos, too. Just a little light on body and not really pleasing with its mass appeal and weak effort on grain bill.
Bottle pours golden yellow with white head.  Aromas of cereal and leaves.  Taste is pure lager, not much to it.  Overall, better than American Lager, but not by much

Good for its style. Pours golden like a pilsner.  Little head. Smokey and malty taste. Decent if nothing else is around.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smells a bit skunky but also malty. Taste is not skunky at all - quite crisp,  actually - much more malt flavor than your typical macro lager. Not bad.

Draught.
Pours a clear, medium gold, with a white head.
Malty aroma, quite clean, citrus, faintly buttery, vaguely hoppy.
Off-dry, light to medium bodied, low to medium bitterness, balanced CO2.
Malty, sweetish taste, hops, citrus, slightly grainy, faint diacetyl, hints of cardboard.
Not bad at all for a lager of this size. Well balanced. (2011-04-13)
Nice head, pretty average beer.  It was enjoyable, but doesn’t have much uniqueness other than the fun glassware.
Fairly common brew.  Prefer on draft if cold.  Very good lager.  Light color.  Good taste and smell.

Pale gold, initially  a thick white head. Light malt and hops (European?) on the nose, but very muted.  Somewhat thin malt taste, slightly sweet with a hint of hop bitterness pushed along by a steady carbonation.  Not great, not bad.

Originally rated February 2005. This Belgian lager poured a blonde colour with a white foamy-cream head that left heavy foam lace. Nicely carbonated. The scent was not skunky this time (sampled from the can), but mostly malt and grass. The taste was also grassy with an aftertaste of corn (which is written as one the ingredients). This beer is usually overpriced (marketing strategy), but remains a descent refreshing lager.

This beer was good and I didn’t think it would be. The aroma is light and crisp with notes of hay. The color a pale yellow, clear and sparkling with minimal head white head. The taste was light and crisp and thirst quenching.
Pale in color with a light citrusy flavor.  Extremely drinkable and quenching. Goes down smooth.
Nice beer with an okay aroma. Taste is a little flat.  Nice pale appearance but overall not my favorite.

Simple and refreshing.  There is nothing notable about this beer, except that it’s clean.  If you’re drinking on a hot summer day and not too focused on your beer, this is a good thing to have in hand.  Not bad, but it’s EuroBudweiser.
banana, rotten eggs, cheese, spruce, bread, pale, clear, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, lively, bitter,

(Second Rating, Home, 330mL Bottle, Vintage Sept. 2011, Lager Glass, 5.0% ABV, Cellar Temp, 24/03/12. #23-41.)




Appearance (3/5): Pours a clear, orange tinted light amber, with a two finger, white, creamy, mostly lasting head with good lacing.


Aroma (5/10): Dominant cereals and citrus, with florals, grass, and skunk. Very subtle perfume note.


Taste (5/10): Sweet and very lightly acidic at the beginning, light bitterness throughout and in the moderate length finish. Quite well balanced. Has a slightly savory overall taste, reminiscent of a pilsener.


Palate (3/5): Light body, lively carbonation, watery and slightly creamy texture, with a slightly astringent finish.


Overall (10/20): Probably my favorite macrobrew. It’s available everywhere, so it’s usually my go-to in chain restaurants that don’t serve craft beer. Nothing particularly unique or excellent, but wonderfully average. The skunk aroma is particularly bad in some bottles. My guess is that the light green glass is particularly susceptible to skunking, especially since its quite old by the time I get it, since its an import.


Drinkability: 5/5. Character: 2/5. Buy Again: Definitely Yes.

When cold, Stella offers a nice thirst quenching retreat from a warm day.  It's smooth and gives off a nice clean and sharp appearance. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Overall, this is one of the best macro-brewed light lagers. It is good for get togethers with friends and having more than one. It has a light crisp flavor with a very slight citrus lift. simple construction

A classic that I drink often. For this review I poured a 500ml can into my Stella Trappist glass. Aroma is strong hopsy, a little skunky (although never really understood that description except to say unpleasant) with a hint of sweetness. Smells exactly what I remember beer smelling like as a child. Clear yellow with hint of amber to give the colour some depth. Thin head, sometimes up to an inch but always fades quickly. Ok lacing considering the lack of head. Tastes just as it smells, exactly what I think regular beer should taste like. Perfect balance between hops bitterness and sweetness to give it an excellent palate and aftertaste that says "I just drank a beer." Thatâ€™s what makes this a classic and why there should be a gold ribbon on the top of the glass. Nothing amazing or worthy of a high rating but the ideal Plutonian beer.

El aroma al principio es floral aunque se puede percibir algo de aroma a malta. Es de color dorado con espuma blanca que dura hasta el final del vaso. El sabor es medio amargo aunque no llega a ser fuerte y tiene algo de cuerpo, el final es seco.
Barva: světle zlatá, pěna bílá , držící. Vůně: nádherná chmelová. Chut: nevýrazný kompromis mezi chmelovou hořkostí a sladem. Středně plné tělo, lehounký chmelový dozvuk.
Nose is sulfury and slightly sweet. The taste is grainy with the same taste of sulfur. Finish is kinda sweet. I can actually drink this, putting it miles ahead of most in the style.

Bottle 0.66 L.
Clear golden body with a medium, frothy white head, mostly diminishing with a fair lacing; high density of small particles.
Light malty aroma with some hoppy herbal notes.
Quite balanced bitter-sweet flavour.
Light-to-medium body with a watery texture; average carbonation; light metallic feeling in the finish.

Pour is a light golden color with a white head. Nose is faintly sweet. Taste has always been a little bit funky to me, but it is what they were going for. Light, refreshing, decent cheap session beer.

A really old friend. I’m probably biased as my wife knows to buy Stella if nothing else. I get  giddy every time I cut the foil around the cap. Soo...

11.2 ounce bottle. Pours a straw with the faintest hint of amber. Quick fizzling head. Nose is a bit skunky, but familiar. Taste is a bit bitter that diminishes and leaves a slight aftertaste. Not good compared to abbey ale, but special to me =)

Pale golden color out of the tap.  Sticky white head.  Faint sweet nose.  Thin beer with some wet grains, stale bread, old lemon peel and a lingering artificial, metallic finish that lingers.  Maybe its better closer to the source.

Only complaint of this beer is the bitterness that is the last taste left with you. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
not bad at all period! decent lacing..bit sweet with a slight bitter finish.
Poured a clear gold.with a thin white aroma. Aroma was somewhat slinky but then some sweet maltiness was there. Nice initial bitterness.
Uma boa Pale Lager. Ótimo custo-benefício e bela alternativa as outras populares do mesmo estilo.

Golden color with a decent head that lasts for about a minute and a half. The aroma of the brew really didn’t stand out. Some light skunk was present, along with some neutral light graininess/maltiness. The mouthfeel was crisp and moderately carbonated.
Another beer that is so light that is hard to distinguish between others in its category.  It is smooth and crisp though.

22 oz bomber.  Two of them, actually.  Pours a beautiful golden honey color.  Aroma is very faint, with classic malt and yeast notes.  Flavor is very light and crisp, mostly a sweet yeast flavor.  This is a classic, a very drinkable beer.  Not one for deep contemplation, or for your average hop-head.  It reminds me of the beer that adults would drink when I was a little kid.  An absolutely classic refreshment.  I love it.
Top of the hangover beers this really is not worth drinking in my opinion despite the fact it is sold everywhere this has a beefy texture to it. Typical of the idiots who drink it.
The aroma is fairly bland. The beer is just slightly to the golden side of yellow fizz. The taste is fizzy water with just a hint of Belgian spice. Better than most pale lagers, but nothing special.

Bottle form Pick N Save.  Here is a beer with an ego.  Pours bright yellow with disappearing head.  Hop nose up front, very mild malt taste.  While refreshing, it’s hype has more foam than it’s actual head.  Grolsch is similar and better and costs about a buck less a sixer!.  Here, for that extra buck you get the paper collar around the bottle cap -  a Roman Collar, if you will, for something less than priestly from Belgium. Belgium has some great beers - this is not one of them!  Save money and opt for Grolsch or a good German lager.  You want a lager from Belgium?  Watch an old Audrey Hepburn movie!  Prosit!

The scent on this one is almost musty with a strange hop twang to it. While the taste is a light on the hops and malts, the finish is rather crisp and accompanies a heavy meal quite well. On it’s own this beer is simply to weak to enjoy.
Bottle. Pours yellow white head. Aroma of bread, hay, sweet malt. Taste is sweet, a little bitter in the finish. Balances well, thin body, average carbonation, refreshing. Good lager overall.

Can: I have had this in a bottle, and on tap too, but when I finally got a hold of it in cans I decided to rate it.  It pours a beautiful yellow with a bright white head that leaves great lacing on my glass.  It has a nice earthy, sweet smell, and a clean flavor of grains.  It’s a little boring, but very drinkable and refreshing.

Bottle. Pours a golden body, with a large white head that’s lasts quite enough, with a good lacing too. But, despite the appearance, I didn’t enjoy this at all. Aroma is weird, too hoppy I think, and so is taste. I tried very hard to finish my glass. To be avoided.

Not bad if you want something light and refreshing.  It’s crisp, with no body, and has a decent hop kick up front.  Goes down easy.  A little over carbonated but that’s to be expected.  Trick is to find bottles that haven’t been exposed to light because stupid green bottles go back quickly.
Love my Stella!  Stella Artois is my all around beer. It’s a smooth that pairs well with almost anything.

(rated 2/6/12) Clear light golden, good white head and great lacing.  Light malt taste with very light bittering.  A one-note beer, inoffensive and drinkable, but weak on flavor and fullness. ----- (12/20/16) How full-of-myself I was then...always looking for bigger brews with strong caramel.  Hoppy brews were really not on my radar yet.  This is one of those small, but undeniably satisfying Pale Lagers, plenty of palate cleansing, goes with any food, light malt and hop brews.  I understand now.

Enjoyed on tap at the Globe Pub in Chicago, IL while celebrating a friends birthday.  Appearance is clear gold with rich white head.  Aroma mostly lager yeast, very small amount of malt.  Taste is pretty good, very crisp , slightly dry, pretty nice.  I enjoy this more and more each time I get it.

Bottle pours clear yellow into a branded glass. Good frothy head that fills the glass. weak head retention. Aroma of hops, malt, mild notes of yeast. Nothing "bad" about this beer. That being said, there is nothing special about it. fairly smooth.
Pours pale yellow with white foamy head. Aroma of grain cider and noble hops. Taste is smooth and crisp with a balanced blend of malt and hops with a dry crisp finish.

From the tap at Bettis’ Grill in Pittsburgh.  Note of correction:  This beer was listed in the Pilsner category on the menu at Bettis’ Grill.  Crisp, clean, no detection of the so-alled skunkiness rumored from other tasters.  Lacks any uniqueness of the Belgian family.  Probably on par with a Belgian Budweiser or a German St. Pauli Girl.

As I live in the city of origin, I try very hard to judge this beer objectively. Many people in Leuven would gave a bartender funny looks if they didn’t get a Stella server when ordering a beer.
That being said Stella has a different taste all around the world, and I’ve tasted many variations which, surprise!, vary A LOT.
Stella Artois serverd in Belgium tastes better on draft, has an acidic touch and no aftertaste. Also bottled it comes in a brown bottle around here. A green bottle means it’s an exported version and therefore not the original ’formula’.
pours yellow colour thin head aroma of straw and flavour is a little skunky but nothing different then all the there pale lagers
It may have a bit more taste to it than most lagers, perhaps a somewhat beerfy taste in fact, however the hangover affects are pretty terrible and I suggest avoiding this one.

Belgian lager with a weird soap-like foam and a slightly harsh hop aroma. taste is most of all German lagers in the more lightly hopped end of the scale. Fine lager if you can handle it a little sharp and piercing hop flavor on your tongue.

When 2pac said "i dont mind it. got a gay fucken name but." he expressed both a mild satisfaction with the beer and a general distaste for the name of the beer, notably his rating ends mid sentence leaving his outright conclusion of the beer to be determined by the reader leaving only his numerical rating as a indicator of his general assessment of the beer.



The beer pours a very pale yellow color with a huge tight white head. 



The aroma is initaly the skunkiest thing I have ever smelled other than a skunk, this is the sort of beer Loudon Wainwright III would be compelled to write a song about. Leaving it for a minute results in less skunk and more odd lightly moldy malt and mild spiciness. Geeze this doesn’t smell nice on any accord. 



The flavor is clean, fairly sweet and malty with some mild grassy hops. The beer is lightly spicy and I kind of like the crisp malt character.

10 YEARS OF 2PAC "i dont mind it. got a gay fucken name but. "  It does have a fucken gay name, 2pac.  And I’m with you as well when you say that I don’t mind it.  It’s a very basic pale lager, but nicely executed.  Loved the world over.
highly carbonated, with a strong white head, good strength, and a decent flavour. refreshing, and up there with the better lagers (and a nicer drink from the bottle in my opinion).
Bland continental style lager with little to recommend it other than it was the only beet available when I visited a friend.
Tastes sometimes varies between countries, but generally an easy to drink lager.
Not outstanding but reliable for most occasions.  Not a lot of head when poured but nice color.  No after taste.
Good crisp "lite beer".   Easy to drink with a meal a bit more hoppy than the typical American pilsner.
This is a very good beer, but also quite heavy for a Belgium beer. It has a very nice taste, although, when you get to the last mouthful, it has a slight taste of paint thinner.
Nasty urine aroma.  Taste is slightly caramel like.  Lousy dry finish.  Tastes a little skunky too.  It isn’t amazing, but relatively easy to drink.

01.06.2011 - Houston, TX
On Tap

Decent palate and taste but not what it is hyped up to be. Does have a nice 5.2% alcohol percentage though...
Bottle. Bog standard lager that has an unpleasant chemical aroma and is quite sweet.
Good for what it is, a crisp mass market beer. Nice pairing for pizza or wings. Grassy notes, sweet bread taste.

Pours a completely transparent light yellow, huge bubbles, large whispy head that dissipates quickly. Aroma: Hoppy. Skunky. Cheese, basement, spruce. Palate: Thin bodied, kind of flat. Slightly oily. Taste: slightly bitter. "Easy drinking" I guess. Not a beer I’d usually drink, but i’m glad I have some curry to go with it.
Straw color with minimal head.  Skunky aroma  and flavor with some bread crust notes.  Light body with high carbonation.
I really like this lager. It’s pretty and has a pretty name. I prefer to order this beer when the only other options are lagers.

330 ml bottle in a lager glass. Pours a clean yellow with a medium white head - good retention there. Tastes cereal-sweet with a very, very subtle and light bitterness in the finish. Body is watery, carbonation is average. I think it does quite fine for a super-commercial lager, yet like most of its category, it remains a very bland beer. I’d recommend it anyday for someone who’s starting with beer.
Bottle and can. Light golden colour, with a medium head. Its aroma is light hay and grasses, medium body, bitter, but a bit watery for me, though.
Nice golden colored beer. Thick white head - I actually enjoy this beer. Obviously there is a lot of stuff out there that is superior - but it’s clean, crisp, with some subtle grassy notes
Bottle.  Mild carbonation.  Pale yellow color.  Clean, dry, appropriately bitter.  Much better than I had remembered!

Overall this is a very enjoyable beer in my opinion. It smells a tad snunky but not as much as Heineken  does.  Color is a light straw color. Taste is clean with a hint of bitter and a smooth champagne tasting finish. I enjoy this beer when it’s on sale but don’t buy it unless it’s on sale. This is one the best everyday beers I’ve had.
Pours a straw yellow color.  Aroma is skunky.  Taste is also skunky and bland.

Kind of disappointed in this beer since it is so widely hailed as a model beer. Watery and not much taste, so mellow in fact that i would have sworn it was made in the States and sold matching flip flops and hats. Not impressed sorry everybody

Light amber, clear.
Fruity sweet, caramel.
Quite dry. Caramel, decent, not that interesting. Quite thin.
Good, solid beer. Don’t have too much to say about it beside that. Good beer that goes with any meal.

From can. Light straw yellow and a clear, billowy head which fades to thin and hangs around. A very light malt on the nose, but not enough to give a clear judgement. On the tongue it’s more sweet than anything else. Very thin, average carbonation, not much excitement. It’ll quench a thirst, but never spark an adventure.
Pale golden colour...very nice lager....not so dry aftertaste actually sweetish aftertaste, medium carbonation
After a hard day of study, entering a pub,a nice Stella from the tap with a clean foam top. Home is where my stella is. Just beer, nothing special. Had worse.

on draft poured clear yellow with no head to speak of. aroma not to sure. didnt get to much out of it for sure. the flavor is of a mild belgium spice with touches of yeast and/or bread. light body light flavor.
One of the most famous Belgiam beers and the worst I have tasted in this country. Poor appearance, vey poor aroma, watery taste. A shame for this country and a beer to forget.
Less bitter than I remember this beer is light on the palate and complexity.  Nose is a little soapy.
bottle from el corte ingles, lisbon. Golden color and corn/cereal aroma. Low bitter taste and thin and medium to high carbonated palate.

Had on draft.

Arrived with a thin head and plenty of carbonation bubbles visible in the glass. Color was a medium straw yellow.

Aroma is slightly floral with some grain and yeast.

The flavor is very grainy with some citrus apparent. Lemon in particular. There is also a bit of yeast bite that is not extremely pleasant. Carbonation is high.

Overall it is an ok beer but there are much better Euro pale lagers out there. A nice alternative to BMC though.

I am very disappointed in this beer. It has changed.  It used to be a reliable clean, crisp and refreshing beer.  It has changed.  It’s as if the makers have set out to try to reproduce this beer at a cheaper price.  It didn’t work.  The aroma is jarring - like decaying citrus.  The taste is awkward. The beads nicely but is thin and quickly drains onto the top of the liquid like the foam around a toilet bowl. Worst of all, beware of a one-beer headache. Am I mad about this beer, yes.  I don’t like when something good is turned into something bad. I’ll never get used to bad management decisions.

Canned and chilled. Heavily carbonated with a thick foamy head when poured. Pale with the usual lager aromas, a hint of honey and light malty flavour. Nothing special and i wouldn’t choose this normally but as mass market lagers go it is drinkable if a bit uninspiring.
Nothing special about Stella Artois. very similar to most others. Id have again if stuck for a few

This "left over from a party" excuse is beginning to wear a bit thin! 330 ml bottle, poured into a glass. gold with a thin white head. I quite enjoy the biscuity/citrus flavour, and despite this beers mass produced prevalance offending my bohemian unconventionality, I think it’s alright. Just alright.

Bottle 30cl.
Pours a clear golden colour with good carbonation and a good size head.
Decent pilsener, not my favorite.

Clear golden pour w/ a white head that left some good lacing. Nice looking lager.  Aromas are slightly floral, grain, some malts, gym socks and cardboard.  Fairly smooth and crisp palate w/ light body and lt/med carbonation. Flavors of seltzer water, mild hops & bitterness.  dry-ish finish and some malt sweetness.  It’s OK.  Easy drinking, refreshing, subtle and mostly unremarkable.  A decent session, and good early step away from American macro lagers.

Pale golden, white fluffy head. Nose is grainy with some wet cardboard thrown in. Taste is grainy, some malty sweetness and cardboard. Finish has some hints at aromatic hops and bitterness. Prickly carbonation, some oily hints in the finish. Overall - not exactly bad, but very forgettable.
Nothing special about Stella Artois. Just another lager beer. You can find much more lagers that are a lot better.....
If you want a beer that is sure not to offend anyone... this might be it.  Weak taste and mouthfeel but it is fairly inexpensive and the bottle looks nice.  Certainly beats most American macros....
Can served in a flare pilsner. Clear and lageresque. Medium sized head that leaves a nice lace. Clean grainy and bready aroma. Light sweet flavor and a light bitter crisp finish.

0.33 bottle. Very soft aroma, rather hop, some forest smell in the background. Pale golden color and soft, average, white head. Taste is even more delicate, it is a balance between sweetness, sourness and bitterness where the last predominates. Light body, smooth texture and soft carbonation. Dissatisfying, barely noticeable finish. Nothing special, although highly drinkable.
Pale yellow, white head. Grassy and biscuit  aroma. Sweet taste with some bitterness. Lively carbonation, light and thin body. Taste quickly fades.
una comun lager muy bien comercializada,degustandola no se encuentran aromas particulares es ligera y tiene un gusto con suaves tonos de lupulo y malta. nada especial
50cl can. Golden with white persistent head. Good lacing. Aroma is malty, cereal, fresh grass and light bittery. Flavour is slightly bittery. Average carbonation and medium body.
I was glad to log in and see many people hating this stuff as much as I do. I found it horrible...skunky, tasteless and bland, Like PBR with a fancier label.
Unexciting very slightly skunky beer.  Better than a lot of other pales out there though.  High ABV!

(bottle) Pours light yellow with a thick white head. Strong skunky aroma (in a green bottle - was there any doubt?) that seems to level out after a few minutes. Thin, dry finish on the palate. Not much to it.

Bottle.  A very clear  light gold beer with a pretty thick white head.  Very weak aroma of grains, malts, maybe a little hops.  Taste is sweet, mild.  Pretty watery, not much on the finish.  It’s drinkable, but that’s about it.
If you want to drink a lot of something that doesn’t taste awful, go with stella.
Clean, crisp, dry - pretty much your standard lager. Pretty good balance, but not very exciting.

A slightly above average Pale Lager. Not anything I would seek out, but I have enjoyed many a Stella over the years while sitting in a bar that does not have any craft offerings. Certainly one of the better regularly offed beers in its style.
Bottle, pours clear golden with white head. Aroma is some malt, grass. Taste is metallic bitterness.

I was recommended this by a friend who described this as marijuana’s alcoholic cousin due to it’s "skunky" flavor.  Personally, I think it tastes a bit like a Heineken mixed with a dos equis.  Not my favorite, definitely drinkable, but not desirable either.
Pours a pale yellow, with an avg sized head.  Aroma of bready malts and hops.  Flavor of light hops and some grass.  Finishes bitter and a bit rough.

Date: October 12, 2011 Mode: Draft Source: Scoreboard
Good for the style, but I only ordered it for the rating.  I will not be stocking my fridge with this.

Keg @ Premier Inn M6, Carlisle. 051011

Golden, clear, rocky white head.

Aroma - Grainy, corn, not much hop, bit harsh.

Taste - cereal, grains, light sweet malts, cardboard, some bitter hops, harsh metal notes, chemicals, poor taste.

Very high carb, bitter metallic finish.

Lousy macro lager. Not good. Never liked this stuff.

Keg at Brass Monkey. Had a taste o’ Miggy’s. Had many pints of my own in the past. Golden to Orange. Fizzy. Mild nod at a Belgian yeast strain. Pretty dull malt profile. Bad really. I hear it’s better on the continent.

Draught in Budapest. Pours a regular pale lager color; golden with a quickly dissipating white head. Aroma is light straw and malt. Taste is much of the same. Refreshing in the 35+ heat, but that’s about it.

Poured from bottle into tulip glass. Clear, light gold color with firm, white foam. Good noble hops aroma. A well-balanced and easy-drinking lager, an upgrade from the typical American Light Lager. Don’t judge me: but blend Stella with fresh-squeezed orange juice for an out-of-this-world mimosa.

Fittingly, I wrote my rating for this on the sick bag during our flight home from Belgium. From a can. This "beer" pours a blonde colour with a thick white head. Big bready yeast aroma with some barley and faint caramel notes. Flavour was again dominated by bready yeast with caramel, grassy hops and a subtle metallic finish.

This brew poured up a clear, light-golden colored body with a white frothy head that dissipates very quickly and left no lacing. Standard norm on the scents and flavors as that of adjunct lagers: grains, hops, malts. Light-bodied, easy to drink, highly carbonated with a clean, dry, hoppy finish. A good brew to have with some zesty fish-n-chips!
Draft.  Taste of wet cardboard and metal.  Not a pleasant flavor.  Would rather have most other lagers over this.
50cl can. Drank it straight out of the can. Normal pilsener taste. With some hay, hops and a Belgian yeast touch. Comparable with Jupiler. An ok pilsener.

4oz draft from Hangar from a flight. Pours a clear amber with a small white head. I really tried to find an aroma, but all I could smell was skunk. Taste is lightly bitter. Tasted strongly of skunk. Light bodied with average carbonation. Light bitter finish. Overall, not that good. Definitely not something I would seek out again.
Upgrade from a miller lite.  As crisp, as refreshing, as drinkable but with more taste.  Good for tailgating or relaxing when you feel like quenching your thirst with an ice cold beer.

Malzig-getreidiger Geruch. Etwas lascher Auftakt, dem eine malzige Mitte folgt. Ausgangs kommt der Hopfen stärker zum Zuge. Insgesamt recht sauber abgestimmtes Lager. Leicht wässrig, dennoch geschmacklich ok.Test vom 30.3.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche

STELLA!!!!!  Actually not a bad little beer.  I had several last night, and it made me wish the restaurant had Blatz on tap.....it was not to be so I suffered through this, and even though I thought it was a bit sassy, it still stands in the shadow cast by the giant: BLATZ.  So go ahead and get your freak-on with this silly little import, while the cool people are pounding the BLATZ.  Don’t question it.

Pour piss-yellow, with a bit white head.
Undefinable aroma, with some cinnamon, as well in the taste. 
nothing special about this lager, however there is a bit more flavour than there is in your normal pale ale.
Bottle. Yellow when poured. Corn smell. Corny, weak watery pilsner taste to it.  Not bad but pretty bland. Couldn’t recommend.  Isn’t this essentially the world’s Bud Light? Meh. 5.2% alcohol.
When nicely chilled this beer goes down nice and smooth.  No harsh aftertaste and finishes well.

On Draft.  Aroma:  Earthy hop and earthy malt
Palate:  Medium body--heavier than I expected.
Flavor:  Like the nose: Earthy hop and earthy, moderately sweet malt.  A light orange/malty note on the mid-palate.  Understated bitterness that showed on the finish.  
Comment:  I assumed this would be watery and relatively tasteless and I was wrong.  I liked the earthy German-like hops and malt.  Being on draft probably made all the difference.
Pours A nice golden color.  Flavor is light and crisp.  As far as mass produce beers fo this is one of my favorites, priced right and a lot more character than most "cheap beer"

Pours yellow & clear. Aroma is biscuit & a little musky. Palate is medium-bodied, creamy but crisp with good effervescence. A little musky flavorwise with a hint of a metallic note. More biscuit too. Not my favorite, but good in a pinch
had this after my beers like it was water to clean my palate before bed. sad.....

I have learned three things this week about Stella:
1) You can drink it on ice and it tastes the same
2) It’s called "wife beater" in Scotland
3) After all that I am still compelled to drink the last can in my hotel before my flight out of here tomorrow

This is my always in reserve standby.  It’s a nice beer and is much better than American lagers.  I love searching for the perfect beer and think I will find it in a micor-brewery or artisan type.  I want the best beer possible to qwaff as I watch football.
For a mass produced beer, overall pretty good. Nice golden colour. Crisp and smooth taste, nothing too exciting. Not my favourite, but priced well to have in my fridge.

Clear light golden beer with a small white head. Very herbal aroma, nearly czech-like, with strong green notes of grass and a little hay. Taste is medium sweet with a nicely balanced dose of floral, grassy hops. More bitter than most other macro-lagers. medium body, oily texture, lively carbonation and a dry, bitter finish. Maybe a little one-dimensionel hop-profile, but actually it does a nice job cleaning your palate on a sunny day.

Can. To Hel with the marketing, what’s the beer like? It pours gold with a high, tight white head. Nose is almost nonexistent, but there are faint traces of apple candy and grain. Flavor is mild with a very strong canned corn note and some sweetness. Finishes flabby. Enh. You can do better for cheaper.
The best you’re going to get in a light lager.  Smell is slightly sweet with mild skunk (thanks to the green bottle).  Slightly sweet flavor with mild fruitiness.  Smooth carbonation.
Pours a nice clear yellow color with a slight foam head. Has some hay in it’s aroma and tastes rather sweet. It’s also a very refreshing beer which makes it nice and enjoyable.

Bottle 330ml @ home

Pours clear pale yellow with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, grain and hay. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.
For a pale lager it’s fairly decent, and in Canada it tastes a lot better than I remember it tasting in Europe, but then again in Europe I was surrounded by better beer, generally.

I tried this twice recently.First in a resteraunt in a bottle now at home in a can. I would have to say the can worked wonders for this lager.It had some body pilsner sweetness head and lacing all which were lacking in the bottle. Classic lager color of light gold with pilsner aroma and for a lager an interesting belgian aroma.Out of a can it was not bad ,in a bottle not such the case. Pretty cool looking can too. Watch out for it warming though youll start seeing unpleasant characteristics like funky/metallic.
pale, clear, frothy, lightly bitter, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, thin feel, light body, fizzy, bitter,

12-oz bottle at Bistecca Fiorentina with Erica, 8/20/2011. Color is dull gold; small, white, fizzly head that disappeared pretty fast. Taste is boring with short legs. A little bit of fruit and honey with a negligible hop profile, although it was slightly bitter.

A: The beer pours a crystal clear straw color with a fizzy white head that is fairly short lived, but does cling to the glass a bit.

S: Surprisingly not very skunky.  A touch of skunk, yes, but it’s mostly clean grain notes.  A bit of bread and a fair amount of sweetness with a light straw and grass character.  There is an ever so slight...sourness to it, however.

T: The taste is mostly just sweet and fizzy.  A lot of adjunct sort of flavors and a lot of grain.  Not too much real substantial malt flavor, but a little bit of pale, biscuit notes to it.  Some faint hops and a mild bitterness.

M: Light in body with a rather high carbonation.

O: Though it’s easy to hate on this beer, when it’s not completely skunked, it’s not an awful one.

On tap @ the Mill Inn, Coulter. Pours golden with steady bubbles and not much head. The nose has pale malt and a slightly sulphurous note. The taste has a big citrus note and pale malt. The palate is medium in structure with a big thick texture and a clean finish. Overall, this is the best of the mass-produced lagers that are found everywhere - the palate actually makes it drinkable.
Jag kan inte för min värld förstå varför den här säljs jorden runt, att folk köper den och att den tycks vara så populär. Direkt äcklig smak av metall, ingen som helst egen karaktär. Nix, bort!
On tap. Light clear color. Bitter taste, and pretty much a standard tasting large pilsner. Some wheat-type flavors come through.

Thin, bitter, almost sour. Watery, bland. Meh. 
A beer for you if you want to drink a lot of something and don’t care that it tastes terribly bland.

Reassuringly uniform. Pours pale yellow. Nose is a touch citrousy acidic hops and grainy cereal malt. Flavour has a bit more too it than blander than bland macro lagers like Heineken and Fosters. Bit of an acidic kick in there and hop dryness on the tongue. Marginally more flavour than other crap lagers but still pretty dull.

0.33l bottle @ Bergen Airport. This is a clear really light golden beer with a big almost fluffy and lasting white head. Aroma is mild hopy with some acidic tones, some thin malts and some flower-water. Light-bodied, oily to watery texture and average carbonation. Tastes light and almost fluffy. Some OK hops, mild malty and hints of lime. Ends just a little bit on the dry side. Drinkable lager, but I find this best served in the hot sun after a long day at work.
Not too much to say here. Most overrated beer in the world? Very bland profile, I really can’t tell any big difference between this and any random macro lager.

Can somebody please tell me why this is now everywhere in the U.S. ?  WHY?!?  Typical Pale Lager, very tasteless.  Had it on tap @ The Holy Grail in Epping, NH. Piss yellow color, mild hop nose, a bit skunky.  Taste is light malt, with light hops. Mild bitterness.  Very bland if you ask me, total crap.

Bottle; Pour is clear light golden with a fine bubbled white head that becomes a light haze, ringing this stella glass. The nose is adjunct, fruity, with a light spice note, and I think the flavor profile mirrors these notes. This brew has a refreshing character, light bitterness, and a touch of sweetness. This is a nice drinker, I’ll admit.

Poured pale golden color with moderate head and little lacing.  Aromas of grassy hops and slightly skunky.  Taste is lightly sweet with a slightly bitter hop finish.  Carbonation and body are average.  One of the better macro-beers.

12oz bottle. This beer isn’t great but it isn’t that bad either. If it’s fresh, it is rather refreshing, but with the green bottle, it makes it vulnerable to skunking easier. The Belgian yeast permeates the aroma and the taste just as well. It’s too bad this beer has to be twice as expensive as all the American macro-brews because I would rather slam these instead of a Bud, Coors, or Miller any day. For what it’s worth it’s good, but I’d rather have tons of beers over this any day...

Decent cheap beer even though it isn’t cheap (Ill take a PBR over Stella anyday). Slightly fruity flavor similar to that of a cheap white wine. Decent enough flavor but just not that much complexity. The nice clean finish is the main saving grace of this beer.

Light body. Slight skunk and sweet grains in the aroma. Faint sweet malts in the aroma. Virtually no hops present. Going back to this one after years of craft beer drinking really demonstrated how flavourful and uninteresting this beer is. Inoffensive at best.
Kind of a severe, skunky, bitter malt taste with not much to like.  More hype than flavor for sure.

Bottle, guess I never rated it. Pours light golden yellow with a rocky white head. Aroma sweet, some hay and grassiness, crisp and light, a bit bland. Flavor has a bit more to offer, some hop character, sweet and grassy, hay, and soft bready, though a bit stale bready. Finishes clean and crisp. Light to light medium body and a sharp carbonation. Refreshing but yeah, so so
Standard golden pilsener color. Smell a little sweet for a pilsener. Taste sweet and light bitter. Decent carbo, low to medium body.
Es mi cerveza favorita dentro de las que se pueden encontrar en la heladera del supermercado, Tiene todo lo necesario en su justa medida.

Bottle(s) at the most authentic italian restaurant in the COE. They need a better beer selection, however. They were out of Peroni, and offered me this "thing of beauty." Good opportunity for another tick, but that was all. Reminded me of Heineken, which I also don’t like. Not smooth enough and not tasty. Of course lagers aren’t close to my go-to brew style, but still, I’ve had much better or at least less offensive. I suppose I could have gotten an older bottle as I didn’t get as much of a big frothy head as they show on the commercials. Or they’re just liars. I expected better, and was let down. This is not class.
Looks like soapy piss, tastes like water with something slightly off, and feels lighter than air to the palate. Not my thing.
On tap at Faccia Luna. Clear gold with thin white head. No aroma. Flavor is caramel and cereal grains. Solid for a pale lager.
Tap@Bayauex.  Gold haze with a small head. Faint malty aromas. Some sweet-bitterness. Good carbonation. In the better end of commercial beers.

It looks pretty safe in the glass though the head looks a little sticky and soapy.  The aroma is mainly of a metallic hop character with a twist of lemon.  It’s sorta dry in vaguely unpleasant kombucha way.  Overrated but not too much.

Bottle- Pours a light golden color with a fair head and some lacing. Clean aroma of fresh grain with a bit of sweetness. Has a mild malt sweetness with a bit of bitterness and a clean finish. Light body, smooth and clean. Nice balance. Better than I expected. More enjoyable than the BMC offerings. Could drink a few of these with no real problem.

At a bar on tap. Poured in a tumbler with minimal head. Very light, clear yellow with a little carbonation. Palate seemed a bit odd, soapy. But it had a light to medium roasted flavor with a hint of hoppy freshness and a dose of bitter in the aftertaste.
Bottle from Alko. Originally rated on 1.7.2009. Okay and slightly better than most bulky pale lagers, but I’m not a big fan of the style.

Presented in its own branded glass, the beer has a medium golden yellow color and a big, fluffy white head. The aroma presents only a faint combination of light grains and a bit of the flowery and musty hops that one expects from a Euro lager. The flavor is similarly light, with a bready sweetness being complemented by a mild hop bitterness that had characteristics of lemon and dirt/earth. The lightness continues through the texture, with a club-soda-like effervescence lightening the medium body. Overall, this beer is light and pleasant yet somewhat substantial, making it not quite the crisp refresher that is often desirable in the style.

0,5 l.bottle. Clear golden colour, has a thin, bubbly white head. Mild aromas of malt, and very light yeasts (the Belgian heritage?). Taste has a light bitterness. Thin mouthfeel. Good for a pale lager. Very easy to drink, this can went down very fast!
Really overrated beer its crap only would drink if ther was no other beer near me

0.66 Bottle in a frozen mug. Intense gold with generous and stable white head. Very quiet nose. Light aroma of malts, some corn. Sweet, very light short straw-hoppy finish. Dry and crisp, medium-high carbonation, light body. Flat, not exciting, not bad.
Simple beer with a medium bitter taste and a clear yellow color. An average beer that is easily consumed.
bottle in a weizen glass - pours clears yellow with lots of head that disappears quickly.  yup, it’s a lager: refreshing, quick finish, simple flavor and goes down smooth.

OVERATED and overpriced as far as beer goes. Clear pale gold with a quickly disappearing white head. Aroma is nonedescript, maybe grass and citrus. Taste is extremely mild citrus, plenty of grass. Watery mouthfeel.

A clear golden yellow with a nice white head quickly diminishes.  The aroma is hoppy with a mild citrus note, while the flavor exhibits more smooth maltiness and an almost meaty yeast taste.  As far as macros go, my favorite.
Pour crystal clear straw colour with diminishing white head. Very slight malt and dms in aroma. Balance slightly bitter taste. Generally better than I remembered. A surprisingly refreshing beer.

Thoroughly overated lager.  Nose is nonedescript. Taste is bitter, slightly citrussy and the finish is short. It’s exported worldwide as ’reassuringly expensive’ , agreed it is expensive , but there is nothing reassuring about it. It’s got a poor taste and guarantees a hangover. 
 On a side note the UK version is much worse than the Belgian one. I would give the Belgian white capped bottled version a much better rating.
Fra dåse, dufter af korn, hø.... gylden med svagt hvidt skum....... smager ok frisk, korn.... svag eftermag.... en ok pilsner....

Never tried this until I saw a brewery review on Discovery Channel.  This was a surprisingly good beer, with a creaminess in the head, very smooth palate and no bitter aftertaste.  Served in standard chilled beer mug, with light carbonation.  While not my daily beer, this is a good beer for a change from a daily beer and goes down quite smooth.  More a sipping beer in my opinion than a drinking beer.  Definitely one of my favorites when looking for something from my daily fare.
good beer with light gold colour, bitter & hops aroma, nice light foam. taste is little bit bitter and very light

Draft,  poured a golden color, lite head.  Crisp barley malt aroma, sligth grass.  Lite bitter and lite sweetness.  Lite bodied, ave carbonation.  Very smooth and crisp, refreshing.  Just a bitter nip at the end.  Good stuff.
A great session beer, but beyond that nothing else. For a mass produced brew this one impresses. When in a pinch grab some Stellas and you won’t be disappointed. Nice Tasting lager.

A medium bitter beer with a little sourness at the end. Lightly carbinated with a strong but pleasant after taste.  It’s a different but  likeable beer. Make sure it is poured into it’s special glass or the taste is not as inviting. Pouring into the glass with the perfect amount of head reveals it’s rich aroma and the taste is much better.

Süßer Geruch, süßer Antrunk. Im Mittelteil weiterhin etwas süßlich aber auch ein wenig herb. Im Nachgeschmack zum glück wenig süßlich, dafür umso herber. Das Bier kann ich mich nicht wirklich überzeugen, muss sich aber vor einigen anderen belgischen Bieren nicht verstecken. 	 
Test vom 19.2.2005, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 9,5,9,10,9,8 - 8,15

THOUGHTS: Big, special, green, holiday bottle with no label, just raised glass. I wasn’t expecting it to be good and I wasn’t disappointed. With no label it allowed way too much light in. Underlying, European, green bottle skunk flavors  and stronger in the aroma. It might be good on tap and not skunked, because there were glimmers of a decent beer, but it was hard to get past the skunk.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a clear, very light yellow with nice carbonation and an average large, white head that mostly diminished and left excellent lacing. The aroma had moderate grain, hay and straw; light to moderate herbal, grassy and metallic hops; but mostly skunk. It smelled like an old man bar with stale beer spilled long ago on the floor. The initial flavor was lightly sweet and slightly bitter; while the finish was light to moderately sweet, moderately bitter and lightly sour with a fairly short duration. There was hay, sour malt, straw, metallic hops, skunk, stale beer, old man bar, pennies, cooked corn and sulfur. The light body was watery and then a little dry with soft, nearly flat carbonation and a rather metallic finish.
Bottle. Bale brownish tan color> foamy head that fades away. Taste and smell is crisp and light. Easy drinking and light. Good for a macro brew

Appearance:  medium gold with a creamy bright white head that lingers, leaving decent lacing.  Aroma: fresh white bread, notes of cut grass, drying hay and saaz pepperyness.   Taste: buttery, slightly sweet, with good balancing notes of crisp, lively and peppery hops.   Finish: smooth and yet crisp, clean, and surprisingly dry.   Notes: I normally don’t care for mass produced pale lagers.  However, I find Stella mystifyingly enjoyable.  It’s a little fuller-bodied and more flavorful than most beers of this type.  It doesn’t set the world on fire, but it’s good in a pinch if selection is limited.
Half litre can, poured into a pint glass. Amber colour, 1 fat finger head. Pour head retention. Faint industrial lager smell. Sweetish slightly grainy taste. Goes down quite well, an ok euro lager.
Your typical pale lager. Not absolutely horrible, but not my thing. Watery, sweet corn/rice flavor.

Bright golden yellow, foamy white head fades. Sweet Euro malt taste, light grassy hop background. Light and refreshing, average carbonation. Crisp clean finish. My go-to Euro-Lagerboy nectar... I have a freezer full of Stella chalices, and  observe the proper pouring ritual... she is a thing of beauty! LF Lagerboy Friendly)

Yes, it’s a crappy, mass-produced beer, but it is probably one of the best crappy, mass-produced beers. On days when you just need a refreshing drink while watching a grand prix, having a barbeque or having a bowl of chilli that’s going to destroy the taste of other beers anyway, nothing wrong with this.
advertising works!  I was hot and thirsty and the picture looked so delicious...that golden beer with the nice head in that sweaty glass.  Oh well, it quinched my thirst but not my desire for a beer.
Terrible, taste like skunk piss!  I can’t believe how popular this beer has become.
Typical pale lager that lacks flavour and makes up for it in drinkability. Very average though

I must admit that the conditions in wich I tasted this beer weren’t optimal. It was served during a 6 days music festival in Belgium and it was draught into plastic cups. The beer was mostly flat in seconds but still it was ok. I’m sure that when I try this beer the way it was meant to be it will be much better.
Bog-standard pale lager, perhaps better ingredients than the norm, but wholly not worth its inflated price (either in the US or UA)(most recently @Martin’s, Georgetown, DC)
Bottle.  Pours a clear/lemony yellow.  Aroma is dry and very light.  Taste is clean and crisp, with a slight amount of hops, but very weak and unimpressive.  A little wheat and citrus.

This is by far my favourite beer. I love its aroma and appearance. Very appealing to drink. The taste is crisp but still holds a lot of flavour. The finish is very smooth and leaves you wanting another. Highly recommend!
corn, sugar, weak hops and malts and not much else. everything you would expect from a mass produced lager.

Probably the most popular Belgium beer, unfortunately, not one of the best.  Very sweet, has the clean, crisp flavor, almost like the “chewing gum” effect.  Not a bad beer, but tastes more like a mass produced beer more than the traditional Belgium beers.  I would buy a glass of this stuff only if there was a “special” running on it in a local bar, but would not spend the import price for it.

Though some may poo poo beer conglomerates, Stella is still a well-balanced and session worthy beer.  Pours a rich golden with egg shell head, nose is not too exciting with some sour notes and yeasty bread.  Tangy on the tongue and light but packs some nice smooth carbonation with  bready, bitter finish that stops clean on the tongue.

500ml bottle, Hungary. I think hungarian version is worse than in the other country. Here is agressive corn smell and taste. Co2 and foam is OK, but taste isn’t, beside of corny feeling there is only light hop and a short grassy aroma (luckily). Not good but quite expensive. Glass and bottle are very nice...

12 oz bottle: Pours a light yellow with a white head. Aroma is reminiscent of a typical green bottle beer; skunky version of American counterparts. Taste is crisp and refreshing but not intriguing. Palate is flat with just a hint of grassy hop.

Reviewed from notes.

The pour is a very light golden color with a slight white head and not very much lacing. The nose is some really light grain husks plus a touch of light hopping. The taste is some very light floral and earthy hops plus some mild grain. The feel is ever-so-slightly bitter with a pretty good dose of carbonation and is certainly light. Decent body, but doesn’t taste very good.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-15-2010
When i think about Stella I think about my first one , which is a good memory . Down Ocean City at the Purple Moose with my future father in - law . All together a good experience !!!

Standard European Macro green 12 oz bottle.  Pours straw hue with a large, medium white head and lively, soda like carbonation.
Aroma is Standard European Macro grassy aroma.  Light, very crisp body.  Taste is light grassy hops and bready malt.  High carbonation makes it difficult to drink.  I poured a half of the bottle down the drain.  I find it insulting to call this brew Belgian.
pours bright golden with a rocky white head, corn, grainy, light hops, dry and lightly bitter short finish. average carbonation, light body - very watery.
its nice cold in a tall glass but it lacks any real taste.  a little tool metallic. understand why it makes people wanna beat their wives.
Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is corn and light hoppy - straw. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and light bitter finish. Watery and light bodied. 310311
Bottle.  Clear golden color, small white head. Standard pale lager look. Good carbonation. Malty aroma with some hops. Sweet malty taste with a bitter end. Nothing special

Has a mild skunky corn aroma to begin with. Pours a very nice golden yellow color with active carbonation. Taste is a bitter bland and corn like. Kind of reminds me of Heineken but not as skunky.Leaves a mild bitter after taste. I’d drink a free one but I wouldn’t go out of my way for this brew.
Tastes like hominy. Smells like a corn filler on the Mississippi. Pours golden. Nice carbonation. Smooth. Easy to drink. It’s just another brew that exists but will never be remembered.
Light crystal yellow, big White head. Malty, sour nose. Crisp bite of malt flavor. Bleh.
It poured a gold color with a white head. The aroma was kind of sweet with a slight yeast flavor. The finish is rather lingering, but decent for a mass produced beer.

Bottle, poured into a weizen glass. Lightly malty aroma, undertones of bread or for some reason this beer reminds me of springtime woodlands. Gorgeous appearance , pale caramel brown-golden body, with a thin- average density. Lightly frothy head, diminishing quickly. The taste is initially slightly acidic with the suggestion of salt, very refreshing. Dominant bitter finish with a moderate duration. light body with a dry texture and reasonably lively. Mildly bitter finish, invigorating.
Poured a yellow gold with white head.  Aroma is weak notes of malt are barely present.  Flavor is a bit watery and some sweetness touch of honey.  Body is light and finishs like a sweeter light beer

(19/03/2011) draft@bar: bland cheap pale lager, middling in its category, drinkable but bland, very little taste overall but luckily there is nothing off about it //// bottle: not much difference really from the draft one, both don’t taste like much & are a bit dull, probably the first beer that I tried /////////////////// Tried again, no notes. Should prob. rate it a bit higher next time. Seeing as I have had more pale lagers now, this one is not that bad compared to the rest. Still def. not a good beer in any way.
ArOma is nonexistent. It pours with a nice head but leaves no lacing. Very thin like urine. Has a creamy mouthfeel but no actual taste. A dodgy example of a boring genre.
A good pale lager.  Nothing spectacular, but nothing offensive either.  Not much else to say about it...
An okay lager. There’s better, there’s worse... a decent ambassador for export.

Pours a clear gold with a thick frothy white head with good staying power.  There is moderate carbonation that lasts.  I notice faint floral notes and a bit of bread.  Very mild bitterness with a touch of sourness.  Not bad, not great
Bottle looks very simple, beer in the glass quite light, small head. Starts mild, but also quite dry and metallically. Finish not as intense as the beginning. Drinkable, but not really with joy...

Clear yellow pour, nice frothy white head.  Aroma has notes of some flower, grass, touch of hay and biscuit.  Taste is some bitter grass, some floral and biscuit, finishing slightly yeasty, dry and a touch bitter.  Pretty clean finish.  One of the better pale lagers, but the flavors are weak.

drank from the tap in a pint glass, better than the average pale
Lager, but still leaves one wanting for more, bitter taste, easy on the palette

22 oz, straight from the bottle.

Tolerable, drinkable, but ultimately not memorable.

Servie en fût, dans son verre éponyme, une bière d’un blond cristalin, malheureusement dépourvue de son col blanc (sa bonne effervescence me laisse présager d’une maladresse du serveur à couler la bière...).  Des arômes un peu ennuyeux de céréales et un houblonage herbacé assez standard pour une lager.  Pas de défaut de goût.  Un palais commercial "one-sised".  Servie trop froide.  Elle était, au moins, désaltérante.
You know, I must say, this is one of the better pale lagers of ANY price that my fairly inexperienced tastebuds have united with.

Smells very light, but the flavour is strong enough but not overpowering. A very clean tasting beer and well worth the extra money. Do not buy from the LCBO though because they always let them go skunky... buy a 24 in the box so it has never been exposed to light.
Yellow color with strong white head. Aroma of dough and bread, some grassy/hay undernotes. Tasts is slightly sweet and bitter.  Overall good mass produced lager.
12 oz bottle - It has a definite European aroma to it.  Good blend of malts and hops.  Not a great beer but good for a pale lager.  I had been underestimating it.
just everyday stella, better ice cold on tap. not too good from the can. the metallic taste is stronger than the brew
This is a decent beer for a macro lager, but it isn’t a great beer itself. It usually comes skunky and provides you with just a bit of grain and a micro kiss of hops.
