12 oz bottle poured into a dimpled mug- poured standard pale golden yellow, no head, extremely light carbonation.  Aroma of light malt and even a hop note.  Hits the mouth cleanly, thin body, a little malt, minimal hop detection, finish was crisp.  I wouldn’t mind having a few of these for a session.

Bottle from a sealed 12 pack so not skunked.  Very pale golden beer with thin white head.  Has typical Euro lager aroma of Pils malt, maybe some spicy hop notes and a twinge of DMS.  Taste is the same.  Too carbonated with very thin mouthfeel.  Now what the hell am I going to do with the other 11 bottles?
Quaffable and crisp, but not memorable.  Decent flavor and aroma - standard for European lagers in the USA.  Doesn’t have the skunky flavor of other European beers in green bottles.

12oz bottle, best before June 08.  Pours very light, pale, transparent yellow with a surprisingly small white head with poor retention.  Bubbles form a circle around the rim and disappear.  Aroma is fairly standard pilsner though not especially appealing.  Beery, malty.  Taste is clean, crisp, no discernable hop or malt characteristics, watery with a non-existant finish. Light body. This is not bad like most other pale lagers but it lacks just about anything you could call good.  Mediocre at best.

this is one of my favorite beers... it pours like a fine champagne and is smooth a silk, very refreshing after a long day.. only downside is it smells kinda weak.  but it’s nice, never gave me a hangover and give me a nice clean buzz.

I was very egar to try this beer.  However I was majorly disapointed.  Seemed like a very strange beer.  Bitter, light in color, and did NOT meet my expectations.  Seems like it gets a bit too much praise for what its really worth.
Not a bad beer altogether.  Tastes of grass, and very light malt.  Aroma has the same bite as the taste.  One of my more favorable lagers.  I’d make the purchase again if I had to buy a lager.

Pours brilliant gold, with average head, nice lacing.

Smells of grass, and a bit of lemon. Almost sour.

High carbonation, not much, if any euro-skunk detected. Floral start, but not bitter. Near the end, I picked up a slight bit of graininess. Actually very refreshing, I could myself drinking a couple of these with no problem.

Not my favorite style, but, all in all, a nice macro-euro-lager.

Poured piss yellow with little head that quickly faded. Smelled like skunk and tasted skunky. I was reluctant to try this beer because of reading past ratings. Overall a pretty crappy beer and would never drink again.
(Belgium) Strong Aroma, Nice Gold color, sm-med Head!!  Bitter taste, but not bad.
One of the worst smelling beers I have ever sniffed. Not a horrible taste more like a refreshing drink of water
On tap, this was like an American macro without the bitter finish. I suppose it would be a good Summer session beer.
pretty average beer that i will drink and dont mind but nothing exciting.  a lot like st pauli and becks pale lagers.
botella. comprada en supermercado. mejor que sus similares. Para tomar seguido.

Best By Date September 2008; Sampled January 2008

Pours with a frothy, fat-one-finger thick, pale, actually nearly perfectly with colored head.  The beer is a brilliantly clear, bright gold color.  Aromas of sweet grain, grassy malt, faintly lemon-like and slightly herbal hop notes as well as a faint note of stale soda crackers.  The aroma is fairly light, but seems clean overall.



This was served at about 40°F (5°C), which causes this well carbonated beer to have a peppery carbonic acid bite to it up front.  Crisp, and clean up front with a biting bitterness that easily cuts through the light malt character here.  The hop bitterness picks up a bit of herbal hop character to it as it moves towards the finish.  The malt character starts out pretty dry and really nonexistent, but picks up a soft grain-like sweetness and a touch of cracker-like malt by the time one gets to the finish.  This is very clean and at this temperature has not off flavors.  Quite crisp and refreshing actually, but I’ll admit that when I am in need of crisp and refreshing I usually opt for water.  This is certainly not a bad beer, if they had only used a quirky, Belgian yeast this might actually be quite tasty.
yellowish pour with a big foamy head. has the skunk aroma. nothing offensive yet nothing really enjoyable either.

Lump this in with Becks, St Paulii, etc as an import that goes for a couple of dollars more but is nothing more than a BMC retread.  Please do not confuse Pilsner Urquell with this beer as they are not even close to being the same beer even though they claim to be from Belgium and are usually the same price.  Pours a light color gold with a non-lasting small head.  Minimal aroma and taste.  Just very bland

This was gift from Bob Archer, President of Blue Ridge Beverage Distributors.  It is good lager.  It has some bitterness at the finish.  The color is a clear straw and modest head with lacing.  This is good beer to enjoy on a hot evening on the back deck.

Bottle.  Poured pale gold with a thick white foamy head.  Some skunk in the aroma, a reason why beer should not come in green bottles.  Solid malty flavour.  Maltish finish with a bit of bitterness.  Genuine, it’s a pasteurised Euro macro-lager, but it’s a worthy example of the breed.

Bottle into Stella-branded stem glass.  Poured a decent 1.5 finger head, which is about the only thing to commend this brew.  The color is a toxic yellow.  The mouthfeel is almost a burning sensation that left me wanting to brush my teeth between sips.  Very bitter with a noxious aftertaste.  Described as skunky in the past and I see no reason to go against that assessment.  Basically, this beer mocks the  hipster doofus who favors it with each sip.  The idea that some people think themselves advanced because they drink a Belgian beer when drinking Stella is sad, very sad.  In the end, this beer embodies everything that kept me from drinking beer for years.

There’s a Stella billboard in Philadelphia that says "Quality has it’s price." This statement is true. But it has nothing to do with Stella Artois. Inferior to water in the following categories: colour, taste, and flavour. It’s rather popular with the recently graduated crowd, and I’ve tried it on a couple of occasions, and never finished a bottle. Somehow watery and metallic at the same time. 

If I had a choice between drinking Stella and nothing, I’d choose nothing. And I don’t mean "drinking nothing" I mean in the grand contest of drinking stella vs. nonexistence, I’d choose nonexistence.

Pours pale golden w/ a solid head and good persistant lacing. Aromas of vanilla malted beer. Lght nectar w/ ample carbonation. Flavors of beer predominate this brew. Nuances of vanilla and citrus. The finish is bittered peacefully w/ no offensive nuances.
Pours nice into a golden color with some white head.  Refreshing with a bit of hops toward the end.

Smells like a skunk covered in urine.  Looks clean, but so does Beast.  Tastes line a Keystone thats been out in the sun for an hour.  Only skunky flavor remains after a few seconds.  I hope only bad people waste their money on this.

A Mes rate, there is no way in the world Sim would be daft enough to drink this.
Actually, I wasn’t daft enough to drink it either. We had a late night at work on Friday so my co-worker nipped to the shop to buy beer. He came back with a nice bottle of Malbec, this and some Fosters Ice. I stuck with the Malbec obviously but as this was opened I sneaked a rating in. Utter shite from the biggest threat to all that we hold so dear. Smut peddling, mediocrity pushing motherfunking scumbags. I don’t know if it’s the same in the rest of the world but the strapline on the adverts here in England is... wait for it... "Reassuringly Expensive." God’s honest truth. That’s how they sell this putrid filth. "Reassuringly Expensive." Basically, "We are going to sell you shit at inflated prices, we are even going to point out the prices are inflated, and you lot are going to drink it, because we know you are allllllll thick as pig shit." Cock off Inbev, you are the Starbucks of the beer world and the devil in disguise. Go on, rate a crap beer, chances are it’s an InBev owned company. Die InBev DIE!

I think I have placed my hat firmly in the ring at this point...
Bottle, yellow and white head. little malty and hops aroma. not interresting beer.
gold with a thick white head.  Flavor and aroma are simple yeast/malt/hop.  Boring yet easily drinkable and clean.  Decent.

Wifebeater indeed. The ultimate in marketing; how did InBev convince so many patrons of high-end beer bars in the US to pay $7.00 a glass for what is essentially stale Budweiser? This beer is a typical low-end Euro lager; no more no less. If you find yourself at that new pub with all the dark wood inside (you know the one) and are expected to pay premium prices at least go for the Hoegaarden tap. It is sure to be there.

~1/2 inch white head. Clear yellow beer. Looks like Bud Light.
~Earthy hop aroma. Yeasty
~Almost taste like a Pilsener. A sweet malty taste with light hops.
~Light, abrupt finish. 
~Not bad, but not that good either. Pretty watery.

Bottle. A clear golden yellow beer with a small but nice white head. Full of carbonation as the submerged bubbles stick to the glass when poured. The aromas are quite wheaty and vegetable-like. All I can think of when drinking this is: corn, which doesn’t much appeal to me in a beer. There’s not a great deal beyond that as there’s very little bitterness or variety in general. Bland and fizzy - not for me but potentially refreshing on the right day.
Grown on me over the years. Yes there is that roundness in mouth. Enjoy it frequently and wouldn’t knock it back if you offered me one.
Hoppy aroma and the flavour is full and nicely balanced, round with a nice bitterness. It’s a nice pilsner. (Very early rating and very short - sorry)
very pale, unattractive beer to drink. better than most other beers available in italy but still not very good. watered down hoppy aroma and a bit too fizzy
Golden yellow with nice head.  Straightforward.  Smooth and clean euro lager; mild sweet aftertaste.
Thin, watery, slightly skunky in the example I’m reviewing.  A bit of yeasty taste along with a modest hop/lager character.  A good beer before a manicure.

Pours pale yellow and smells unpleasant...Taste is decent, definitly better than most other things I can get in my city. While I kind of enjoy the taste, I find myself becoming sick of drinking it after my third bottle. Unimpressive but better than the crap(Bud & Coors) that everyone else around here drinks.

Pours a very pale yellow (similar to say miller lite....right there a sign it is a rather unfortunate beer/unfortunate experience). Seriously, smell is a bit urine like. A thick white head that soon dissipates, like many people’s balls for drinking this, or ordering it in public. Taste is plain, "clean" if you will, with light hops. A pretty bland beer. Perfect for the person who thinks they drink good beer just because it has a foreign name.
Bottle. Pours a pale yellow with a white head. Light hops aroma. Taste is clean with a nice hop bite in the finish. Refreshing. Not a bad lager at all.

11.2 ounce bottle. Pours a very light yellow with a very small white head that disappears quickly. Contained a good amount of carbonation. Smells of bread, light hops, and skunk. Taste was nothing special... hint of malt with a bitter hop aftertaste. A very easy to drink beer, but definitely nothing to get excited about.
On tap. Pours a light golden with good sized white head. Aroma and taste is moderately hoppy and clean. Good session beer that you can get at most bars.
Nice euro style lager.  Not two much fizz which can be a problem with lagers.  Fllavor  is liight in hops and mouth is watery.
Green bottle.......therefore a little skunky.  Overall it’s easy drinking, a little flat, but a little citrus and hops in there.  I can think of other worse things to drink.
pours crystal clear,gol white head,grainy nose slight skunk notes,grainy slight hop finish.after retrying this beer I used to like this now It seems very flat and not very good.
nice euro lager, straw yellow, malty with slight hop nose, crisp refreshing session beer, dry finish
Nice color, head seems lost when taken from a tap versus a bottle. A very good session beer - easy to drink.
A good pale lager, and accessible anywhere around me.  Good overall flavor, favored by many of my friends.
your most availabe Belgium beer, the most recognizable in the U.S.  good b.c it is always the better alternative, but independently not so great.

Bottle. Brewed in belgium, BBE 07.2008. Had this brew multiple times over the years and wife picked up a 18 pack of Belgium beer from Costco and it had a sixer of this so I figured I rate it. Pours a pale yellow with thin white head. Aroma is slightly papery and lightly doughy with notes of hops. Flavor is moderately sweet, maybe a hint of cardboard and pale malt, but with a fairly decent bitter hop flavor through to the finish which has some metallic flavors along with the hops and grass. This bottle is much better than the last one I had on draft, however it’s just not either too good or too refreshing so I try to avoid it for the most part.
Bottle: Not good at all.  However, I think that the beer that I had was a little skunky.  Bitter and bland.

Invited to friend’s Christmas part who have fridge well stocked with this product. Pours a clear golden pale brew with a fast dissolving white head. Aroma of light bready malt, some citrus zest and a touch of vegetable. Taste is light bodied, well-carbonated with a bready malt flavor with a hint of citrus. Finish is slightly watery and gritty and then a clean cut and crisp flavor.

Nice golden color, decent head for a pale lager, leaves nice lacing when it goes away.    Aroma is of mild hops, as is the flavor.  Enjoy this beer with a meal in the correct glass.  Better from the bottle than on tap in my opinion.
draught. Clear golden colour. Hoppy and malty, slightly watery. Not bad but rather boring.
The head dissipates quickly.  A decent beer which reminds me of Heineken.

Bottle. Yellow-colored with big bubbly white head that disappears rather quick. A quite usual "not-much" pale lager aroma with some graininess and faint notes of grassy hops. Sweetish flavor with some malt and very light bitterness in the finish. Light-bodied with a watery mouthfeel.

Bottle->shaker: Pours an average, but creamy head with good lacing and a clear light yellow body. Has a hay-like malty aroma, flowery hops, and perhaps some raisin or pair in the aroma.  The body is thin, light and no carbonation with a short duration and a lightly bitter flavor with a fruity resonance.  Not a horribly beer, but Belgian in name only, IMO.
Bottle. Pours light yellow with a white head. Hoppy aroma. Flavour is hoppy as well. Some cereal and grassy notes. Mildly bitter finish. 27-12-07.

Aroma is very faint with a touch of skunk.  Color is bright gold with an average head.  Flavor comes on a light body with a light corn like malt flavor and mild bitterness.  After taste seems to have a slight plastic taste to it.  I would not drink it again unless I had no choice.
Pours a light golden color with a decent amount of head. Much too carbonated for my taste. Not enough body with a bitter taste. Probably my highest rated pale lager. Why do I even drink them?

Pours out ok,light gold colour,aromas are mild if any.Carb is over the top,it,s more like a bottle of bubbly than lager or pils,not to my liking one bit.Taste is wiped out as well with too much carb.It just isn,t beer to me.

Pours a clear golden color with a small head that dissipates and leaves a bit of lacing. Smell is slightly floral. Taste has some fruit tastes in it, very clean and crisp. Mouthfeel is thin with a decent amount of carbonation. Pretty drinkable, better than an average macro, nothing to get excited about. One more note, I didn’t find this beer to be as bad as some other people and it’s a decent beer, but not necessarily worth the price.

12 oz. bottle. Nondescript aroma and appearance, with a bitter taste. Its not bad for a single drink but after one its hard to withstand a second. That being said, its not a terrible palate and its widely available around the world. Accompany this beer with a tasty food or better yet mix it with cider to make a snakebite.
Bottle. Thin, light.  Pale lager or not, this is boring. I hope Belgium have better beers than this.
This is being brewed in australia now and has become quite affordable. Typical european character and overall a decent beer
Bottle. Pours moderately dark golden with a small white head. Aroma and flavor are light semi-sweet malt with a hint of hops. Good for a pale lager.

Smells light and grassy with strong bitter hop notes, nice for a pale lager. Pours a clear light golden color with a small white head with some lacing. Taste is quite generic, like the mass-produced beers, but is good. Very nice pale lager.
A decent beer, but has a bit of a bitter aftertaste.  I liked it though, would have another one.
Bottle and draft.  Pours a medium golden color, head was big, rocky and white.  I used to think this was the best beer on earth.....untill I developed a pallet.
Its an okay beer, I like it’s bitterness but the after taste just doesn’t taste great. Drink it with something salty!

Tap. Light aromas of hay, herbs and barnyard. Head is big, fizzy, white, is mostly lasting and has excellent lacing. Color is sparkling clear yellow. Flavor starts lightly acidic and finishes moderately bitter. Palate is light, dry and has a lively carbonation (I remember the bottle has a more fizzy carbonation). A drinkable beer but a bit bland.

The beer pours well. It is pale golden color with a frothy white foam head.  It has a mild pilsen hop aroma with a slight malt odor.  The flavor is watery hop bitter, tart, with little malt carrying through.  There is a mouth puckering feel that seems to coat the mouth and teeth.  Altogether, better than most of the American made pale lagers, but not my favorite style.  This beer would be best on a hot day and drunk at very low temperature.

66 cl bottle. A clear pale blond beer with a medium sized but disappearing white head. Quite weak aroma, but there are shy traces of hops. The flavour is not greatly balanced between sweet and bitter, but you can find much worse. Light to medium body, lively/fizzy carbonation, short finish with light bitterness. I couldn’t finish the whole bottle alone.

Bottle. Light golden color, fluffy white head, a lot of fizz, watery body.  Little to know aroma, slight beer smell.  Short beginning with little to no flavoir with a lot of fizz.  Middle draw is long ending with a medium bitter after taste.  Clean crisp distinct flavors.  Refreshing light beer.  Excellant summer beer as it is not a light beer but taste like one.

Freebie following argo0’s holiday party.  Thanks, Aaron!  Pours a clear, pale golden color; white head with solid medium-bubbled lacing.  Not much of anything in the aroma, really; mostly minerals and a metallic note; barely there and relatively inoffensive.  Crisp and light citrus bitterness at the tip of the tongue; good levels of carbonation, and that’s about all; basically just a simple sugar core with nothing surrounding it; a light show of mineral bitterness at the edges.  This would be much better with some actual Belgian character (a hint of biscuit or esters, please?).  But no.  Light, rough mineral bitterness and sugar in the finish; slightly metallic.
A classic lager.  One of my favorites. Refreshing flavor.  Not too intense.  I named my dog after this beer.

Light and very gassy, very commercial and overrated belgian lager thats probably being brewed somewhere in Kent. Chavs like it. I try to stay away from it. In the old days if i was like drinking stella it ment that im trying to sober up a bit.

33cl bottle from Systembolaget.   Pilsner yellow with a firm white head.   As I was expecting, the aroma was skunky due to the green bottle and not much care taken to keep it out of light, but there is also a crisp hoppiness underneath that puts it above the typical pale lager.   The flavor is light and crisp, with more hop bitterness than is typical, and some sweetness from the malt too.   Overall, pretty clean flavor.   Light and a little watery on the palate, with lively and abrasive carbonation.   Definitely not my favorite beer, but it’s one of the more interesting and drinkable examples of the style that I’ve had.
UK version 1 pint draught rated. Typical mass market eurofizz all appearence & little substance. Pale lager with large white head & a lingering effervesence that makes it way too fizzy for my taste.

Pours typical lager color with minimal head - interestingly enough, when I held up to the light, couldn’t see much action regarding carbonation bubbles rising to top - but the beer wasn’t flat - solid all around brew, I was a bit surprised at the overall rating given by others - I thought this was on par with the ’crafts’ put out by the big boys (e.g. Blue Moon) while priced about the same...

Hallo buttercup, how goes the skunking? I don’t know if this beer is always skunky, but mine was and it was miserable. Light sour hops is the only non pheremone quality that is detectable. This beer is worse than bud light.

12 ounce bottle.  Pale gold, nice rocky head, classic label.  A lightly bitter lager, a bit watery with a tingly hop finish.  A decent light lager.  For some reason - the girl’s name perhaps? - this beer is very popular with New York women.  I remember having this on tap in Brussels in the 1980s, in a glass with a brass lip, and that was great - a lot better than the bottle I rated here.

lot of flavor but still refreshing.  Nothing outstanding about it, but not mad i paid a little extra for it.  doesn’t taste like it has any rice or corn...  still higher alcohol percentage than a bud or others in the category.  I had a full sail pale lager and I’d MUCH rather have stella.  over all good when you are thirsty and want something that tastes good.  Re-reading my original review, I’m going to buy another tomorrow!
!
Not as carbinated and bland as most pale lagers.  Full taste for the genre makes this one one of the best of the bunch.  Better than the big three and one of my favorites in this category.

this is probably the best rating i’ll ever give this style.  basically a better than normal pale lager.  has more of a sweet aroma, better taste, more to it than your big name PL’s (bud, miller, pabst, coors, etc.).  hey, i’d choose it over budweiser.  fizzy mouthfeel.  quick finish.  light.  eh.

UK version (4.8%)...... Bright yellow colour, no head. Corn malt taste. Very sweet and gassy.      Belgian version.... 
For a lager this is full on flavour as well as being easy to drink. There’s a metallic edge to it but overall it’s quite good 426311 = 2.6
Classic pale lager, good all around beer to have with pizza, chicken fingers, or simply to just chill out. Little bit of grass, smooth, has some body and not too light...just right.

Eh, a little better than the typical lager. Golden yellow color, quickly diminishing white head. Not much aroma, but taste is a little heavier and lingers a little longer than most pale lagers. Would recommend.

Pours a golden yellow with a white head that diminishes rather quikley to a bit of white film. The aroma is a bit weak, with some grass and hops. The flavour is a bit sweet with touch of honey, that keeps the bitterness in the background, not as balanced as it should be, but still not bad. Refreshing and drinkable if nothing else.

This has been fiercely slagged by a lot of reviewers, and not just on RB. One woman I met referred to it as "The European Budweiser." I have had Stella before, but to rate it I got a pint from the tap in a local bar (for $4.00--ouch). It came with a thin head that sank fairly fast. The body was a very clear gold. Aroma wasn’t bad, but there was little of it--quite neutral, I thought. The flavor was in keeping with the aroma: well balanced, I suppose, but nothing distinctive about it. Palate was medium-thin. I didn’t notice any nastiness in the tail. The kick was sneaky and more powerful than I expected, but that could have been the effect of the Duvel I drank just before I had this. Not bad, really, but not good in any very memorable way. I’d rate it about even with Heineken. It doesn’t deserve the "European Budweiser" tag and it would make a good session beer, but I would really rather have a Ballantine instead.

On tap. One of my favorite lagers on draft. Nice and crisp, no funky skunky smells and nice white fluff heads typical of Belgian brews. Drank 3, sang Steely Dan’s Black Cow on the Kareoke machine. Went home. A good night!

Bottle. Had this over in England. Thought I’d retry it here. Overall, similar to the typical American lager in color, head and aroma. It stands above the others in that it has some flavors of malt and a tinge of acidity that bites. This is a decent as far as pale lagers go.
ok beer... aroma and appereance very similar and reminded to corona not bad with a slice of pizza
Draft, pale yellow color with not much head.  Not much aroma or flavor.  It was very light to drink, not one I would normally order.
Fresh, slightly bitter and yeasty smell.  Medium pale gold.  Flavor is well balanced, decently  hoppy and finishes bitter.  Decent yeast flavor as well.  Pretty good and easy to find pale lager.
Paly gold pour with a white head, not much aroma, maybe a lsight sazz boquet. Thin, ligh flavor, not moyuc there, alternative to mega swill

From Bottle:   This beer has a pale  yellow color.  Has flavor starts fruity but quickly turns to a bitter finish.  I’m not a huge fan of pale lagers (especially in November) but this one isn’t bad.  Got if from a local store in a Pick Six, and I’ll grab some this summer.

Aroma/Malty-light,
Appearance Head/Initial-small, Head/Color white,
Body/Hue-medium,
Initial Flavor-bitter light
Finish Flavor-bitter light
Palate/Body-light
beer
Draft @ Bubba Gumps. Very good pale lager. Disappointing head but very clean taste. Recommend.

Alla spina allo Sherlock’s di Praga. Pale Lager normalissima, senza infamia e senza lode. Soliti sapori metallici, ma più sopportabili che in altre birre del genere. Tutto sommato è fra le più sopportabili delle lager commerciali.

Rated while drinking: Pours a pale flax with crystal clarity, and a small white head with decent lacing. A bit of skunk on the nose with maybe some hop bitterness and cereal. Taste has some skunk in there as well, but finishes with the flavor of baked bread. A bit harsh on the tongue, but watery as well. It’s OK, but I would probably only reach for it if everything else in the fridge was an American macro.

On tap at the Sanctuary In Iowa City. Pours very clear pale golden with a medium head. Grainy, corny aroma with no skunk. Flavor has notes of grain, corn, some lemon and a solid amount of hop bitterness to balance it out. Medium body with a smooth texture and lively carbonation. Decent head retention. Not great but far from the worst thing I’ve ever had.

Pours a very light golden color with a thin white head. Almost no carbination is visible through the glass. It smells a bit like a fruity lager.  It tastes like a green bottle beer; a little skunky. Other than that the taste is a little innocuous. It has a bit of a thick almost wheaty feel in the mouth.
Bottle - minimal aroma.  OK, I just can’t do this.  It is Belgian Budweiser.  What a shame that this beer is even known
Classic taste, almost predicably so. Refreshing but distinct at the same time, vaguely buttery in its smoothness.
Medium, tight, white head with a light aroma that invites you in.  Flavor is smooth and deep.
One of the best. Classic european lager. Refreshing but with taste and character. Very nice palate.

on tap at the Fox Theater during the Ben Harper show.  pleasantly surprised with this one.  virtually no aroma to mention... however, the beer flows nicely over the tongue with a bit of carbonation and light hoppy notes.  the finish is nice.  I don’t get any skunky qualities like so many others who have rated this... maybe it’s just better on tap.... or I feel it’s okay to like something that is commonly available.  very drinkable.
Light to medium amber color, thin white head. Nose is slightly hoppy, slighty malty. Not very interesting. Light bodied and bitter on the tongue. Not very good.
This beer is light and virtually flavorless. It tastes much like Rolling Rock.
Bottle. Nasty. Skunky bubbles, leaves a sickly aftertaste. I wish I hadn’t payed for this beer.

Bottle, 25 cl. Pale yellow colour with a white head. Aroma bit hops. Thin body. Taste is dry, watery, clean beer.
normal pilsener.

Draft. Pours light golden with smallish white head.  Aroma of skunk, and some corn. First sip, a bit skunky, then hoppy, then finishing with corn on the cob. Feels very carbonated, and watery. After the corn flavor disappears, not much left. I knew I should have tried the miller light instead.
Smells hoppy and skunky. Better on tap than in a bottle. Light yellow tone. Refreshing and bitter. Packaged fancier than it actually is.
A pretentious megalager.  Tastes like a combination of corn and metal.  At least the goblet looks nice on a shelf.
People seem to love this beer.  Can’t tell you why.  Must be all the francophiles who are full of shit anyway.

Pours yellow with a medium head. First impression of aroma is very skunky. After that passes, it settles into corn and hops. The taste is much hoppier than most lagers. Caramel and prune malts are also prominent. Light, easy to drink. Slightly dry. Heavy bodied for a lager.
Bottle. Fancy advertisements and good with roasts. Expensive compared to other beers that are just as good or even better.

Not really what I expected.  SInce its served in a fancy glass, I was thinking I would get a fancy beer.  But not really.  It’s good.  The aroma and flavor are better than other mass produced lagers, but there’s nothing here that makes me jump for joy.  The beer taste itself has a slightly bitter kick to it, but goes down smoothly.  I think that maybe since the alcohol content is a little higher than normal, that after a few of these everything feels better.  Try it.  Why not?
Light yellow color, white head (as if there is any other with a pale lager).  Rather carbonated.  Bad tasting hops and a lame skunk odor.  I don’t understand the love.

Reminds me of a fancy budweiser with some other pale lager qualities. These yellow, highly carbonated foamy drinks are just not my version of a good beer. This is above the rest because it has some sweet hints of honey in the aroma and flavor giving it some complexity. Doesn’t taste of cardboard like the cheap ones, but not a lot better.

Smells faintly of hops.  Pours pale yellow with a white head that dissipates quickly.  Light tasting malt with an even milder hop aftertaste.  The hops don’t mask the malt sweetness very well.  A decent refreshment that goes down well.  A little lacking in the flavor department, but I have come to expect nothing more from a widely avaliable pale lager.

Light piss yellow with some form of a head.  Mostly disappears.  Smells, unsurprisingly, like malt, not corn!  I mean, there’s some laced in there, for the sake of being interesting, but not nearly as much as I expected.A bit sweet too.  A light fruity, almost vanilla fragrance to it.   Thin and watery, duh.  With a bit too much fizz, but still kind of creamy for this style.  A light sweetness laces this, reminding me of Red Stripe.   But the corn flavor just isn’t there!  A bit of grass, to slightly peppery hops.  Lingering dryness.  A bit creamy, a slightly bland blah flavor in the finish.  A bit herbal in the hops, or is that skunk?  anyhow, it’s decent enough up front, and not totally gross on the end.  I mean, this is the lowest common denominator on beer.  this is probably the least beer-like thing I’d consider drinking on my own.  Still, prolly not buying this.  (didn’t this time!)

In terms of pale lagers, you really can’t complain about Stella Artois. It still sucks in relation to just about any other style, but the ingredients are heads above any BMC lagers. The taste is, as a result, sweeter, cleaner, and, obviously, not as adjunct-laden (grassy, rotten, or otherwise gross). I can see forking over a little extra cash for a Stella if my options are limited to widely distributed beer.

330ml bottle.
Pours a golden yellow with a fair white head. Fades a little fast. Aroma seems very faint but that might just be me. Medium-thin body with soft carbonation. Taste is sweet with a little hoppy bitter finish. Very simple beer, but still good. Leaves a little to be desired.

Bottle: Stella Glass.
Very pale golden colour with a pristine white head. Great gossamer lacing on the glass that looks great. Aroma is strong  one the hops side of it. 
Dryish taste, not very appealing, very watery tasting, a good thirst quencher on a hot day.. or after sport in a quick down, not one to savour. A bit sour with a bitter edge on the after taste. A very clean beer, but not the best around. I used to like this one until I got a bit more cultured.

Bottle...fluffy white head and golden body...aroma: sour yeastiness + orange rind thats sat on the counter all day....clean---nice body for a pale....lingering aftertaste...nice nice and well just nice

Pours a watery yellow color with no head.  Smells like water and tastes like water.   Not very offensive but on the other hand its not possible to be very good if it tastes like nothing more than slightly carbonated water.

This is not bad and it’s drinkable, but it is not very good and is quite bland.  I tried it on tap at McNear’s in Petaluma and it was really cold at first, making it almost impossible to taste.  Thus, the start was very bland.  As it warmed, I noticed more aroma, flavour, some body and depth, and a slight bitterness in the finish.  Overall it was boring and very bland and watery but not bad or unpleasant.  It was also extremely bubbly and carbonated, more so even than other similar beers, and this detracted.  It was golden with a decent head.  

Deciding to revisit this, I got it in a bottle and had it ncely cool, not ice cold, and the difference was marked.  My new rating reflects what this beer really should be like: a solid, good light lager that, while not really a quality pislner, is nicely on the hoppier side for macro-lagers and quite enjoyable if fresh and ot ice cold.  It has a nice perfumy lager aroma of grain, flowers, juniper and a bit of sulphur - a definite European quality to it, which I like.  The taste is light grain, herbs and juniper with a definite light bitterness - more bitter than Heineken or Grolsch, a bit tingly, and a light bitterness in the finish.  It also has a light soapy quality but just enough to remind one that this is a basic macro lager.

I was not really impressed or disappointed with this one.  It’s lager, but there was absolutely no distinguishing taste from any other lager that I’ve tried.  Overall it was crisp and went down easy, but I was looking for a little more.

Amazing.  I had this when i was in Leuven, Belgium.  Everyone that I spoke to in europe said that this is the best beer in the world.  I agree with that statement.  It has a higher alcohol content than most other beers and it has a great taste.  I am very impressed!  If you haven’t tried this beer, I would recommend it.
I was not impressed at all. The bartender said this beer was French at first but it’s not obviously. It’s seriously missing flavor.
Alright for a light lager. Goes down easy and finishes clean. Like so many of its counterparts however, it is rather bland and unfufilling.

It’s OK.  I had this at Oktoberfest in Helen.  It looks like urine and has a white head.  Taste is allright, but not impressive.  For a pale Lager it was better than most though.  Drank this out of a shaker.
A great Summer beer which is easy to drink.  Smooth beer with a simple wheat color and a nice aftertaste.

Fairly poundable, I thought I would try this since it is one of the "imports" at my favorite bar.  I can see why it is so popular, kind of the new heineken at the bar.  Thankfully mine was not skunky and as such imparted little flavor.
Golden colour that is slightly clear.  Has a slightly bitter kick to it.  Has a bit of body to it, but nothing that is filling.  Very enjoyable with a meal or for drinking while relaxing.

Couleur paille, claire, mousse plutôt compacte s’estompant peu à peu, laissant un lacet, trace légèrement le verre. Arôme sucré, agrémenté du houblon légèrement. Goût sucré et malté, suivit d’amertume, finale plutôt sèche, amertume bien présente en finale. Effervescence plutôt forte, corps mince. Somme toute un bonne pale lager, j’aime beaucoup.

Pale yellow/gold body with bubbly white head.  Aroma is pale malts and comes off slightly skunky.  Light body with some sweet and bitter flavors.  Tends to finish on the dry side with a light bitter bite.
i Bought this after seeing Johnny Knoxville drinking it.  Nasty All i have to say.  Buy Becks or Heineken.  Skunky dry oh man.  I wanted to buy a gallon of ice cold water.

Draught.  Outside of the pretty glass this beer doesn’t have much to offer.  Skunky nose, pale color and little body.  If you see someone drinking this beer at a pub, most likely they like the pretty glass.  Common consumers are Eurotrash and Eurotrash wanna be’s.
Perfect beer.  Couldn’t complain if this was the only beer available.  Has an awesome aroma, appearance, flavor, palate and overall flavour.
green bottle beer, golden color. too skunky to really enjoy. definately would not try this beer again
I was talking about Belguim beer one day with a friend and they just assumed i was talking about stella. how sad.
Rather floral, and more bitter than I expected.  Some grainy/bread malt, well balanced, and well made.  A cut above most macros.
pale straw color, with a thick, white, creamy head.  Light malt aroma, with a little bit of off "skunk" aroma.  Light and a little tangy.  Not too sweet.  Fairly dry finish.
First beer I had when I was in Belgium. Brewed in Leuven, great city. Beer is nothing bad, nothing really special. Good beer to drink. Clear and light.
Smells of barnyard, golden, clear, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, light body, overall more than ok beer.
[Sampled at Charlottes day.] Brought home from La Roche this was just to taste some belgo pilsner. Clear fluid and not bad, just a little refreshing and forgetable!

On tap numerous time, pale golden color with dense white foam that actually leaves nice lacing.  Aroma is very pale malts with an ever so slight note of hops, little hints of cooked veggies.  Flavor is slightly sweet with noticeable bitterness in the finish and more cooked veggie notes.  Overpriced euro swill.

I’ve sampled this several times, most recently from a six pack of bottles.  Pours a clear golden color with a foamy white head.  A slightly sweet, smooth taste with a hint of bitterness at the finish.  Best served ice cold.
Pretty good beer with a smooth taste.  i actually tried this at Ruby Tuesdays.  It was draft.  It would have been very good in  a frosted mug.
On tap at a local restaurant with a really bad selection of beers.  Clear pale yellow with a fluffy white head.  Malty aroma and taste, but left me wondering why it still really had no taste?

Draft at Brixx. Poured extremely thin yellow straw, smell of corn, malt, and skunk. Mild flavor of a light pilsner with a strange, unwelcome sourness in the aftertaste. It went down smooth if more fizzy than I’d like, but wasn’t as refreshing as a cheap macro with that unpleasant aftertaste. I’m not sure why anyone buys this one.

Date: 10/27/2002

Mode: Draft

Source: Summits - Sandy Springs



Clear yellow, light malt aroma and flavor, clean, just a hint of bitterness for balance



Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20

Rating: 2.6/5.0
Score: **/4

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

Bottle 0.33. Brewed licensed in Zagrebacka pivovara. Pale yellow with small head. Some wheat aroma with maybe citrus hops. Medium flavor, sometimes maybe in direction of slightly bitter. Thin texture and moderate carbonation at the finish. Beer just the high average.

Had on tap. It was pretty tasty. Yellowish, a little on the bitter side. Good if served cold and consumerd before it warms too much. I’ll have again while I’m out, but don’t think that I’ll ever buy a sixer for the fridge.
As for most on tap beers you can get around here, this is usually much better.  Pours a nice head, golden color, hoppy, fruity taste.    Nicely served in 50cl chalice.
Bottle.  Golden, clear.  Sweet and a little hoppy.  I’ve had this in a few different bottles and on tap, and the taste definitely varies, but hell, drink up any way.

On tap at Waldo Pizza, in Lees Summit. Pours a clear light yellow with a thin white head. Grainy and bready pale malt with a light citrus hop backing. Light to medium-bodied and creamy smooth, it finishes clean and slightly bitter; pretty nice for a pale lager. The flavor follows the nose almost to a "T" but it seriously degrades with time. This one, like most pale lagers, becomes awful if allowed to warm. Drink it quickly.

Saying this beer is overrated is an understatement, but that’s what an advertising budget is made for, I suppose! Not a bad beer by any means, but certainly nothing special. Typical Euro lager profile, perhaps a bit more hoppy than others. Colour is almost nonexistent. Worth having every now and then, but how this beer manages to survive at its price point baffles me.
A very nice strong lager, have tried from 440ml, 500ml, 568ml cans andfrom various bottles also from tap in various pubs.

(Bottle) Pours a golden color with a dense white head. Decent body and relatively high carbonation. Very similar to many Euro lagers. A good example of the style, but a little too sweet for my tastes.
STELLA! STELLLLLLLAAAAAAA!! Ah shit it aint a Street Car Named Desire. Not too bad for a Belgium brew. Has a decent aroma, hoppy, medium carbonation and a sweet bitter finish.

19% ?
Wow, pretty savage score for a pretty good beer.  I dont’ understand the negativity.  It’s a solid pale lager with a but more sweetness and hoppiness at the finish.
what do these negative reviewers think they are drinking.
My only complaint, it’s a bit pricy for what  you are drinking

A clear golden brew with a foamy white head. I’ve had this beer in many different places and from cans, bottles  and on tap, and I find wide differences. When it’s good it is refreshingly sweet with a mild hoppyness, the taste is clean and good. Other times though it can taste much more like a average Pale Lager type.
Pretty standard. Perhaps a little more bitter than most lagers. Can pour nicely and the aroma is swell. Edit: slight downgrade, cause c'mon, it's freakin' Stella.

Uhhhhhhh... not much to say about this stock standard lager really. Admittedly it’s usually a better alternative to the array of awful Australian lagers on tap, but hard to get past the cringe factor of paying extra and participating in the charade that you are lashing out on the good stuff.
Tap. Sweet nose: corn and sugar. OK flavor: there are actually some decent German hops hiding close to the finish. Better than most of the other InBev and BMC offerings, but nothing spectacular.

Bottle, Draft. Obviously has a high class image.  Its not as premium in Europe from what I hear.  Anyways I really liked this beer at one time but after experiencing more beers theres a lot better for cheaper.  Nice Alc content
355 ml bottle.  Pours a bright golden yellow with a billowing white head.  Excellent lacing.  Sweet nose with a touch of skunking.  Light semi-sweet body with a tart finish.

(Bottle) Pale yellow color and small head. Strong aroma of hops, like cereal. Very hoppy flavor, with some metallic parts. Still, very drinkeable and refreshing, one of the best pale lagers on the market.

pale, sparkling, clear, rocky head, tan foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, full body, thick feel, slick feel, average carbonation, lively, long finish. I hate the taste. If has a required taste and it depends on the person’s tongue.
A very classy, fairly hoppy belgian lager with a decent sized head.  Great for special occasions.

On tap at TGI Fridays.  Arrived at the table a crystal clear gold with a thin, sudsy white head that was gone after a few sips.  Light, indistinct aroma.  Some decent hops in the flavor with a dose of light bitterness at the finish.  Medium bodied.  Better than the BMC offerings on the menu.

Grainy and sweet.  A good amount of sourness.  Balanced by a fair amounf of hops.  Not an enticing, enjoyable hop character though.  Full body; much fuller than other pale lagers.  Decent beer for the style.  Far better and more complex than the average, but still not actually a beer I like.
Well most popular belgium beer. But one of the worst. Acidy, empty bodied, claasical pale lagr even hops are not bitterness. My worst at my holiday at Belgium.
Tap in Antwerp: Golden looks sligtly sweet and some bitter aftertaste, not my favorite.
bottle.  This beer is down right assulting.  strange fruit and bubble gum.  very sweet and strange balance.

Definitely has that touch of "skunk" associated with pilners. crisp and clean on the palate. Hint of spiciness. Nice bite to it. not bad to knock back a few. there are better. i wouldn’t go spending big import prices for this one. all-in-all, good session brew, but it won’t knock your socks off
just an ok sesson beer. not very complex, but very palatable. slight sour on the mouthfeel, slight hop on the finish

This is the best of the "big name brews", but that doesn’t say too much.  Pours a large head that disapates pretty quickly and a really mild nose, it has a fairly bitter hoppy taste and is pretty light bodied with a mild bitter finish.
It’s an acceptable beer that really beats the crap out of other beers in it’s catagory.
a pretty refreshing smooth beer that doesnt excite me nor disgust me and thus is too pricey for something that is just ok.
Light golden brown color with lots of carbonation and a Light head.  Very smooth and easy on the palate.  Distinct hoppy notes, but not over powering.  Overall, a good refreshing pale lager.

On tap, and poured into a shaker.  This pale lager poured the typical clear, golden color, with a huge amount of dancing carbonation bubbles running up the sides of the glass.  A very thin, white fizzy head quickly faded away.  The aroma of this beer was sweet malts and some surprisingly strong (for a pale lager) hop notes.  The flavor was much the same.  Sweet maltiness followed by a nice noble hop presence.  One of the better pale lagers that I have sampled.
Draft at Rick’s Sports Bar. Typical golden lager color. Nice and easy drink, nothing really stands out with this beer. Had this after drinking 4 or 5 Hop Devils, so it calmed my taste buds down.

Was in a bar to hear some music last night. Didn’t particularly like the choices of beers so I tried a SA for the first time. I thought it was a pretty nice refreshing beer. Slightly hoppy with a noticeable amount of yeast. Decent carbonation pretty good finish. I enjoyed it quit a bit
Very harsh carbonation. Very light golden colour, slightly hoppy/bitter finish. Nothing special but from time to time I enjoy one on a patio.
Clear golden color with a decent creamy head. Fresh, hoppy taste. Lots of carbonation. A bit of an alcohol finish.
Skunky malty aroma.  Bubbly white head with clear golden body.  Flavor is crisp and sweetish with a light maltiness.  Lightly bitter finish.  Mild carbonation.  Ok overall.

A beer that seperates itself from other pale lagers, now i realize that isn’t saying much.  In my limited experience with macrobrews (and beer in general) this is at the very least a step above pale lagers like miller and bud.  This is a beer you can drink with your buddies, and not risk offending any tastebuds.

Pours a perfect head, perfect gold color , it came with the special glass with the proper instructions to pouring , great hoppy balance, if it were not so over priced this beer would be a number one contender.
Bottled, clear color, malty very light nose, porous quickly diminishing head. Taste how w pale lager can taste, the crisp malty flavour is appreciated

old rating:
6/3/6/3/12 - 3.0 (Bahrain on tap).

new rating: (Outback in Hong Kong on-tap).

pour clear yellow with large white head that disapates quickly, lots of carbination, and okay loacing.

smell is grass, sweet,  and pear.

taste is watery, sweet, corn, and some malts in the back.

overall ive always liked this beer, nothing special about it just always seems to hit the spot.
a clean tasting light colored lager with a little head. fills the glass nicely and goes down smooth. could be alot worse, could be alot better, worth a try
A clean-tasting, crisp pale lager.  When searching for something in this genre, you could do a lot worse.
bottle- very sweet, sugary, adjunct flavor that is pretty crisp and dry. Hardly full flavored. Not good.
A Light and crisp beer Pale in color with bit of citrus and light hops A good beer
Bottle at RF07 - House Of Beer Tent. Clear yellow  - white head. A classic pale lager. Light in all ways. Crisp citrus hoppy, light malty, light sweetness. High drinkability.
another beer i can really enjoy everytime i have one.  finding a good beer to have around is a great thing.

From bottle. Musty aroma. Clear yellow in appearance with a thin white head. Crisp lager, wheat and a little honey in there for sweetness. Thin palette but refreshing. Actually quite enjoyed drinking it for a change.

Tap and Bottle. Poured from bottle a medium yellow color, with strong carbonation. Bitter and sweet flavors, with the sweetness winning out. Maybe too carbonated from the bottle. Lots of grain, sweetness, and a little hops. Didn’t have much aroma. Strong aftertaste much like the flavor of the beer itself.

On tap, seemed skunky, flavor was off, and was flat. I returned it for a Bass.

little bit of a skunked aroma, flavor was good and consistent throughout.
Have to agree with another reviewer about the beer being better as it warms.
Overall better than average lager.
Good beer with steak.

This is a pleasant beer to drink after work when visiting the pub with friends.  The aroma is mild and malty, and not too strong.  It pours a nice golden colour with a fair sized white head and looks like a beer should.  It is very smooth to the tongue and goes down nicely.  It has a mild taste that makes this a very easy beer to drink.

This beer is light, light, light.  Still better then the mass marketed domestic crap.  But not by much.  There is a little bit of bite that adds to the flavor but that is about all that is good about this beer.  NEXT!
ok, well how can you be a regular member of this site and not have a rating for stella. Ok, now lets never speak of it again.

Tap and Bottle...better on tap. Pours a decent bright yellow with a white full head...not much staying power. aroma, little on a grainy side, taste crisp and clean with a slight grain start and a little hop bite at end...easy to drink. Nothing to special for this beer...to me a "Light" beer Beligum style...riding a nice wave of being "in" right now. If poured with a little care and in own glass, it does show well...a nice transition beer for someone who only drinks the corporate big 3 beers.

Thin almost straw color with a diminishing head. Not as bitter or heavy as a belgian although i would regard it as a light belgian. Great with a slice of lemon to bring some of the hidden spices to the palate.

12 oz bottle pours a clear yellow with a white head.  Nose is very grainy.  Hay some malt, but not skunked.  Lightly malted flavors a little bit of fruit but a lot of grain.  All i’m tasting is old grain as i continue.  no more of this.

Appearance: Typical yellow of industrial pale lager beers. Medium head, white color, low density, persistent.
Aroma: Malty, medium hoppy and cereals. Like any commons pale lagers. Slight tone of citric fruits, such as apples and pears.
Flavor: Similar to the aroma. Some touches of herbs and flowers. Medium dry finish, persistent and metallic.
Palate: Light body, watery texture. Low carbonation.
Very Mediocre.
(sorry for my english)

A cloudy light yellow with tiny sediments floating throughout.  White and lacy head which slowly dissipated after a few minutes and left the true defintion of "belgian lace"  Initial tase of flowery bitters with a bit of a sweet tea background.  Aftertaste much like that of vomit.  Not a horrible beer, just wish I hadnt bought it in a 12 pack.

A clear, but darker gold-yellow color with an average-sized, bubbly, white head; some retention.  A deep aroma of grainy and grassy hops; seemed like winterish scents.  A big bitter-sour taste with a good bubbly feel and a full texture with decent carbonation and fizz.  Mostly wet, but with some dry after-effects.  A pretty good beer for one so widely distributed.  Stella!!
Clear yellow color. White firm head. Aroma is hoppy, citrus with some grass. Flavor is pleasently hoppy for a pale lager. A nice refreshing lager.
xxx I dont see what people like about this beer, i know so many people who love it and i just dont get it.

Partial to Stella in times of mass drinking, I figured it deserved a rating...lively malt crispiness greets the nostrils as a soft, golden effervesecent lacing that forms strong coral-like branches....smooth, crisp and nondescript taste accompanied by lagerish palete with some bubbliness...to me, a macro with at least a clue of how to present itself...
light gold with med white head pretty generic  pale lager a little more flavor than other macros light creaminess
Not good at all.  My friend said I’d love it, its a great lager.  He was wrong, I hate it.  yellow, no hop flavoring, no aroma

on tap = good,
from a 500ml can = good,
from a skunk causing green bottle = bad.

one of my favs for macro lagers. something i could drink a lot more then i do. id say its a pale lager pushing the boundaries of premium. no real adjucts and seemingly all malt. actually hop flavours in the finish. an all around good lager.
12oz bottle. a boring and slightly skunked lager. you could say you’d pick this over BMC but i don’t think you’re doing much better.
Bottle - At ’Outback’ - nothing special, general Lager from Belguim.  Uniform taste, yellow in color, simple in palate.
A spicy sweetness predominates this summertime beer. Light drinking, good for a cookout.

Found on tap at a local bar. The appearance is simply what other pale lagers strive to be: transparent gold with a lasting white head. The aroma was not overly sweet or bitter, but sadly lacked any real defining character. In relation to other pale lagers this has a similar but all around sweeter taste that is especially noticeable in the aftertaste.
Easy to drink, inoffensive, weak taste, weak bitterness, just plain boring.

...its Stella. 66cl bottle. Pours gold with small white head, aroma hoppy and bittersweet. Actually has some body and tastes malty rather than cardboardy, which puts it a step above most macro lagers. fairly refreshing, pleasant on palate, a little over sweet in the finish. okay.

Grassy hop aroma with underlying sweet light malt. Brassy gold color with a foamy white head. A bit thin bodied. Sharp carbonation bite. Starts with light maltiness, reasonably balanced by grassy hop. FInishes slightly corny and vegy. The finish is bitter, but a pilsener would be better. Though it beats .... out of Bud and friends.

Light golden pour with white head.  Light taste overall, and high carbonation.  Some honey sweet, malt smell.  Similar taste with a light quick bitterness and aftertaste.  Simple and refreshing and easy to drink.

500ml can. Pours a typical gold colour with a surprising amount of head. Aroma is of malts and hops of course, a tad metalic, and uh oh, a little corny. It looks insanely carbonated. Taste is actually decent, more bitter than I thought it would be. It’s actually fairly well balanced with some good sweetness in it. But there is a touch of corn in the aftertaste, thankfully it doesn’t spoil the whole thing. I was prepared to not like this one, but for a trendy beer it still beats the crap out of a lot of other macro’s out there. Probably a decent party beer.
Bottle.Pale yellow.Not a distinctive aroma.Slight hops bitterness,ok texture.Easy to drink.Just ok.
Light crisp lager, faint citrus notes. Not much spicing to the yeast, so it doesn’t hold much belgian character, and lacks anything that gives it much character.

Un color amarillo claro que nunca me ha agrado en una cerveza. Si bien no es totalmente aguada, me gustan con mas cuerpo.
Su popularidad y marketing es mayor que su calidad. aunque no es una cerveza mala, por el mismo precio prefiero otras... paso.
better than some of it’s mainstream uk competitors (fosters, carling, budweiser, carlsberg). that’s not saying much.
Yellow fizzy pale and tasteless. the ever so slight nuance of something slightly Belgian. You casll this beer?

Pours a very pale yellow color with no head to speak of.  Aroma is pretty much non-existent, though perhaps some slightly grassy notes.  Flavor is hoppy, very light kind of fresh grassy, but very pleasant. There is a bit of sour there, however not too pronounced.  Carbonation is mediumish, and mouthfeel is pretty light, but acceptable.
Golden with big white head.Hoppy light feels flat and watery really thin and boring beer.Sour finish.

Judged as a premium American lager (yes, that IS what it’s listed as).  Had on draught at the Garage.  Aroma is sweet malt forward, with a light citrus hop aroma, some bubblegum tones and caramel.  Beer is a clear gold, with a solid white persistant head.  Flavor is very clean light malt followed by an equally clean finish with no residual bitterness.  Flavor has a slight sourness, citrus hop tones and medium bittering.  Body is very light, with medium carbonation feel and no creaminess.  Overall, I enjoyed the interesting citrus notes, but not too much other than that; texture is a bit too light.
I’m surprised that so many people hate being that it’s such a popular beer (not that popularity should have anything to do with taste). I think it’s one of the better "trendy" beers around.
33 cL can. Pours pale yellow with a huge crispy head. Aroma is slight floral hops with a grass note. Flavour is sweetish going into a mild hops bitter finish.

This is One of the most disgusting beers i have ever tasted!!!!!!!!! This is why your average young woman hates beer! Horendously rotten vegetable taste with elements of wet dog and general lager charcter lacking very other little aromas. Taste shockoingly is similar making me want to vomit in the nearest possible bin. Lacks any positive qualities. Carbonation is good but i feel this is just to hide the poor quality of beer. Y on earth is this mass produced Amatures!
Not great, but easily the best of three awful "trendy" beers that are found in american clubs (stella, amstel, heineken).  Drinkable - if cold

Well, it’s the best of the green bottle beers but that’s not saying much.  Better on tap (what isn’t) Pours a clean lager color with decent head and carbonation.  Skunky aroma and flavor because too much light gets through to it, but you can still taste some hops and a mildly refreshing sweetness.  Not bad but far from great.

Ok first bone to pick.
It is advertised as ’reassuringly expensive’ yet wholesales to pubs for about 45p.
Go Figure.
At least it has a bit more going on in it than bud!
Very strong irony almost sulphery theme running through it.
If I had to drink a mass produced lager it would probably be this one....
bottle at home ... I didnt buy it.. drunk perly to rate ... not as bad as expected ... Pale golden yellow ...  very strong lager hop ... very typical laggeryness ... short lived lager bitter.

Eh.  I expected it to be well overrated based on its name, but when I finally checked its score on here, I found it to be scored exactly as I would rate it......middle of the road.  Pour is an almost clear, medium golden color with a small white head and some lacing (I have had varying head form with Stella, from robust to almost non-existant).  Aroma is faint, but reminiscent of sour dough.  Flavor follows suit, with a somewhat subdued hoppiness than lingers for a few moments.  I agree that it opens up a bit as it warms in the glass.  As I stated before...."middle of the road".
Looks brilliant. Tastes not bad. Bready/hoppy aroma and pleasent enough taste.

Bottle to glass. Very pleasant beer. Soft on the palate, pours nice. Packs a lo more flavor as it warms. If you intend on drinking a few i reccomend taking them all out of the fridge at the same time and really taste for what the temperature can do to this very satisfactory brew.
bottle. Not even bothering to make notes. Not out of snobbery, but just because no one is interested.

Rated 1/19/07:  In reality I can sum this up by saying it’s Heineken, Becks, Grolsch, etc....brewed and bottled in Belgium. Rather typical of the European lagers that find their way to our stores. The pour was initially impressive with a fluffy cotton white head, but even that went away as time wore on. This is very drinkable and soft on the palate. Pretty basic and soon forgotten. Average lager.
Bottle.33cl. This a bit bland pale lager, but ok. Not much of an aroma to speak of here, just a slight tinge of malt. a little sweet and cloying when it  is warmed.

Ha, happened across a bottle of this. Yellow with moderate amount of head. Lightly malty, doughy aroma with light spicy aromatic hops. Ragged hoppiness over a wan, lightly malty body with hints of whiskey and corn (???). Alcohol exudes pretty roughly over the flavor and finish.

Surprising alright, i was expecting to hate it, the taste isnt too bad, i was expecting something very offensive, but was actually decent.  really light and a thin foamy white head that disolves quickly. meh.  i would drink it if it was all that was left.
I didn’t find much going on here. Run of the mill for me. It’s a bad beer with a good name.

Bottle at Maggiano’s.  Clear golden with a foamy white head.  Aroma is dry malt and sweet grain.  Taste pretty much mirrors the aroma with a hint of hoppiness thrown in at the finish.  Not bad, but there is so much better out there.
I do not like pils beers and this one is no exception. Not much taste. Not a pils i recommend
Nothing but Begian Budweiser.  Awfull taste. Real crap. Nothing at all to this beer.
Enjoyed draught at Philips Arena in Atlanta during Roger Waters concert. tonight  Your basic lager.  A good session beer.
This is just a classic, overall good lager with a nip of pear and a smooth, dry finish.

Bottle and draft. Classic European lager appearance: thin and clear, pale yellow straw color. Head is smallish and lasting with good lacing. Aroma is also typical: rubber, skunk, corn and slight honey-perfume.  Taste is faintly similar, and mostly dry. This is really about the same as most of the offerings in the style, but seems to have been marketed well.

Pretty good barbecue fare, I suppose. I’d not had Stella in quite some time and it went down easy on a late spring evening, its crispness and mild spice masking themselves as personality. It’s pretty easy to be a curmudgeon about this beer, but Belgian blandness is better than some.
Love this beer. One of my favourites for sure. Nothing makes me happier than sitting down and relaxing with a stella

I usually never drink lagers, but there was very little choice on the train with my meal. I can’t say that it was bad, but it didn’t have much taste and certainly didn’t take me where I wanted to go. Fortunately, however, the train did.
On tap.  Ugh.  Very disappointing.  Thought I was drinking an old Bud Light.  Thin and flat, no body.  Sour.  Oh well, at least I gave it a try.

Free 12oz. from Shawn.  This was a decent sipper from the bottle while I was cooking on an 80 degree May evening.  Tastes like smooth macro beer and has the enjoyable metallic hop flavor.    Not bad + not worth the price

Lys gul øl med ingen skum.

Ligner langt væk en pilsner, men har noget mere humle. Humlen der er brugt er dog ikke særlig spændende. Mere sødlig en en danske pilsner.

Tør eftersmag.

Duften er let humlet - let sødlig.

Ok backup øl, hvis alt andet slår fejl....

Pours a pale gold with a thin head and nice lace - thin hoppy aroma. Tastes of sweet lagered cereal malt, a big of honey-lager, and slightly citrus-like hops - grapefruit for a moment, there. Cereal & hop aftertaste, thin slightly creamy body with decent carb. This is my backup-beer if the only other beer on-tap is sickly-sweet local macro junk. Not bad, ultimately unremarkable.
a really plain, clean, crisp pale lager. Better than most, but nothing really stands out or sets it too far apart.

I very much enjoy this beer. It’s very very light and goes great with any kind of meal in my opinion. It’s not a really amazing brew but it’s just so mild and smooth I find it becoming a reliable selection for any night.
meh! this beer was very dissapointing.  no smell or significant flavor. ill pass on this one every time. had a lot of hype too

Prominent "dough" note, but not offensive.  Can be poured into a nice head, appearance is a clear, golden yellow.  Clean and crisp, its flavor is not complex, but not neccessarily a bad thing.  Alcohol of 5.2% masked well.  A refreshing and easy to drink lager.

Pours a golden yellow with a fairly thin white head. It has a fresh aroma of very pungent hops and yeasty grain. The taste is of dry, grassy malt balanced with lots of bitter hops. It’s not the best beer in the world, but it’s one of the better macro-lagers.
12 oz bollte.  Little above average pale lager.  Golden, white head, etc.  Little aroma or flavor.  Lawn mower beer at best.
Tastes okay, especially for a green bolttle beer. Pours a light gold color with a nice head. Not much of an aroma to it and simple tasting.
On tap.  Wasn’t impressed.  Pale yellow with white head.  Little aroma.  Flavor was a little more interesting than a typical macro.  For the price you might as well drink bud.
Aroma is sweet doughy, grainy malt and subtle herbally hops with a faint yeasty background. Flavor is grainy malt which is a little corny plus grassy hop bitterness and some doughiness.
Bottle and Can. Good Lager beer, weak aroma and golden appearance. A bitter flavor at finish, good when serve cold.

What can someone say about one of the most popular beers in the world?  Well, on a hot day in a cold bottle in goes down pretty darn easy: that is about all.  There is truly nothing wrong with this beer, it is light and refreshing and quite easy to drink.  But this isn’t much that is right about this beer either.  The aroma & appearance are pale, and the flavor is weak.  I am not going to bash the ’Inbev’ people for aggresively marketing another truly bland beer, for I am sure that lots of people love walking into a pub and seeing this on tap.  I am just not one of them.  There are lots of great beers from Belgium, this just isn’t one of them.

Aroma of light crispness, some light malt, faint faint belgian golden smell? A pale gold color with a head that goes away right away. Flavor is crisp and refreshing. I got a little spiciness, but that might just have been skunkiness from the green bottle. Not bad, but not superior. Better than MBC
Tap at Ølmolevitten Århus. Must be the simplest belgian. Very thin taste of hops and hay. The belgian Budweiser.. Nice white head I must say. Decent but boring.

A rather ordinary belgian.  In Texas it is labeled a Malt Liquor....certainly the best Malt Liquor I have ever had....blows OE or Colt 45 right out of the water...but as a belgian lager it is drinkable but not worth the price...get a good microbrew or a bottle of Chimay instead.

On tap at Mile Square in Hoboken.  They don’t call it Belgian Bud for nothing.  I’m sure this is the shame of Belgium.  It is funny to see people drinking it, thinking that they are worldly and knowledgeable about beer.

This beer is... overrated. The fact it comes from Belgium doesn’t mean it’s great. It’s even not good. It’s just bad but not so much. I simply have shivers when I think about drinking such beer. There are much better lagers. And with no doubt - muuuuch better Belgian beers
this tastes like natty but slightly stronger and skunkier... only very subtle flavors of hops give away that this is a beer at all
what is this stuff?  so light and such little impression left on me.  no distinct flavors or color.  tastes like a red stripe light.
STELLLLLAAAAA... such a following for such a plain jane...  I’ve had better... lots of carbonation I think...
Bottle, 33 cl. Pale, clear golden, small foamy white head. Weak malt aroma, some light floral hops. Light in body, but with a decent mouthfeel. Starts with a stale sweetness, ends in a bitter finish.
Bottle. Has a cool name and nice look and label. But unfortunately a bland, watery taste.

in bottle, 330 ml.,
An aroma hoppy, but with a fund of flour, and something of vinegar. Golden pale color, very frothy. It is very gaseous, and with a thin body. Has a bitter flavor in palate, but ultimately it is a little a vinegar. In general, I can say that it is something better than the rest of the Chilean lager.

Not a good beer, but for some reason it looks like it should be. Strange, watery taste. It isn’t worth spending money on this when you have domestic pale lagers that are about the same. Way too expensive.
Draught. Pours a clear yellow with a steady white head. Not much in the nose. Flavor is all corn with an unpleasant palate.

This is a very worthy Pale lager. As others agree the rating doesnt deserve its true worth. Alot of pale lagers are horrendous, Stella happens to be a very crisp, smooth and refreshing pale lager with a good balance of hop and malt presence. It is on the expensive side but for those who havent tried it, its definitely a beer to try.

Crisp!  Great beer for those that are experienced with beer and those that are not.  Unfortunatly, though it is expensive in most places it is worth the treat for a clean lager, with a clean finish, and a bright body.  I am surprised of the low rating but it surely is worth a try and revisit if you love beer.
hey for a lager it’s damn good! grassy with really nice carbonation. probably too expensive. a bit complex (not too much going on here) a great beer when you don’t feel like it.good body.
One of my favortie lagers. I’m surprised at the (relatively) low score here - I think it’s because lagers in general score badly at ratebeer.
Surprisingly good lager! Nice hop presence, good malt flavours. Buiscuitty, toasty, hints of lemon. Pleasant mouthfeel. Notes of honey, tee in the finish? Nice bitter finish.

Pours yellow like any macro.  Aroma isn’t bad, nothing great, nothing offensive.  Nice crisp lager, perfect for a session, no really offensive tastes here.  Moutfeel is decent and you can feel the bitterness. I have had it many a time, and will probably continue it as a session beer every once in a while.

Not bad at the going away luncheon for a few coworkers.  Went down smoothly wtih the JackD burger.  Some might say they should give this stuff away, yet I found my first stella a bit sweet on the palate but satisfing for lunch.  Anyway the price was right(2.50) for the 22oz glass. Bert is probably shaking his head now while reading this one. Hah!
330ml bottle. light gold colour, moderate head. smells like malt and sweetness. tastes pretty much thesame. not a bad beer, i drink it quite often but only out of necessity

As far as pale lagers go, this stuff isn’t that bad. It’s got those saaz hops going for it, I guess. But honestly, what true beer drinker likes pale lagers? Unlike the American macro pale lagers, this one actually taste like beer, with a decnt sweet, malt presence and some mild hops, but if your looking for any complexity at all, steer clear of this, and any other pale lager.

Crystal clear golden pour with a nice foamy white head.  The aroma was malted sugary sweetness with maybe something that might be a distant relative of a hop.  The flavor was overwhelmingly sweet with hardly and hop presence to balance it out.  Yet somehow it still managed to finish clean.  A decent example of the style.

A decent beer. Golden and transparent, with a moderate head. Aroma is decidedly beery. Taste is malty, no bitterness, no complexity. Not spectacular, but smooth and drinkable, a nice accompaniment for dinner, lively conversation, or a sports event on TV.

The skunk smell  was overly strong and permeated the entire room. I like a little skunkiness, but this was way too much. It was nicely hopped, but not terribly complex. A skunky bitterness lasted for a while, which I didn’t like.
Quite heavy, but good taste, and good head on a well poured pint. Known as the "wife-beater" round this way, because after several of these, you go home and start throwing things.

Very good marketing makes this seem like an exceptionally fine beer.  Unfortunately, this is much in the way of budweiser and company.  However, there are some definite hops and malt.  So it is a real step up while retaining the inoffensive attributes of the major brands.
light golden colour, bubbly head, quite good lacing, aroma and flavour multimanufactured pop commercial beer in 100%, maube some mead in teh background, poor, no thanX

First beer on tap ever. Love me stella. A fine beer. a connoisseur of beers. I always imagine rich french nobles drinking this with there big fake puffy white hair and there frilly blouses with there pinky fingers extended outward. wee wee!
Draft: nice gold color with foamy white head.  lightly sweet aroma.  Moderately bitter with a bit of sweetness.  Very light on the tongue and smooth.  But also quite plain.
gold blond coloured body with a white head a spicy hoppy aroma a spicy hoppy sweet taste with a bitter finish
Pours light yellow with a moderate head. Decent, but watery mouth feel. Refreshing. Smells a bit of citrus, but had a light musky smell akin to mushrooms... Odd.

I was expecting a lot worse. This better than any American pale lager I’ve had which isn’t saying much. Pour was a clear gold with no head. Not much aroma. Crisp fizzy pale lager taste. Not much else.

I don’t like giving bad reviews to Belgian beers, but I gotta do what I gotta do.  I liken this beer’s appearance to urine, and the smell isn’t that far off, either.  The flavor was largely lacking, and the duisappointment level was high.  Stay clear of this one.

Keg dispense. Straw coloured with a strong white head. Indifferent aroma with a chemical edge. A lot of carbonation but less flavour, some hops were detected but not much else. Can cause a shocking hangover even when drunk in moderate amounts.

Aroma of fresh road kill skunk with its piss sack still swaying in the breeze. So why did I give the aroma a three?? Skunk aroma reminds me of spring time. The flavor however is not too shabby. A tart citrus with a light hop finish.

On tap at Gato Nero - came a lovely shade of urine, bright white head, smallish.  Aroma of sweet malt, very light hops and corn - inoffensive, but certainly not adventurous.  Taste very much the same, easy to drink, but nothing to ponder - also, becomes sickly sweet as it warms.  I’d take this over Heineken or most domestic macros (not saying much), but not much else.  Pleasant, inoffensive, boring.

This beer was highly recommended by several other drinkers during a night out and I guess it just demonstrates how different my tastes are from the ’mainstream’, because I did not care for it at all.  It smelled and tasted skunky and had no body to it.  I will probably not drink it again.
Clear yellow with an average head. A little hoppy on the nose and palate. Not much else going on here really.

12oz bottle into a pint glass. Pours a golden straw color with a thick white head. Stays around for a while and actually leaves decent lacing on the glass. Smells of malt and citrus. Medium carbonation and mouthfeel. Tastes of malt, citrus and dish soap. No bitter kick, finishes clean. Could easily drink this at a bar-b-q or something similar instead of BMC. Still like Heineken a bit better though.

Another beer from a Best of Belgium 18-pack.  I sort of hope that this is actually not one of the country’s best.  Pale amber color with a fine white head.  Slightly skunky aroma with definite hop character.  Taste is okay.  A lot like a pale ale.
Slight floral aroma. Light malty flavors. Mouth texture is smooth and a tad creamy. Not bad but nothing special.
Bottle. Pale Golden colour with large creamy head. Malty aroma and taste. Bitter aftertaste.

Tasted 15/03/2007. 330ml bottle, shared with 4 others at Island Bay. Pale gold, firmish white head. Huge hop noble aroma, relative to Amstel Light and a Fosters.  A little grainy sweetness. Fairly balanced in the mouth, tending towards the noble hop flavour.  Lingering bitterness, medium-low intensity, slightly herbal.  Not quite as good as it can be when fresh. I can drink this now and then.
Skunky nose. Pours the typical wheat color with a smell white bubbly head. Lots of yeast in the taste. Tastes kind of like bread. Clean finish. Just ok.

Decent beer, probably a great beer considering it’s MASS produced at a huge rate for the world market.  Smells like beer, nothing special to the nose.  Nice white head you’d expect from such a carbonated beer.  Not a bad beer, very drinkable, think of it as a replacement for Rolling Rock drinkers, a step up.  I find it to be a good beer with most foods, that’s how I like it best.  Mouthfeel is it’s weakest point.  Overall drinkable, everyone should have one with a bag of chips, a pepper/pickle tray, cheese, and sausage balls.  Just a good palate cleaner.
This has become my default pub beer simply because I can’t drink more than one guinness at a sitting. It has a pleasant, smooth, clean, crisp taste, and no aftertaste which I can discern.
cereal, floral, skunky, golden, clear, white foam, frothy, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, light body, oily feel, lively, bitter, Not bad, but thoght it was a little strong at the end
Lite malt aroma.  Golden with a lasting head, which was nice for this style.  Full body with mild sweet & lite hops end.  Bit surprised with the bitter after-taste.
A common Belgian lager, and however spread worldwide, it is not the best Belgian pilsner beer.
Large white creamy head, diminishing rapidly to some lace, very little aroma.  Very clear yellow lager.  It’s a so-so beer and I really don’t think it is in the same category as other belgians.

Wow, this is ’the best belgian beer", huh? Hmmm. It’s not bad, but I don’t think ’sour, pale lager’ when I think great Belgian beers. My friend Megan loves it--and her opinion is one of the best thing Stella has going for it ;)

It is what it is. This beer is not going to change the world, but it will quietly introduce the unsuspecting public to a more Belgium flavor profile.
