Becoming the next over priced/rated import lager move over Heineken/Corona,Interbrew is launching is brand globaly. Better than Jupiler,Mae-Pils,and most large scale lagers.But even so, it's very unsatisfying.Deep golden in color with a small white head.Skunky hop aroma.Sweet and bitter finish.
I really like this stuff cold. As it happens, this is the only beer from belgium i've ever tried, i hear there are some great others though. Not too filling and a great beer to kick back with.
Nice beer- needs a lemon peel in it to soften the taste.....................
Very inconsistent on draught, more so than other lagers, sometimes it can be really awful. Also, its pretty good in bottles, not in cans however.
Golden color with a crystal clean appearance. High bubbly and foamy head, some lace. Aroma of Saaz hops with a slightly sweet smell. Very smooth on tap.

RERATE 11/12/03: Golden body, medium white head receding, mild Saaz nose. This is Heineken without the off-flavors and with slightly more assertive hops. While it is no Budvar or Prima Pils, it is nonetheless a decent, drinkable mainstream pilsner.
Another typical belgian pils. Maybe a little bit better than Jupiler, but not special.
There are other, better pilsener, but this one is really good in hard places

After repeatedly telling the waitress I wanted the "stout" she was conviced I wanted a "Stella." Not surprising considering the high concentration of yuppies in that neighborhood. Anyway, the beer could have been worse, but I was not pleasently surpirsed either.  Slighter richer in flavor than your american standard, but nothing too speical.  They had it on tap.
Not at all what I had expected. Flavor started out bitter and skunky and turned to bland by the end of the pint. Even so, it still beats the heck out of American mega-pilsners.
Didn't impress me at all.  Everything was shy in this beer.  The malts, the hops?  Not much taste.

This stuff is pretty far removed from anything else from Belgium.  I got ripped off, I was in this pub in Chicago on the one free night that I had on a business trip.  Didn't have time to make it over to Goose Creek before it closed, so I stopped in some random bar and had everything that they had on tap that I hadn't had before.  It wasn't a very good experience, and the bartender told me that this was a Belgian Ale.  Uhh, no.  It did have an okay smell, albeit a bit skunky.  Not much else nice to say, it was pretty bland.  Are there any good pilsners out there??

Clear,golden. Better then average head and lace. Nose is a bit skunky with a tad of flowery hops. Decent body,oxidized to all hell. Some ok malt flavors,smooth,drinkable. Will I ever buy it again? Nope.

Bottled.  Big disappearing head, clear light golden color.  Nose slightly hoppy, pleasant, weak.  Flavor a bit bitter given that there is little malt to counterbalance it, and that the body is pretty thin.  Better than most cheap American swill, but not by much; certainly goes to show that not all Belgian beer deserves to find a place on the American market.

An acquired taste for many palates. The abrasive flavour can be off-putting to new takers. Most drinkers graduate to this tipple from nasty Carling. One of the few beers in my experience that tastes better from a can than from draught. Can't beat the real stuff from Belgium though!
It's pretty good, but much lighter on the hops than most pilseners..........
It's okay, but after the first pint you start to wish you hadn't started. After a number more you wish you weren't born.
A light and tasty Pilsner, a nice offering from Interbrew.  Bubbly and crisp, and served with the foil on the bottle like champagne.  Mm-mm.
Not bad for a Pilsner. First sip actually pretty good, but it got blander the closer I got to the bottom of the glass.
Vaguely skunky megaeuropils.  Served on draft so being lightstruck is not an excuse.  Marginally better than Heineken I'd say, but that isn't really much of a compliment.
I guess I just dont like Pilsners, I would only put this half a notch above Bud.

Not-quite hazy yellow/amber body with a fast moving head.  Light flowery aroma, crisp, clean, and ends slightly bitter.  Old rating:  I tried to find a bottle without dust, or under a light or covered in slime, but it tasted horribly lightstruck.  Eh.  It beats the hell out of about 90% of the beer drank in America, but as you all know, that ain’t saying much.

Sold as a premium brand here in the U.K., but all that means is it costs more and is strong. To the average U.K. drinker 4.5% abv is strong. Aroma and flavour is muted although hints of hop are apparent. The head lasts about a nanosecond. Overall the beer is probably worth of the "premium" tag as it is far superior to any English lagers. It has a soft smooth palate and aftertaste and doesnt have the nasty aftertaste of many other stronger lagers that just seem to have a couple of bags of brewing sugar thrown in to boost the alcohol.

Good beer for the money... at least here in Western Canada ...
I moved up to here from the Eastern U.S. and never was willing to pay what was being charged for it in Pennsylvania.
It seems to be a beer of choice here, cheap cheap and cheap again .
reminds me of Heineken etcetra yet not as caustic.
Ubiquitously popular, relatively well-hopped but somewhat grainy and overly gassy lager. There are worse out there.
A good, crisp lager.  The drink of choice in most, city center pubs.  Enjoyable at any time.
Smells hoppy. Golden. Bitter. Average.......................................
Yuck.  Smells rank, tastes rank.  Very watery.  Nothing on the palate.......

Stella Artois is one of the best lagers on the market. On draught the pint usually has no head, has a clean taste and goes down easy. Bottled Stella comes in green bottles, and tastes clean also, doesn’t taste at all skunky. Acceptable in cans. You aren’t going to be taken aback with it, but if you are looking for lager you can’t do much better.

i used to think this was the best. there are heaps better european pilsners out there. the imported stuff in bottles, is a bit watery, and the stuff on tap, in Australia, (which is brewed by CUB) is very fruity, and gives you a headache.
This is alright in a bottle, but it really shines on tap. Full of flavour with a great almost caramal malty nis palate with a great clensing finish.
Good flavor. Great beer for a chick.........................................

The pub drinkers choice!  Lacks the depth of flavour that you would expect from the alcohol content.  A beer that is best consumed when quantity of beer drunk is more an issue than the quality of the beer drunk.
A heavier Pilsner.  Goes down smooth, no aftertaste.........................
Smooth and clean.  A good one for a quiet time.  One of the better lagers...
I like this beer. Nice flavour and palate...................................
Nice and smooth. Not much to dislike about this beer........................
damned europeans and there green bottles! This is slightly drinkable ass in a glass

This is a great one if you plan on drinking mass quantities, but just as good for a quiet night in.  Goes down easy, with a smooth flavor and no aftertaste. 5/3/6/3/10  

  You need to drink this fresh and on-tap.  It makes a WORLD of difference.  The bottles here in the states are crap.

 RERATE: (12-27-06 bottle) Golden pour, thin white soapy head.  Aroma is slightly sweet.  Smells a touch better than bud or miller.  Flavor is slightly sweet with the usual corn flavor of adjuncts.  Not so good, but I do remember it being a bit better on tap.
Very smooth lager. Quite drinkable, even in excessive amounts. .............
Very drinkable especially if you are in the mood for many rather than few...
great beer.  a little expensive..but worth it!  one of my favorites. .......
Like its price for the quality. Price is no problem if you really like a great beer.
Among commercial pilseners from giant breweries, this is one of the best. Very drinkable.

Very nice when the weather is hot and the beer is cold.
Good colour, and goes down the throat very easily.
I love Stella Artois. Simple as that. The only thing wrong with it, is that it smells of Burps!!
This stuff is nasty, i can say nothing good about it. I've never liked lager and this horrifying experience reminded me why
A really good beer. Well worth the price....................................

Nice smooth light brew. If it were cheap and accesible I would drink it regularly. Orig rate 2/7/02...3.3. Clear pale straw to gold. Aroma is grainy and of corn. Light to medium bodied with little liveliness and mostly malt and corn flavors. Middle and finish are clean with moderate bitterness. Finish is slightly sweet but balanced and subtle.  I can’t say I would crave this beers flavor.
Nice refreshing pilsener. Light but tasty hops..............................
Old man let me taste his.  Man it was skunky... I think the bottle I tried was rowed in a boat to Canada...

Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is clear medium yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (grain), moderately hoppy (herbs), light note of solvent. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately bitter, slightly husky, slightly unclean. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Definitely pils-level bitterness in the finish, but just barely clean enough to be drinkable.  Smells and tastes a bit industrial.
Draught: Pale Yellow, and a little fizzy.  A lighter Belgian beer.  Nice taste and quite refreshing. Missing some of that lager after-tatse.
smooth and refreshingly clear, you can't drink this in moderation. To be savoured.

Not a bad lager w. the expected green bottle skunkiness. I can handle a little skunkiness and this was OK. A little richer and a bit sweeter than say standard German macrobrew lager like Becks. Its better on draught but this rating is based on the bottled version.
Nice light pilsener, but nothing really special. Slight metallic tang lowered the rating.
i dont mind it. got a gay fucken name but...................................
nice beer,easy drinking,belgium lawn mower beer,crisp,slight maltiness,budweiser of belgium

Off tap at a reputed bar in Pasadena, CA. A glorified Budweiser without the tailing hoppiness. Easy-drinking transitional beer that lacks much character. I was expecting more from this oldie-but-newbie import. But then again, this is a pils. Mild-mannered palate that changes very little from start to finish. Even tempered through and through. Good for a glass and then off the the ales...

Golden and clear as a bell with bleached-white frothy head. Effervescent, light, clean, delicate, and only mildly hoppy... with some aroma in the finish. Detected a little "metallic" off flavor, but that could be from the cap. Nicely balanced and clean tasting, but not a whole lot of character. Although, it was surprisingly rich. Not bad. Not great.
I'm a fan of this beer rather than some of the other lager imports, nice taste fuller body would be nice though. A fan and will drink again
nice taste going in, quite good in my opinion but falls short to be one of my fav pils...
Classic beer, got to love it really, drunk by everyone all over the globe!..

ReRate#2, Just had a fresh one out of carton, yummy light honeyoil maltiness, soft head is pillowing banana flavoured froth that lasts well in the big Stella glass. Debloodylicious even at $62Aussie bleeders a carton, 24 x330mls plus bonus 4 500mls Stella glasses. Good with mates and darts too.
same style as heineken but without as bad aroma. the after taste is the same. not a better you want to drink in quatity

A downright rude aftertaste, you almost feel violated. Can cause severe sickness and chronic beer arse. A particular favourite of a turkish friend of mine, he says that the rank aftertaste masks the dirty flavour of his rotten kebab. Only resort to this scally drink if you find yourself in the tragic situation all lager drinkers fear, where the only other taps on the bar serve bitter or stout. Even in these dire circumstances you should drink quickly and leave wearing your Berghaus jacket and Rockports, our kid.

Immediate and full skunkiness.  Pale, weak body.  Would rate appearance only 1 but there is actually a decent meringue head usually seen on fuller beers.  Thin, watery palate and flavor.  Skunkiness remains throughout.  Undesirable.
Those people can really brew a good beer....................................
A better than average mass-produced pilsner.................................

A very pleasant pils. Not the type of beer one typically associates with Belgium.  For a mass produced  beer this is very good, but there are some better microbrew pilsners available. try the stoudts or victory prima pils.
Pours gold with white crown .  Light sweeta roma , not to deep .  Very average lager , plenty of carbonation and sweet malt .
very smooth on the palate. very good beer on tap. not to strong like the other belgium beers out there
This is a very good lager and great for quencing thirst and with that nice hot pizza : ) I grab this one every now and then IF I WANT A LAGER that is.
One of the best mass market beers there is.  Beware of stuff that is brewed under license in UK or other countries they have a more bland taste and are no match for the real thing brewed in Belgium
The best French beer is brewed in Belgium...................................
Quite drinkable - although I have to say I think it has got worse over the past three years.
Very drinkable beer, golden color, quite hoppy, spicy aftertaste, light in body, crisp & clean, nice balance, nice pilsener
Perhaps, one of the best commercial beers around!...........................
A bland, thin Pilsner.  No real crispness or hoppiness to speak of.  Boring.
A good lager to have if your having more than one.  Many folks drink it with a top, but I think that makes it a bit too sweet.
Passable pilsener.. A bit too syrupy for my taste. Interbrew makes much better stuff such as Leffe or Hoegaarden
this is the best beer I never try. hmmmmmmmmmmm... oh damn i want one right now!
freshing and clean. I good beer to relax and watch a game with the guys.....
Overrated - not too bad, but let down, not too terribly tasty (good or bad).
overated, but intriguing and original flavor, no aftertaste...clean hops....
Almost Mexican tasting in it's malt and near-spicy bitter. Prone to skunk. Not entirely bad for a macro.
Soap and water. Must try to get a fresh batch...............................
Make sure this is cold when you drink it.  If it is, you will find it rather smooth with a little bitterness; not bad.  If it's warm, watch out! Soap and water.
